story:
Heavy rainfall ravaged parts of Serbia and Bosnia-Herzegovina this week, resulting in the worst flooding the countries have seen in 120 years, Reuters reports. 

A massive storm churned river waters and triggered landslides across some of the Balkan region, leaving roads and railways underwater. So far, three deaths have been reported, according to Reuters. On Thursday, Serbia and parts of Bosnia-Herzegovina declared a state of emergency, as roughly 100,000 homes were left without power and 400 schools were closed, per Al Jazeera. 

Severe flooding in Bosnia-Herzegovina has forced schools to close and hundreds of people to evacuate their homes. Thousands more were left without power.


Hundreds of homes were cut off or flooded after the Miljacka river, which runs through Sarajevo, broke its banks. Some 3,500 homes in the capital were left without power. Authorities said emergency workers were supplying food and medicines to those who could not leave their homes. 

WE NEED YOUR HELP!


UPDATE: We finished the campaign with 45,00€. I've deposited the money on Red Cross of Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina account.

Thank you,
Haris Tahic

campaign_city: All affected towns, Bosnia and Herzegovina

story:
Hi

I m 27 & live with my parents here in India which is becoming a everyday headache for me.

As most Indian are my mom is also superstitious which is killing me. Being a male I should be mentally strong but stress given by mom everyday is weakening me. I was diagonosed with multiple sclerosis in 2008, I hope most of you would be aware of how it is when you have ms and It becomes more worst when the environment you live in is full of stress. So to get over ms I got two sweet parrots (cockatiels) which was helping me a lot to keep the stress of me but my don't like me happy and mom got into believe that parrots will make my health more bad and would nearly kill me and my stars don't suit birds as pet and she is killing me with it.... she want me to sell them but u guys tell me will you be able to sell of a pet which is more than a child to u ?? Will you be able to do it? I have had these birds since 1year and I m very bonded with them , even the thought of selling them makes me cry. So everyday mom will start taking about this thing about stars and my health which gives me more stress and tears ..... Its been a month and she won't stop talking about it and give me stress and tears. I think she likes me crying and stressing but she can't understand that stressing with ms on is more dangerous. There have not been one day that I been happy whole day... No she won't stop. I m not a guy who can handle stress , my head pain, my legs muscles go stiff due to ms which becomes more worst due to stress she gives. I have tried explaining her that stress is not good for me , showed her Google stories that how stress makes ms more worst but no hell no age won't understand. I tried explaining that you are just a stressful to talk but she won't understand.

You know what when you go and sit Even for 1min with your pets..... all your stress goes away. Even my NeurO doctor when I shared with that I have parrots which I love very much and relaxes my mind.... He was also with me that I would keep them as it will help a lot with ms but my patents 

I work with dad in his business so I don't really don't have a source to save and buy a room separate away from parents..

Please help me out with this guys.. I beg you . its becoming too much for me... Stressing everyday and cry for the thought of going away from my pets , plus due to ms my left eye number is around 4 so I can't really see with this eye. Crying every day is making things more worst for me.

story:
Imagine the scene. It was December 30th 2010 with freezing temperatures and thick snow outside. I was rushing around after four kids and trying to decide what was for dinner. My sister-in-law came round and wanted to cook a curry for friends on New Year’s Day. Well, being busy that day, Lynn suggested blending the spices and including cooking instructions. The curry was a resounding success and Chilli Papas was born.

Chilli Papas was originally born out of adapting my mother's family recipes without oil making them healthier for all the family and has led to the adaptation of other curries through trial and error. 

Since then, Chilli Papas has expanded it's varieties to 11 mixes, is an award winning product and is sold in sixty locations around the UK.

To keep up with demand and expand our range, hand-blending -however satisfying- is not viable so we need to outsource the blending. This may sound boring BUT it will transform Chilli Papas and what we all can achieve. Without this expansion, Chilli Papas will stagnate, lose customers and my aspirations for Chilli Papas won't be met.

What can you do? What can we all achieve together? You can be part of something unique. A Unique product that empowers consumers to eat and cook healthier. We believe Chilli Papas is more than just a product. It is an educational tool. A tool to show that curry can be a healthy option. To be used to feed patients, feed school children and contribute to the recovery of Obesity. We at Chilli Papas are passionate about change, we hope you are too.

We need to raise £5000 to outsource the blending of our spice mixes. Nothing else but it would make a big difference to the future! For your help we have some exciting rewards and benefits. These include a "Wall of Fame", various discounts special offers, home demonstrations (if local to Colchester, Essex)

If for any reason we do not reach our target, all funds raised will still go towards out ultimate goal.

And finally we would ask everyone (whether they are donating or not) to help share our campaign, use the Indiegogo share tools and follow us on our Facebook page! #healthycurry

story:
We have now reached our initial funding target for our first 3 months and to run our first conference. However, in order to make a longer lasting impact on public health and to continue our work to inform and implement healthy decisions we still need donations, which you can now do on our website :) www.PHCUK.org/donate

The Basics

What?

The Public Health Collaboration will be set up as a charity focused on supporting research and investigating pressing public health issues concerning the UK.  On a quarterly basis we will publicly publish reports on these issues alongside coordinated campaigns for change.

Why?

In the UK 25% of adults are obese, the highest prevalence in Europe, and type 2 diabetes has risen by 65% in the past 10 years with no sign of slowing down, both cost the NHS £16 billion a year. The PHC will illuminate the solutions to turn it all around.

How?

Through INDIEGOGO we need to initially raise £5,000 to help set us up as a charity, fund our team to write our first report to be published in April, as well as support our ambitious research and campaign plans to empower the public and medical community.

Either Watch or Read Below

The Background

 My name is Sam Feltham and I'm the director of the PHC.

Some of you may know me from my fitness boot camp business, which I've been running for the past 5 years. From March 2016 I will be closing that business down to fully focus on running the Public Health Collaboration. This may seem like a dramatic and drastic action to take, but desperate times call for desperate measures.

In the past few years of being in the health and fitness industry I've noticed an increasing number of doctors coming out of the wood work to support real food and smart exercise to treat and prevent diseases and conditions, instead of just prescribing drugs and pushing fake food.

Several months ago I started having conversations with many of our founding members below about how we can start creating real change in the UK for improving the health of our nation, which is getting worse year upon year despite all of our best efforts. The one thing that we kept going back to was to collaborate our efforts into one singular organisation to inform the public and empower the medical community on the science and solutions of health. Over a melting pot of ideas we founded the Public Health Collaboration, or the PHC for short. Without further ado I'd like to introduce you to the founding members and advisory board of the PHC...


The Founding Members

Dr. Trudi Deakin
Dietitian

Dr. Aseem Malhotra Cardiologist

Dr. Tamsin Lewis Psychiatrist

Dr. Rangan Chatterjee General Practitioner

Dr. Jen Unwin
Clinical Psychologist

Dr. David Cavan Diabetologist

Dr. Katharine Morrison General Practitioner

Dr. David Unwin
General Practitioner

Dr. Joanne McCormack General Practitioner

Dr. Kailash Chand OBE
Ex-Chair of an NHS Trust

Dr. Ian Lake
General Practitioner

Dr. Ayan Panja
General Practitioner

To find out more about our founding members visit our website @ www.PHCUK.org

The Issues

As previously mentioned in the UK 25% of adults are obese, the highest prevalence in Europe, and type 2 diabetes has risen by 65% in the past 10 years with no sign of slowing down. Together they cost the NHS £16 billion a year and the UK economy at large £47 billion a year.

These perilous percentages and shocking statistics have presented themselves despite the fact that as a population we are closely following the dietary advice that is being recommended to us. Based on the latest National Diet and Nutrition Survey published in 2014 by Public Health England, our total food consumption is on average 383 calories below the recommended, our total fat consumption is just below the recommended 35%, we're just one portion shy of the recommended 5 fruits and vegetables a day, and lastly we're only 1 g over the recommended amount of daily red meat intake.

So it seems that the actual issue here is that we are generally following the advice we've been given, but it's not making us healthier! Arguably, the current advice has got us into our current sticky situation. A complete overhaul is needed for our dietary advice based on the scientific evidence in order to improve our nation's health, and we believe that the PHC is the team for the job but that is only possible with your support.

The Solution

Solving a complex problem such as public health is difficult because there are so many moving parts to take into account. With this complexity often what happens is that lots of money is just thrown at the problem instead of taking a step back and actually thinking about what can be done without spending ridiculous amounts of money to work with the current system in place.

As previously mentioned the current system of dietary advice is working, in as much as the nation is generally following the advice. Unfortunately, it just so happens that the advice being given is making us unhealthy rather than the desired effect of becoming healthy.

With that in mind our solution will be to focus initially on the root cause of the problem by simply improving the healthy eating and weight loss guidelines given by the NHS. Namely the Eatwell plate and simple calorie restriction, that have been used for the past 20 years with no improvements in public health. We will improve these guidelines by publishing our first public report on healthy eating and weight loss guidelines given by the NHS in April 2016. Alongside this we will be running a campaign for change that the government will find hard to ignore with the help of our incredibly influential founding members.

After publishing our first public report and running our campaign for change in April we will continuously campaign until our recommendations are taken seriously. However, at the same time we will write our next report to be published in June, which will be on dietary advice for those living with diabetes. As before we will run another campaign for change that the government will find hard to ignore. We will repeat this process with other pressing health issues concerning the UK every 3 months until improvements are made. The key with creating change at this level is to be consistently persistent, something which we're currently lacking in the UK.

£5,000 doesn't sound like it's enough to change anything on a large scale if you're used to big budgets, but we're in a fortunate position that our founding members are giving their time for free to help write our reports and supporting our campaigns. Also, this initial fundraising is to get our first 3 months fully operational and to run our conference on Saturday 11th June. After that we'll need to raise a minimum of £5,000 every 3 months in order to keep everything going at full speed, so the more we can raise now the better the position we'll be in for the future.

Turning the tide on public health in the UK doesn't require throwing ridiculous amounts of money at the problem. It requires sitting back to reflect on how to redirect the NHS's energy, but we need your support to enable us to do that.


The Funds

At this point you might be asking yourself, so what exactly will you be spending my hard earned money on?

First, to set up as a charity in the UK you need to raise £5,000 and this initial funding will allow us to operate fully for 3 months to publish our first public report and run our conference. If we raise £10,000 we'll be able to fully operate for 6 months, £15,000 means 9 months and £20,000 gives us 12 months at full speed.

Secondly, we will need funding to cover minimal operational costs. As I mentioned previously, I currently run a fitness boot camp business but after 5 years of trying to improve the health of the UK through that business I feel that the only way to create lasting change is by setting up a charity such as this in order to improve guidelines and public health policy. With that in mind, and provided we raise the requisite funds, I will be running this charity full time and closing down my fitness business from late March 2016 to completely focus on improving the health of the UK.

This transition will remove my income, and so one of the expenses we'll have, along with admin and technical costs, is a basic salary. At the beginning I will only be receiving a London Living Wage and will never exceed an average income, as defined by the local authority, in order to stop making the PHC another bloated charity spending too much money on salaries instead of the cause they are fighting for.

Thirdly, we will need funds to support GPs who want to implement our solutions for improving their patients health and save money for the NHS. With the funds raised we will also track the results in these surgeries, and use them in our reports and campaigns to bring about change within the NHS itself.

Finally, that brings me on to our ambitious campaign plans which will need funding for spreading the message. One of the major campaigns we already have planned will be in June 2016 when we will have our first annual conference in Birmingham on Saturday 11th June with each of our founding members speaking on an area of public health that they're particularly passionate about. On Sunday 12th June we plan to organise a real food rally in London at Parliament Square to campaign for real food throughout the NHS.

The Perks

The first 4 perks don't need much more explaining than there already is in the sidebar. Those being becoming an eNewsletter Subscriber for £1, receiving 20 PHC stickers for £5, 2 wrist bands for £10 and a t-shirt for £20, but we thought you'd like to see some pictures of those perks...

Stickers

Wrist Band

T-Shirt

Although those don't need much more explanation, the others do need a little more than the brief that's already there.

PHC Annual Membership - £50
Whether you're a passionate health professional or a peeved member of the public as a PHC member you get all of the above plus printed quarterly reports posted to you, if you'd like them in physical format, alongside 50 campaign flyers for that quarters campaign to hand out in your local area. However, a PHC annual membership doesn't just mean getting all these bits and bobs. It means that you're part of a movement that wants to turn the tide in public health and fully support the cause for which we fight for. After this crowd-funding campaign we hope this to be our main source of funding year upon year, from people and professionals like yourself who are passionate about the cause.

International PHC Membership - £75
This membership is for those not living in the UK but wish to fully support the fight for which the PHC fights for, plus you get all those bits and bobs posted to you.

PHC Conference Ticket - £100
This perk includes the PHC annual membership plus a discounted conference ticket. We plan to make the conference as cheap as possible but this perk guarantees that you're only paying £50 for a ticket.

International PHC Conf. Ticket - £125
This perk is the same as the previous one but for those not living in the UK.

PHC Patron - £500 (Only 10 Positions Available)
Finally, our PHC patron perk is for individuals wishing and able to contribute a little more than our regular annual membership. With this perk you'll be featured on our website and public reports as a patron for the year ahead. Alongside access to reports before they're publicly published for your comments and receive a VIP conference ticket where you will be honoured in the opening remarks and be invited to the speakers dinner. If you think you could be one of these especially generous people then it's better to act sooner rather than later as there are only 10 patron positions available. For more details on the patron perk please email us directly on info@phcuk.org.

The Final Word

Although I didn't know it when I started helping people obtain and maintain healthy lifestyles 5 years ago, the PHC is what I have been working toward in order to create real lasting change in the UK. On that note I would like to thank all of the founding members above for stepping out of the status quo, and for believing in the cause and myself in order to bring about the change we want.

We hope to deliver this change as quickly as possible, and that it will reverberate around the world, but we know that it will be a long fight that will require hard graft and lots of help. If you contribute to the Public Health Collaboration then I'd like to thank you on behalf of the founding members and from the bottom of my heart for giving what you can.

If you decide you can't contribute to the Public Health Collaboration but still believe in the cause we're fighting for then please share with your friends and family either offline or online through your social media outlets. The more we can get the word out the more funds we'll raise, and the higher the chance of change coming for improving our nations health. Also, in the future there will be volunteering opportunities available on our website at www.PHCUK.org.

Finally, I know there is a fair amount of information to take in here, some of which is ambiguous because we don't want to give our complete game plan away publicly just yet, but this is a large project that requires a fairly detailed explanation of what it is and how ambitious it is. If you have any questions at all or would like to get in contact with us directly about any synergistic opportunities please either email us on info@phcuk.org or tweet us @PHCUKorg.

Thank you for your time and we hope to create change sooner rather than later,

Sam Feltham & The Founding Members of the Public Health Collaboration

The PerksThe first 4 perks don't need much more explaining than there already is in the sidebar. Those being becoming an eNewsletter Subscriber for £1, receiving 20 PHC stickers for £5, 2 wrist bands for £10 and a t-shirt for £20, but we thought you'd like to see some pictures of those perks...



Stickers


Wrist
			Band


T-Shirt



















Although those don't need much more explanation, the others do need a little more than the brief that's already there.PHC Annual Membership - £50Whether you're a passionate health professional or a peeved member of the public as a PHC member you get all of the above plus printed quarterly reports posted to you, if you'd like them in physical format, alongside 50 campaign flyers for that quarters campaign to hand out in your local area. However, a PHC annual membership doesn't just mean getting all these bits and bobs. It means that you're part of a movement that wants to turn the tide in public health and fully support the cause for which we fight for. After this crowd-funding campaign we hope this to be our main source of funding year upon year, from people and professionals like yourself who are passionate about the cause.International PHC Membership - £75This membership is for those not living in the UK but wish to fully support the fight for which the PHC fights for, plus you get all those bits and bobs posted to you.PHC Conference Ticket - £100This perk includes the PHC annual membership plus a discounted conference ticket. We plan to make the conference as cheap as possible but this perk guarantees that you're only paying £50 for a ticket.International PHC Conf. Ticket - £125This perk is the same as the previous one but for those not living in the UK.PHC Patron - £500 (Only 10 Positions Available)Finally, our PHC patron perk is for individuals wishing and able to contribute a little more than our regular annual membership. With this perk you'll be featured on our website and public reports as a patron for the year ahead. Alongside access to reports before they're publicly published for your comments and receive a VIP conference ticket where you will be honoured in the opening remarks and be invited to the speakers dinner. If you think you could be one of these especially generous people then it's better to act sooner rather than later as there are only 10 patron positions available. For more details on the patron perk please email us directly on info@phcuk.org.
The Final WordAlthough I didn't know it when I started helping people obtain and maintain healthy lifestyles 5 years ago, the PHC is what I have been working toward in order to create real lasting change in the UK. On that note I would like to thank all of the founding members above for stepping out of the status quo, and for believing in the cause and myself in order to bring about the change we want.We hope to deliver this change as quickly as possible, and that it will reverberate around the world, but we know that it will be a long fight that will require hard graft and lots of help. If you contribute to the Public Health Collaboration then I'd like to thank you on behalf of the founding members and from the bottom of my heart for giving what you can.
If you decide you can't contribute to the Public Health Collaboration but still believe in the cause we're fighting for then please share with your friends and family either offline or online through your social media outlets. The more we can get the word out the more funds we'll raise, and the higher the chance of change coming for improving our nations health. Also, in the future there will be volunteering opportunities available on our website at www.PHCUK.org.
Finally, I know there is a fair amount of information to take in here, some of which is ambiguous because we don't want to give our complete game plan away publicly just yet, but this is a large project that requires a fairly detailed explanation of what it is and how ambitious it is. If you have any questions at all or would like to get in contact with us directly about any synergistic opportunities please either email us on info@phcuk.org or tweet us @PHCUKorg.Thank you for your time and we hope to create change sooner rather than later,Sam Feltham & The Founding Members of the Public Health Collaboration

story:
UPDATE 2015/12/09

learn more about the indoor project here: http://alberta.ctvnews.ca/video?clipId=766073&a...

UPDATE 2015/11/19

- despite the above goal, we would require a minimum of $100,000 start up capital to construct and operate this indoor park project steadily
- Skate Life Calgary has agreed to join in and partner up on the project
- The indoor park will estimate to be 7000 to 8000 sq.ft
Park feature:
- comfortable resting area for visitors with a view of the skatepark. Parents will be able to keep an eye out to confirm the safety of their children
- onsite skate shop
- on site concession
- the skatepark will be skateboards ONLY

Short Summary

Skateboarding is a growing sport. Everyday, more and more people are getting into skateboarding, more and more skateparks are being built, including Calgary, AB. Canada.

Just this very years, 3 new outdoor skateparks began construction and one was completed in September. 

Calgary is prone to long winter, cold weather, and large amount of snow every year, it is very difficult for skateboarders to continue skateboarding. Many would go to parkades and skateboard illegally there. Some get hurt, some get fined, but there is no place for us skateboarders during the winter in Calgary. 

All of this can be resolve by simply having an indoor skatepark in or around Calgary, where is it affordable and safe for skateboarders of all ages to use. Under the supervision of adults and employees, we can all enjoy the use of the indoor skatepark.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to reach the goal of $1,000,000 CAD. It may sound like quite an amount, but if 10% of Calgarians donate $5, the goal could be reached. 

I have faith in the community and I believe this is a town with kind hearted members that simply want to improve where they live.

I have personally put in $10,000 into the funding, but I need everyone's help to get this project rolling.

The funding raised will all be used towards the project, not a penny less,
such as:

- property
- construction
- utilities
- taxes
- insurance
- employment
- advertisement

If goal is not reached, the money donated will still go towards building an indoor skatepark. It will only delay the project, but the dream will not die.

The Impact

Once the indoor skatepark is built, skateboarders will have a place to express themselves over the cruel and long winter. For many like myself, we live and breathe skateboarding. Being part of the skateboarding community is as having a second family that will help you and treat you as equal no matter who you are, where you're from, or what is your gender.
Many of us need this place we call our second home, where we don't feel lost in the world.

Risks & Challenges

Challenges may occur when the right location could not be found for the right price.
We are aiming for an industrial warehouse within the City of Calgary that is near a bus stop or train station. 

Once the location is found, everything else should be smooth sailing with the perfect business plan.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word. Money isn't everything. By letting as many people as possible know about this crowd funding campaign, it will help us gain more of the public's attention.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Melissa.  Wife to Christopher (married 15 years this June) and Mom to 3. My daughter Eva, who is the oldest is in need of braces due to teeth that are overlapping, teeth that have come in crooked, teeth that have come in, in the wrong place, impacting others below the gums, and several other minor issues that will be addressed simply because we took care of the more pressing ones.

We have turned to Indiegogo because we simply do not have the necessary funds to begin the process. 

What We Need

We are looking to raise the necessary funds (approx $2,000) to begin round one.  This includes speech/occupational therapy to correct some issues before we begin.  The typical amount of visits is 3, but after talking to the clinic it appears that Eva made need more than this.  However, they cannot determine how many visits it will take until we begin the sessions.  Next up is a baby tooth that needs to be pulled, the costs of a records appt, a spacer that will be inserted and then the actual braces.  These will be worn for approx 8 months before we move on to round 2.

If we do not reach our goal we will use everything we do get, to get the ball rolling.  If we surpass our goal, the additonal funds will be set aside and put towards the costs for the 2nd round of treatment.  At this time we do not know how much that will cost as I have been too overwhelmed with the cost of the 1st round to ask. 

The Impact

My biggest concern at the moment is to bring some relief to my child who complains of her teeth and gums bothering her almost daily.  Upon visiting the dentist, to see what else we could do in the mean time, we were told that the spacer/braces are the only remedy. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our campaign and spread the word, thank you.

story:
Summary

My name is Bill, my domestic partner was burned in an explosion 3 years ago. He was burned over 73% of his body, 3rd degree.

We are blessed that he survived what we were told was the un survivable. But the burn was not the full extent of his injuries.

His eye lids turned inside out and had to be removed. The doctors re-grafted new eye lids taken from another part of his body, but the first graft failed. and they needed to be done again.

This is where it would get easy to blame nurses in the hospital for not keeping the grafts lubricated enough, but however it happened, the new eye lids scratched his cornea's and have blinded him as a result.

To add insult to injury, He has had to have all 10 fingers amputated. Being newly blind, he can't even feel his way around, and depends on me for everything.

I am a cancer survivor, and myself, disabled. We are very blessed by my health issues as they have allowed me to be by his side 24 hours a day, providing the care he needs in order to keep him out of a home.

What We Need & What You Get

Vince needs a cornea transplant to restore his eye sight. Unfortunately, the fire killed off the stem cells around his cornea's, which are needed to support the transplant. Without these stem cells, any cornea transplant would fail, so first, he must get a corneal stem cell transplant.

Let me take just one moment to THANK YOU for having the compassion to read this far into our story. We realize it's kind of in depth to try to read the full extent of our need, But we really are trying to be as transparent and open to explaining everything about our situation, So you know my intentions are sincere. We really do appreciate you staying interested in our plight and continuing to read our story.

Now, There are Very few eye centers in the country who do corneal stem cell transplants. And of them there is only ONE (To the absolute best of our knowledge) that has done any work using the patients own stem cells from other parts of the eye.

Usually, if a patient's stem cells are too damaged to support the cornea transplant, they are able to take the stem cells from the other eye's corneal stem cells. In Vince's case, BOTH eyes are damaged beyond the ability to support the corneal transplants without stem cell transplants.

In this case, stem cells are often harvested from cadaver donors. When this is done, the patient must go on immune suppressing drugs so they do not reject the donor stem cells, just as any other organ transplant.

Vince has been seeing the cornea specialist at the county hospital here in Dallas for 3 years now, and to be honest, they seem to be making it as difficult as they can to even go ahead with a cadaver donor transplant AND THEY WILL NOT EVEN READ THE RESEARCH I HAVE PRINTED OUT AND GIVEN THEM FROM THE CLEVELAND CLINIC IN OHIO.

The Cleveland Clinic in Ohio has done miracles working with corneal stem cells when the patients own stem cells are damaged in both eyes. They have successfully taken stem cells from another part of the eye all together, lay them on the corneal stem cells, where they transform into the type of stem cell needed to support the cornea transplant. THE CLINIC HE IS GOING TO NOW WILL NOT EVEN LOOK AT THE RESEARCH, and insist on trying the cadaver donor transplant, and will offer him no other option

I'm sure it would be natural for you to wonder what the big deal is, Why is it so important to try to avoid using cadaver stem cells. --- Well, the fire has left Vince's lungs permanently damaged, and frankly, his immune system compromised as it is. He has had pneumonia 3x since his release from the hospital. Twice I was told he might not survive the pneumonia. It has been explained to us that Vince going on the immune suppressing drugs by itself could kill him. So, in addition to the fact he just is not getting the medical care from his cornea specialist that we would all wish for anyone in his position,, Being able to go to a clinic that actually cares about the results they offer their patients may actually save his life if they are able to use his own stem cells to regenerate his corneal stem cells. (By using his own, he will not need to be on the immune suppressing drugs)

The Impact

PLEASE understand, over the 10 years prior to Vince's accident, He carried me through two separate rounds of chemotherapy each lasting several months, as well as a 4 month course of radiation combined with 2 weeks chemotherapy.

This man is the type of friend everyone needs in their life, and even today, his bubbly disposition keeps everyone he knows laughing and experiencing the love he so willingly gives this world. The world really is a better place because he is in it.

If he were able to see again, It would be no time before he was out in the community offering encouragement to other burn survivors. Already he often stops and talks to the family members of patients in the burn unit ICU, Offering them encouragement and showing them that miracles do happen. Giving them hope when in the natural world, there just doesn't seem to be any within sight for them at the time.

But blind, he is only a shell of a man, trying to be patient as he waits in his lonely existence until God send an angel with a message that hope is on it's way.

That is why I want to take him to a clinic where this is their specialty, Where they will address his blindness with a determination to solve the issues affecting HIM. And the sad part is that the technology is there to do it. BUT where he is now, he is being looked at as though they have saved his life, and he should be happy with that. And yes, we are thankful for the talents of the WONDERFUL burn doctors who saved his life, and the PM&R doctors who do very well at addressing and trying to manage his pain. But no hospital can have a perfect record in every department, and he is definitely falling through the cracks in the eye clinic of this hospital. I believe that they just have too many patients there for them to have compassion for any of them.

The money I am requesting is to cover the trips from Dallas to Cleveland, a hotel and rental car for the trips needed to get him established at the Cleveland Clinic. In addition, Vince will be responsible for 20% of all medical bills (All Dr appointments, procedures & transplants)

I really do foresee our actually cost being much higher than what I have requested on here, But even if I don't get the full amount requested, What we do receive will go toward travel, Dr appointments, and even if we can't pay for the full amount of the procedures upfront, what is left will be used as down payments toward the procedures needed.

In closing, I can't thank you enough for spending the time to read our story and considering our request. for the next five minutes, please try to notice everything each of your fingers touch. Consider how you would do it without any fingers at all. Then if you can, try to imagine how you would do it if you couldn't even see the position each of your knuckles are in (The 1st knuckle where your finger meets your hand). This is the world I am trying to free him from.

There really has not been much opportunity for him to learn any independence in his disability. Outside of a gal who comes by 5 days a week to help me with housework, Vince and I are alone in Dallas, needing to live here for his medical care. If he were to get his eye sight, we could move to be with family again. And perhaps he would even be able to get some kind of a job, restoring his dignity and sense of self worth again.

I am sorry this has been such a long article, Vince is one of God's beautiful souls placed on this earth to touch each of our lives. I promise you, every penny sent to assist us will be appreciated and we will keep each of you in our prayers of thanksgiving.

Even if you are unable to help financially, perhaps you could post our story on your face-book page, or other web site that might point potential donors in our direction. Also Indiegogo suggest we remind you to use the Indiegogo share tools. I really don't know what that means, but hopefully you do. If the site allows you to email us, we will be glad to answer any questions you may have for us.

Also, I have seen prayers answered in hours as he lay fighting for his life. even the smallest, quickest, yet sincere little prayer could have a huge impact on our situation. All prayers, love and well wishes are welcome, THANK YOU with all our hearts.

May God bless you, as you have blessed us.

story:
Short Summary

Research into the more frequent and common cancers is often well-funded. In contrast, rare cancer research is challenging not only because there are few cases to study, but also because a lack of public awareness may mean less available research funds.

I am a pathologist and cancer researcher who is very interested in T-cell lymphoma, a rare form of often very aggressive blood-cell cancer. I've designed a novel test to hopefully improve the way these types of cancers are diagnosed, but I need to study the test on a large number of archived tissue samples  to make sure it works. There are several hundred archived tissue samples available for study (available under ethics committee oversight); now I need to find the cash to pay for it!

What I Need & What You Get

All funds raised through this campaign will go specifically toward my research project. Funds will help pay for the testing and validation of my new test on about 300 cases, each case costing about $40 to test. This number of specimens was selected after a rigorous review of the epidemiology of T-cell lymphomas in Canada and reflects the bare minimum number to get meaningful data.

Unless indicated, all contributions will be credited in my research project summary (meaning that unless you say otherwise, your name will appear in the acknowledgements section of my thesis and publications); every donor deserves the right to be recognized for their generous contributions to the advancement of medical science.

The Impact

My life's goal, as a pathologist, is to do my utmost to ensure a patient gets the right diagnosis in order to get the optimal care. In the world of lymphomas, this means not only recognizing that a specimen contains a malignancy but making sure to correctly identify what type of lymphoma it is, since we know that subtype determines therapy and response. My hope with this project is to prove that my new test will make this process easier, more accurate and more reproducible. Your contribution to this project will help to make me, and hopefully many other physicians who read my research, better able to direct patient care; this is especially important in rare cancers where the science may be less well-established.

Risks & Challenges

Through my work & research, I am fortunate to have access to the expertise of many of the world's leading minds in cancer research. Nevertheless, as with any scientific undertaking, there is a minute risk that the results of my research will be unsuccessful. Even in this unlikely scenario, however, a "negative" scientific study should help the medical establishment learn how to do things better.

Other Ways You Can Help

Cancers in general are prevalent diseases (that is to say, there are many people living with these illnesses). For anyone interested in making a non-financial contribution, there are many ways to "fight the good fight." The simple act of volunteering your time to support a cancer patient living through their challenging journey can be enough. I encourage everyone to give to cancer research and treatment campaigns, in whatever way they can.

Short Summary Research into the more frequent and common cancers is often well-funded. In contrast, rare cancer research is challenging not only because there are few cases to study, but also because a lack of public awareness may mean less available research funds.
I am a pathologist and cancer researcher who is very interested in T-cell lymphoma, a rare form of often very aggressive blood-cell cancer. I've designed a novel test to hopefully improve the way these types of cancers are diagnosed, but I need to study the test on a large number of archived tissue samples  to make sure it works. There are several hundred archived tissue samples available for study (available under ethics committee oversight); now I need to find the cash to pay for it!   What I Need & What You Get All funds raised through this campaign will go specifically toward my research project. Funds will help pay for the testing and validation of my new test on about 300 cases, each case costing about $40 to test. This number of specimens was selected after a rigorous review of the epidemiology of T-cell lymphomas in Canada and reflects the bare minimum number to get meaningful data.
Unless indicated, all contributions will be credited in my research project summary (meaning that unless you say otherwise, your name will appear in the acknowledgements section of my thesis and publications); every donor deserves the right to be recognized for their generous contributions to the advancement of medical science.
    The Impact My life's goal, as a pathologist, is to do my utmost to ensure a patient gets the right diagnosis in order to get the optimal care. In the world of lymphomas, this means not only recognizing that a specimen contains a malignancy but making sure to correctly identify what type of lymphoma it is, since we know that subtype determines therapy and response. My hope with this project is to prove that my new test will make this process easier, more accurate and more reproducible. Your contribution to this project will help to make me, and hopefully many other physicians who read my research, better able to direct patient care; this is especially important in rare cancers where the science may be less well-established.
    Risks & Challenges Through my work & research, I am fortunate to have access to the expertise of many of the world's leading minds in cancer research. Nevertheless, as with any scientific undertaking, there is a minute risk that the results of my research will be unsuccessful. Even in this unlikely scenario, however, a "negative" scientific study should help the medical establishment learn how to do things better.
    Other Ways You Can Help Cancers in general are prevalent diseases (that is to say, there are many people living with these illnesses). For anyone interested in making a non-financial contribution, there are many ways to "fight the good fight." The simple act of volunteering your time to support a cancer patient living through their challenging journey can be enough. I encourage everyone to give to cancer research and treatment campaigns, in whatever way they can.

story:
Fourteen weeks ago, this little girl was living the life of your average 6-year-old: She had just started the first grade and had just moved into a new apartment with her mother and brother. The family had just been able to afford an apartment in a nice neighborhood where the kids could play outside and climb trees. Her mother had worked so hard to provide for her children and was now overjoyed that they could live and go to school in a family-friendly area.
 
She was playing with and tormenting her older brother, taking vacations with her grandparents, singing, laughing, climbing her favorite tree, and dancing. With an infectious laugh and sense of grace, an indiscribible connection to the earth and all its wonder, a thankfulness for everything large and small, compassion, and an innate desire to live, her very presence restored passion to the weary. I remember once, when given the gift of a mere pair of hand-me-down flip-flops, Mia placed her hands on her cheeks, took in a deep breath, and - with nothing more than a sheer, unabated sense of gratitude - squeeled "OHHHH, THAANK YOU!!!!". We all smiled and were blessed by her absolute passion for the everyday.  
 
She was the epitome of thankfulness that we should all aspire to be. She didn't know a stranger. She would walk into a room full of people, survey it, stick her hand into the air, and say, "Hi! I'm Mia!" Almost as if to say, "I am here to brighten your day and fill your soul!"
 
Around eleven weeks ago, her 14-year-old brother, Ethan, came down with a cold/flu virus and recovered fairly quickly. So, when Mia came down with cold and flu symptoms, it appeared to be nothing abnormal. Her mother, Michelle, did what all of us moms do and consoled her child. She treated the symptoms and tried to wait it out. Until one night when she ran a short errand and left Mia in Ethan's very capable hands. When she returned home, Mia approached her and said she "Couldn't see" and got up to go to the kitchen. She ran into a chair and fell. When Michelle went to help her up, she was confronted with every mother's worst nightmare. Mia's body stiffened and she began to seize. Never having dealt with any medical issues with either of her children, she immediately took action and called 911. The EMT squad arrived and took her to the hospital.
 
From here, Mia suffered several more seizures and eventually went into Cardiac Arrest. A very precarious situation, the Emergency Room nurses refused to give up. She was administered heart massage and resuscitation for an unheard of FOUR hours. Once they were able to get somewhat of a trace heartbeat, the doctors decided to try a fairly new method of heart and lung assistance called ECMO (Extracorporeal Membrane Oxygenation) to help support her heartbeat. From here, she was placed on many other forms of support. All of her vital organs had shut down, she had a collapsed lung, and her heart was only pumping on a machine. The potential outcome was grim.
 
Her brain was without continuous oxygen for four hours. Because of the extensive brain damage caused by lack of oxygen, Michelle was given a very grim prognosis for her child. The Cardiologists and Neurologists said the words no mother should ever have to hear about her child:
 
"Mia has suffered severe trauma to the brain due to the amount of time without oxygen... You may want to begin thinking about her quality of life... IF..."
 
After the initial shock, Michelle made the decision to commit her life, and the life of her children, to God. To put Mia in His hands and to rely on faith in the unseen. He began to work. When Michelle prayed for strengthening of Mia's heart and lungs, Mia's heart and lungs gained strength. When Medical Science finally caught up and there was an X-Ray, Mia's left lung had been restored! When the doctors felt that removing certain machines would be detrimental to Mia's survival and there was concentrated prayer over the function they performed, they would begin experiencing problems with those machines. It became necessary to remove them one-by-one (ECMO, dialysis, various IV feeds) because it would have been more detrimental to have her remain on them! The same thing happened with medications. When the doctors wanted to "try" to remove her from certain medications and see whether her heart would be strong enough to maintain function, it always was.  
 
"'For my thoughts are not your thoughts; neither are your ways my ways', declares the Lord." (Isaiah 55:8) Contrary to all that was before us and the doctors, this child is now walking, talking, laughing, reading, singing, and eating (among many other things the original prognoses suggested). She is gaining strength daily. Best of all, she has not lost any of the personality we all loved so much. She has touched the lives and hearts of every person with whom she has come in contact. The doctors who made the original assessments of her possible future now walk by her room, stop in, smile, shake their heads, and say, "AMAZING".
 
Defying all odds, medical science, human knowledge or understanding, Mia will be going home with her mother and brother on November 21! Her only remaining obstacles are a g-tube to administer the heart medications she will require for an undetermined amount of time. The doctors now pass information to Michelle with the caveat, "We don't put anything past her", or "She has surprised us before". She is working daily to strengthen her muscles in order to be able to use them as often and as freely as she used to. She greets all who visit with that huge "Mia smile", laughter, and a huge hug. She says, "I love you" often and without abandon.
 
She is a miracle. 
 
This is where you come in:
 
She needs your support so that she may continue the laughter. Her mother is every bit as much a fighter as she is, but is unable to carry the burden of Mia's medical expenses alone. For the ECMO treatment alone, the cost is around $16,430 per 24 hours. Mia withstood approximately one week of this treatment, which has been known to cost up to $1,238,004. (CTSNETJOURNALS; November 11, 2012) Again, this is only one of her treatments. She has to have continuous care for Myocarditis and follow up treatments for her g-tube (including possible eventual removal, prayerfully), therapy, and follow-up care.
 
It goes without saying that EVERY dollar counts! Mia and Ethan deserve a childhood not fraught with constant financial strain - and a mother who is able to not live in daily fear of being able to pay these bills. Whatever you are able to give is a blessing to all three of them.

story:
What is Toledo Quidditch?

The Toledo Firebolts are the OFFICIAL Quidditch Team of the University of Toledo. We are the newest club sport at UT, and we are exploding on the scene! We were founded in the Summer of 2012, and played our fist match against rivals and friends BGSU. We have since then played in 27 matches, including participating in the Midwest Regional Championship, the BGSU Rivarly Tournament, and our first ever, Glass City Quidditch Classic. We have also participated in quidditch history, having hosted and played in the first ever televised quidditch match in the history of the sport!

We are hoping to get to the Division 2 Quidditch World Cup, which will be in Kissimmee, FL. April 13-14. In Division 2, we will compete against 19 other teams for the title of Division 2 Champions! However, we need to get moeny to get there!

Every donation you contribute helps us out in the long run. We would be representing our school, our city and our state in Florida, and it would be WONDERFUL for all of you to make a donation! 

Want to know more?

https://www.facebook.com/ToledoFireboltsQuidditch
http://www.internationalquidditch.org/
http://www.independentcollegian.com/news/when-magic-becomes-reality-1.2804200?pagereq=1#.US_EKDCG2Bs

What We Need & What You Get

Our Goal is 1500, but we will need more than that! We would like to get 3000 so that we have to only cover food out of pocket, this is going to be our biggest trip  of our teams career!

All of your donations will go to vehicle rentals, fuel cost, hotel cost and registration fees. We are going to make sure that we are travelling as light and as cost efficient as possible, because we want to make every donation worth it! 

We have the perks as listed below to the side for you to enjoy! The best thing is that the more you donate, the more stuff you get!

The Impact

Every donation helps each player to keep cost as low as possible. We are all college students who don't have a lot of this money lying around.

Getting us to World Cup can help with future player recruitment! If we do well, it reflects well on the school and helps us to recruit players at our school to help our program grow!

We have a new found reputation as a team, and we want to continue to make that grow! We arethe first program to have a match televised on cable television, and we have hosted our own tournament. Competing at World CUp would cap off a great season for us, and build momentum for next year!

Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE this page as much as possible! even if you can't donate right now, doesn't mean you can't help us to get to World Cup!!


Every little bit goes a long way! We really want to make this happen, and You can help us have it happen! Make this trip become a reality!

story:
After having some severe chest pains, Xavier had to undergo an angioplasty surgery to clear a clot in one of his arteries. While the surgery went very well, he is left with tens of thousands of dollars in medical bills, and still needs aftercare and follow-up visits to the cardiologist.  Though Xavier (a.k.a. lil' tuffy) is doing great, he sure could use your help and support. Please help us raise money to aid in Xavier's care and recovery.

We are trying to raise $15,000 to help cover the substantial medical bills that are now due. Spread the word and help out with whatever you can so Xavier can just keep on being talented, charming, smart, handsome, funny, and the force that he is. 

Thanks for helping!!

story:
The Situation

Everyday, 55 Filipinos die from water-related diseases. The economic loss in the country from water-related problems amounts to $1.54 billion dollars a year.

On a global scale, 80% of illnesses are linked to poor water conditions.

Everyone wants to drink clean water but not everyone is aware of the effects of constant dirty water.

Without clean water, the possibility of breaking out of the cycle of poverty is very small. Without potable water, farmers can’t grow food.

Without clean water, people can’t build housing or stay healthy.

Children can’t stay in school, and the focus to keep working is lessened when dealing with all these problems simultaneously, which is a reality to most families in developing countries.

The Team

This is the story of Reinell, Alvin, Moses and Mich: Four guys from Angeles City, Pampanga (a city north of the Philippine capital) who want to change how Filipinos view clean water.

But this is also your story and whether or not you want to help them change how people access clean water across the world.

 

The Product

The LIFE water-purifying machine is a low-cost device that uses nanotechnology filtration and electromagnetics to take out viruses and bacteria. Compact and lightweight, it can be attached to almost any faucet. This small device requires no power source and can purify about 25,000 liters of water - making it safe, convenient and more affordable.

It even cleans dirty mop water! Check out our video (1:06 - 1:16 mark) where one of our founders, Reinell, drinks water freshly filtered from a mop bucket.

 

Lab Tests

 

 

 

The Department of Science and Technology has certified that the LIFE Purifier is effective.

 

The Company

Aqua Powered Solutions (formerly Armtech) is a company that endeavors to make potable water a reality to places that can’t imagine an easy and convenient access to clean water.

We are backed by Ideaspace Foundation, a non-profit incubator fund for Philippine-based science and technology startups.

 

Why we need funding

The product is not good looking, not flashy, and we hired an industrial engineer to help us make our prototype look better. The new design needs 6 molds. Each mold costs USD 12,000. We need these molds so that we can start manufacturing this product and start rolling them out for households, communities, government and non-government disaster relief programs.


PRESS

  • Techcrunch - Filipino Accelerator IdeaSpace Picks Country’s Top 20 Tech Startups
  • Interaksyon - IdeaSpace bares 10 winners of year-long search for next big innovation
  • SunStar - Kapampangan Traders Win IdeaSpace Competition
  • TV5 Reaksyon - IdeaSpace Prototype Day 
    • Live demonstration of the LIFE purifier (5:45 to 8:40 mark)

 

* Thanks to Bea Bermudo for helping us make the pitch video!

story:
Help Maureen fund her Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction training

My name is Maureen Lauer-Gatta. I have been teaching yoga for 10 years. In 2011 I participated in the Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) training that was held at my yoga studio -- The Yoga Room in Warren, Ohio. While there are many outlets to practicing compassion and living a full life, I embraced the MBSR program. It has given me abilities to practice compassion for myself when things feel overwhelming. I struggle with the idea of death and dying on a daily basis. Yoga has become an outlet for me to stay calm during my practice, but the Mindfulness techniques have enabled me to take this off my mat and into my daily life by not dwelling on my personal struggles.

The MBSR program at my studio is based on a sliding pay scale. I would like to continue this and offer others the ability to take part in these life-enriching techniques.

I am seeking your monetary help because I was very fortunate to get into the training program at Mt. Madonna in Watsonville, California to study with Jon Kabat-Zinn (founder and former Executive Director of the Center for Mindfulness in Medicine, Health Care, and Society at the University of Massachusetts Medical School) and Saki Santorelli (executive director of the Center for Mindfulness in Medicine, Health Care, and Society., and director of the Stress Reduction Program at the University of Massachusetts Medical School)

There was a waiting list of over 800 participants just to get into this program and some have been waiting for 4 years!

I am seeking $2,300 which will help cover:

The cost of room and board and meals for the 7 day training, which is $2,162.

Transportation is $192

Flight: $300

Running my studio while I am gone is $120 (substitute teachers)

100% of the funds will go to this training to allow me to share this program with others in Northeast Ohio and Western Pennsylvania.

 

Why the Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction Program

For me, this program has helped me find inner peace and happiness.

This is from the Umass.edu site: http://www.umassmed.edu/cfm/stress/index.aspx

"World wide, tens of thousands of people have accepted this invitation. They are a lot like you, and they’ve learned to integrate the methods we’ve developed here at UMass into their everyday lives. Two decades of published research indicates that the majority of people who complete the course report:

  • Lasting decreases in physical and psychological symptoms
  • An increased ability to relax
  • Reductions in pain levels and an enhanced ability to cope with pain that may not go away
  • Greater energy and enthusiasm for life
  • Improved self-esteem
  • An ability to cope more effectively with both short and long-term stressful situations."

Other Ways You Can Help

I completely understand if you are not able to contribute, I am very limited financially in what I can give. One thing that you can do is help me get the word out. Please share this with others that may be able to. Indiegogo has share tools. Please click and share with others.

For me, this program has helped me find inner peace and happiness.
This is from the Umass.edu site: http://www.umassmed.edu/cfm/stress/index.aspx
"World wide, tens of thousands of people have accepted this invitation. They are a lot like you, and they’ve learned to integrate the methods we’ve developed here at UMass into their everyday lives. Two decades of published research indicates that the majority of people who complete the course report:

Lasting decreases in physical and psychological symptoms
An increased ability to relax
Reductions in pain levels and an enhanced ability to cope with pain that may not go away
Greater energy and enthusiasm for life
Improved self-esteem
An ability to cope more effectively with both short and long-term stressful situations."



Other Ways You Can Help
I completely understand if you are not able to contribute, I am very limited financially in what I can give. One thing that you can do is help me get the word out. Please share this with others that may be able to. Indiegogo has share tools. Please click and share with others.

story:
Greg's Story

Greg Dixon is a hardy soul. He hunts moose every year to provide for his family and shares with others. He also fishes each summer. In fact, it is not unusual for him to leave Fairbanks on a Friday after work, drive 320 miles to Chitina, unpack his dipnet and some Pilot Bread (TM), and fish from the rocky riverside. He'll stay for a day or two to catch some of those beautiful Alaskan Copper River red salmon, then return to Fairbanks for work or more play. Or it's back to work at the  gold mine.

Greg works at a gold mine somewhere north of the Glenn Highway, in one of those mountain valleys none of us have ever seen, and probably never will. Greg and several people live there throughout the summer, hoping to leave a little richer, and maybe even a little wiser.

When he's gone during the summer, Greg leaves wife Sasha, born and raised in Fairbanks, and three children, ages five, eight, and ten. The kids have been schooled at home and their playground is the great outdoors. Sasha and Greg and their friends teach their children by teaching them their surroundings. They plant and grow a garden and greenhouse organically. The kids run barefoot everywhere. They need a bath in the summer all the time, but forget it, they will be dirty again in an hour.

Imagine the horrifying news in December when they found out that Greg had cancer of the colon. Later, they learned the cancer had metastasized to the liver, making it necessary to postpone surgery.

Why We Are Fundraising 

Between November when Greg first saw a doctor in Fairbanks, Alaska and January when Greg began receiving chemotherapy treatment in Katy, TX, Greg and Sasha had accumulated over $50,000 in medical bills. Greg is seeing an oncologist in private practice who was trained at the renowned MD Anderson. This reduces the bills by not having the high overhead associated with MD Anderson. They have also received some assistance from pharmaceutical companies who are willing to provide medication at a discount. Some of Greg's treatment costs are now being covered by private medical insurance, but some are not. The cost of the hospital stays, oncologist, chemotherapy, and upcoming surgeries (at least two) are accumulating at a staggering rate.  

The Dixon Family 

Greg grew up on Cordes Way in Goldstream Valley and went to West Valley High School. His father, Larry Dixon, moved his family to Fairbanks from Florida, where he had worked at Cape Canaveral. Unfortunately, Larry passed away in December, soon after Greg learned he had cancer, and before Greg could return to Anchor Point to see him again. Greg's mother Fran continues to live in Anchor Point where she is an avid quilter. Greg has three sisters: Carla, Paula, and Lynette. Lynette has temporarily re-located to Texas to help Sasha and Greg by looking after their children while her own children are at home.  

Other Ways You Can Help

We know some people want to help but are unable to give any financial assistance. You can still help by sharing Greg's story and by keeping Greg and Sasha and their family in your prayers. 

Thank you!

story:
(Thank's everyone in the media and everyone supporting the project here for your support!! It's been amazing.)


**UPDATE**

Dear Backers, 

We are sorry for our extremely bad communication here. We have no excuses other than us being inventors and not to skilled in communications (with humans anyway). Actually, we didn’t even KNOW about the possibility to communicate here until one of you kindly reminded us. 

Now, to our common project, the No More Woof headset, we where totally shocked by the interest from global media. One can say that all of you backers jumped onto something that really stirred something deep in people. The possibility to, in some rudimentary way, communicate in a new way with animals. 

Anyway; we are working like crazy trying to identify the patterns in our beloved pets brainwaves and build the interface to fit the components in a sturdy and dog friendly way. So far we’ve both encountered obstacles and made progress. As always, our biggest issue is that we tend to aim to high. This project is partly self-funded, and partly funded by you. It is not a billion dollar Darpa project, but we seem to set goals as if it was. 

Our new timing Schedule allow us to have the units ready by the end of may, only one month late. Then we will start shipping the No More Woofs. 

Meanwhile: HERE are some unique picture only for you from our latest testing (the dog is called “Jocke”). 

HERE you’ll find a movie that Volvo made for us. 

We’ll try to update you again here as soon as we’ve made any progress (or encountered a new hurdle). 

Until then, please visit our Facebook-page at https://www.facebook.com/TheNordicSocietyForInventionAndDiscovery

And once again: thank you for your support. It reality matters, not only to us, but to science!!

/The NSID



No More Woof aims to develop a small gadget that uses the latest technology in micro computing and EEG to analyse animal thought patterns and spell them out in Human Language* using a loudspeaker. But we admit, we are optimistic dreamers, so even more importantly we want to raise AWARENESS about this area of science, and point others to the potentials! 







Among the patterns we have found are "I'm Tired", "I'm excited" and possibly "I'm Hungry" and the clearly intense brain activity  when a dog sees a new face, that we translate into: "Who ARE you?". So far we have funded this project all by our own means, and we have DELIBERATELY set the amount of money we want to raise really low, not to get peoples hopes up. In the end, this will only be the start of future development!


As we see it, by pre-ordering your own set of NO MORE WOOF, you are not only buying the first edition of a cool product (that might not be perfect) but more importantly, you are showing your support for further research into finally breaking the language barrier between animals and humans. Join the movement!








The technology used in No More Woof is the result of combining the latest technologies in three different tech-areas, EEG-sensoring, Micro Computing and  special BCI software. During the last decade huge discoveries have been made to map out the human brain’s functions. But never before has anyone made a serious attempt to apply this groundbreaking technology on man’s best friend.



For instance there is a spectrum of specific electrical signals in the brain defining the feeling of tiredness.


Some of the most easily detected neural patterns are: "I'm tired", "I'm curious who that is?" and "I'm excited". 

(It is worth pointing out that dogs "think" in a different way than humans. Whereas the dog's brain signals might indicate excitement, that does of course not really mean  the dog is "thinking" that, it's rather more a mental state than a "thought": the dog IS excited. However, the difference between thoughts and mental states is actually an interesting philosophical question, for those who are into these things.) 




Every mammal creates and transports "thoughts" the same way, as a swarm of electrical signals through a complex neurosystem). It has long been possible to record this activity through Electroencephalogram (EEG) readings. When it comes to humans, the last decade has seen tremendous progress. 

However every species uses its unique structure. You could say that all creatures speak the same language only with varying dialects. And as animal brains are less complex than humans their signal patterns are more distinct for feelings of anger, curiosity or tiredness – actually making them easier to distinguish.


The challenges we are facing using EEG on pets are a matter of placement for best comfort and how to identify the clearest signal when attaching the device on fur (we would never let you shave a tonsure on your beautiful German Shepard).


We are experimenting with a new brain-computer interface (BCI) to detect, analyze and translate the brainwaves of dogs into comprehensive thoughts.


Earlier the devices had to stream thought sequences, but now we are using Raspberry PI, which handles this process directly inside the device. 


This might not seem as a big deal, but actually it clearly distinguishes this project from all previous research. 


When the EEG readings are gathered, you could say that the trick of reading an animal’s mind is stripped down to a more or less complex deciphering problem. 


Right now we are only scraping the surface of possibilities; the project is only in its cradle. And to be completely honest, the first version will be quite rudimentary. But hey, the first computer was pretty crappy too. 




For more information, read about us in Wired or Gizmodo.


http://www.nordicinvention.com


Finally, we must AGAIN stress that ALL the products are at the first stage and shall be regarded as research support. 
(If anyone at ANY point like their money back, we will give it to you. For us this is actually most of all a way to raise INTEREST around this magical area of research!)
That said, they will definitely work on a basic level (identifying excitement and tiredness for instance) with dogs and we can actually think of no cooler products, and yeah, we're basically building them because we want them ourselves. (We've spent more money on this than we will ever receive :)

story:
"Kids in houses that moved from all-dirt to all-concrete floors saw parasitic infestation rates drop 78 percent; the number of children who had diarrhea in any given month dropped by half; anemia fell more than four-fifths; and scores on cognitive tests went up by more than a third."      -Foreign Policy Magazine


How Did earthenable Get Started?

earthenable was started by six passionate people with a dream to improve health outcomes through simple and affordable solutions.  We came together at Stanford's design school, through a class called Design for Extreme Affordability. One of every three projects from the class continues to this day, and we are proud to be incorporating as a nonprofit.  

The Problem

During the course of Stanford's design for extreme affordability class, we traveled to Rwanda to understand how sub-optimal homes affected physical and emotional health outcomes. We were shocked to discover the significant health problems that dirt floors cause.  Studies show that simply eliminating a dirt floor from the home results in dramatic reductions in childhood asthma, diarrhea, malnutrition, and parasite infestations. In impoverished children, the cognitive improvements and health benefits of a proper floor are on par with providing nutritional supplements.


We were also shocked to find out how unaffordable other floors are in Rwanda - concrete is upwards of 300 US dollars.  Everyone we asked with a dirt floor said they wanted a proper floor but couldn't afford it.  


Uma's home had a dirt floor, which turned muddy as many puddles formed due to rain seeping up from the ground.



The Solution

It then became our mission to find a way to floor Rwanda.  And it turns out the solution was right in our own backyard!  Earthen flooring has experienced a revival in the western United States, with many sustainability oriented home-owners refining the technique to install modern earthen floors in their homes.  These floors are easy to clean, abrasion-resistant, and beautiful.  All we had to do was find a way to adapt this for Rwanda.  



A modern earthen floor in Portland, Oregon, Courtesy of Joshua McMahon


In the United States, earthen floors are made by hand with several layers of earthen materials, without the need for industrial tools, and sealed by a layer of linseed oil. 

One reason earthen floors have not reached Rwanda is that linseed oil is very expensive. We have addressed this by developing a way to chemically convert soybean oil and sunflower seed oil (both affordable and locally produced) into a material that behaves just like linseed oil, and is also more environmentally friendly. Our newly developed oil can be produced with mostly locally available material.  

The other reason earthen floors have not been adopted is that people don't know the technical (but easy-to-learn) skills to installing high quality floors. earthenable brings modern earthen flooring to the poorest Rwandans by bridging this gap in training. 

Where's My Money Going?

We have already completed two pilot projects in Rwanda with great results.  We plan to scale in June 2014 to many more communities.  Until then, we need $20,000 in order to fund: 

  • Additional pilot floors to continue to test, learn, and refine our product and training process
  • Research and development of our new drying oil, and initial manufacturing (with two chemistry students from the Kigali Institute of Science and Technology or KIST)
  • Testing ways to make earthen floors dry quickly to prevent displacing families from their homes for too long (with a recent graduate from the KIST engineering program)
  • Solidifying materials sourcing and supply chain support
  • Hiring a trainer from Rwanda to conduct earthen flooring workshops across the country
  • Trips to Rwanda for our co-founders to oversee additional pilots

The Impact

"Kids in houses that moved from all-dirt to all-concrete floors saw parasitic infestation rates drop 78 percent; the number of children who had diarrhea in any given month dropped by half; anemia fell more than four-fifths; and scores on cognitive tests went up by more than a third." 
     -Foreign Policy Magazine

Our campaign will promote a simple technology that can potentially make a huge impact on the health of Rwandans, all serving a massive unmet demand for affordable flooring. We hope you will join us in enabling Rwanda to have healthier homes.  

More information on the dramatic health improvements attainable by a proper floor are available here: UC Berkeley's assessment of Mexico's "Piso Firme" program

Other Ways You Can Help

If you know partners or organizations who may be interested in working with us, please contact us at earthenable@gmail.com!  We appreciate your support!  

Credits

The original music created for this video is by Carlos Cabrera.

Photographs of modern high-end earthen floors were generously provided by Joshua McMahon. Joshua's earthen masterpieces can be found at http://www.dioxua.com/

Special thanks to the MASS Design Group and Earthen Hand Natural Building who have supported us along the way.
