story:
1. Cotton swabs push earwax deeper into your ear canal & causes plugs.  

  • Earwax buildup can cause itchiness, dizziness, pain, & ringing in the ears 

2. They can puncture your eardrum.

  • 1 in 2000 pediatric office visits and 3 in 1000 ENT visits are solely for cotton-tipped swab related injuries.
  • "In trying to remove it, people often get into trouble ... they've got a cotton swab in their ear and somebody nudges their elbow and all of a sudden they've done serious damage to their middle ear."  - Dr. Charles Beatty

3. They cause more itchiness than relief.

  • Using cotton swabs --> dryness in ear canal --> itchy ears --> back to using cotton swabs 

4. Not eco-friendly

  • 25.5 billion cotton swabs are produced each year & have been around for 90+ yrs, so imagine how many were used and thrown away since its invention.



Take Oto-Tip wherever your ears go... 



...to easily clean your ears...


With Oto-Tip's soft and flexible spiral tip...


A better way to clean your ears!


For deep ear cleaning, TEC Home...

Bringing professional ear cleaning into your hands...

Home Irrigation Made Easy!


Watch how our products work:




Our Perks for Indiegogo Contributors


We're on a mission to save the world's ears...

Imagine that one morning you woke up to find the birds weren't singing. Imagine your desperation in realizing you had lost the ability to hear. 

For years there has been an unjustifiable gap between the accessibility of healthcare here in the United States and in developing countries across the globe. Though it may be hard to believe, the number one cause of impaired hearing worldwide is wax buildup. This problem can easily be treated in its early stages. Millions of people across the world are loosing the ability to easily communicate with their loved ones, and we want to deliver hearing innovations to fix this problem. Clear Ear has partnered with organizations across the globe to deliver free ear health screening and cleanings through our HERE and THERE program. 


Learn more about our HERE and THERE Program in Varni, India: 

We went to Varni, India in August and assisted our partners Healthy Scholars & the Community Center for Development (CCD) at Varni in bringing healthcare to the region. While at the CCD, we participated in the Health Screening Camp and Ear Cleanings for the students. We believe in a world where what you do HERE can make a positive impact THERE. 



Our pilot manufacturing line is up and running and we will start shipping products starting Jan. 2015...

Coming soon, Cinematographer Aravind Ragupathi is creating a video that will take you behind the scenes and give you a glimpse of how our products are made...


With your support, we can bring good ear health into our daily lives here and across the globe. 

In the end, this campaign is about more than just a cool product. We want to change the way that people think about ear health. That's why we are banding together artists, engineers, philanthropists, students, and people just like you to provide a globally unmet need in ear health. 

We know that not everyone is in a position to donate, and that's okay! You can still help our campaign by sharing our campaign on social media networks like Twitter and Facebook. 

So join our movement today to help make ears around the world happier! THANK YOU!

From Left to Right: 

Dr. Carpenter, MD, is a Board Certified Physician in the specialty of Otolaryngology and Head and Neck Surgery. He received his training at the Mayo Clinic and has 35 years experience at a teaching hospital and is currently at the Lahey Clinic Medical Center. 

Lily Truong earned her B.S. and M.S. in Biomechanical Engineering from Stanford University. She is passionate about global health innovations having formerly worked at medical device firms in the U.S., Germany, and China. Her first hand experience with her mother going deaf in her left ear along with the realization that 360 million other people across the globe suffer from impaired hearing, led to the co-founding of Clear Ear. 

Leland Stock is a mechanical engineer with over 10 years of work experience and almost all of them in the medical device industry. Leland has a unique background of experience in the hearing aid and ear care space as well as medical device optics and lighting. this experience had made Leland a valuable asset to the Clear Ear team.

Gavin Ogami is a manufacturing engineer, who earned his B.S. in Biomedical Engineering and M.S. in Industrial Engineering from California Polytechnic State University - San Luis Obispo. He has years of experience in lean manufacturing of medical devices and automotives. 

Additional team members:

Dr. Vandana Jain MD, MBA, is the co-founder of Clear Ear Inc. She is a Cornea, Cataract and a Refractive surgeon. She has the rare blend of business management training as well from Stanford GSB. As an ophthalmologist, she has worked and spent time at prestigious institutes like L.V. Prasad Eye Institute, India and Massachusetts Eye and Ear Infirmary, Harvard, USA.  

Dr. Chris Baker is  Board Certified in Pediatrics and Emergency Medicine, currently working at a children’s hospital in the bay area. Founder of Aardvark, which commercialized a children’s line of nasal care products.

Dylan Walker is senior-level marketing professional in the start-up medical device industry; Previously held positions in ear tech marketing at InSound Medical & Acclarent.


Q: How are the two devices different?

A: The main difference is that the Oto-Tip provides basic daily cleaning and the TEC HOME provides occasional deep cleaning. 

Q: Are the ear tips reusable?

A: Yes.

Q: How are the devices cleaned?

A: For the Oto-Tip, you can detach the tip and wash it separate from the rest of the device. For the TEC HOME, you can detach the tip and the water container and wash them separately as well.

Q: How are the devices powered?

A: The Oto-Tip is powered by 1 AAA batteries and the TEC HOME comes with a charger similar to an electric toothbrush. 

Q: What are the approximate dimensions of the devices?

A: The Oto-Tip dimensions are around 4" long and 1" diameter at the base. The TEC HOME dimensions are around 10" in height and 4" diameter at the base.


MedCity News "a medical device to softens and remove ear wax, which can become more problematic as people age" 

FORBES "...provides a more efficient way to clear your ears." 

ABC "heats up the water to prevent dizziness..."

Vision and Hearing News "...helped remove a quarter-sized calcified mass of earwax from his ear that had gone unnoticed by doctors as it had built up over time."

USA TODAY (IN PRINT, March 2014)


Questions or comments ...

For anything you may want to know about Clear Ear or if you wish to get in touch with us, you can contact us at info@clearearinc.com

Prasad Eye Institute, India and Massachusetts Eye and Ear Infirmary, Harvard, USA.  Dr. Chris Baker is  Board Certified in Pediatrics and Emergency Medicine, currently working at a children’s hospital in the bay area. Founder of Aardvark, which commercialized a children’s line of nasal care products. Dylan Walker is senior-level marketing professional in the start-up medical device industry; Previously held positions in ear tech marketing at InSound Medical & Acclarent.Q: How are the two devices different?A: The main difference is that the Oto-Tip provides basic daily cleaning and the TEC HOME provides occasional deep cleaning. Q: Are the ear tips reusable?A: Yes.Q: How are the devices cleaned?A: For the Oto-Tip, you can detach the tip and wash it separate from the rest of the device. For the TEC HOME, you can detach the tip and the water container and wash them separately as well.Q: How are the devices powered?A: The Oto-Tip is powered by 1 AAA batteries and the TEC HOME comes with a charger similar to an electric toothbrush. Q: What are the approximate dimensions of the devices?A: The Oto-Tip dimensions are around 4" long and 1" diameter at the base. The TEC HOME dimensions are around 10" in height and 4" diameter at the base.MedCity News "a medical device to softens and remove ear wax, which can become more problematic as people age" FORBES "...provides a more efficient way to clear your ears." ABC "heats up the water to prevent dizziness..."Vision and Hearing News "...helped remove a quarter-sized calcified mass of earwax from his ear that had gone unnoticed by doctors as it had built up over time."USA TODAY (IN PRINT, March 2014)Questions or comments ...For anything you may want to know about Clear Ear or if you wish to get in touch with us, you can contact us at info@clearearinc.com

story:
Tourette Syndrome

  • Hello, my name is Jack Joseph Francis. I am an 18 year old boy from a quiet town called Welwyn Garden City, in England. UK.
  • I have suffered with Tourette Syndrome for my whole life, though was only diagnosed when I was 11 years old.

Tourette's syndrome (TS) is a disorder that causes me to make sounds, words (vocal tics) and have body movements (motor tics) that are beyond my control. Tics occur suddenly, may last from several seconds to minutes and have no meaning to myself.

In my words, it is living hell. It is extremely constant and tiring, as well as exceedingly annoying.

Most people with Tourette's syndrome have their own unique type and pattern of tics. Tics come and go over weeks and months. They also change from one type to another. Many people with Tourette's syndrome have episodes of tics that interfere with their daily activities.

I do suffer in life, I don't go out much due to the amount of people staring and giving me odd looks, it's really not nice. Though what I must always remember, is that there are people out in this world, so much far worse of than me, I am honestly just happy to be alive, have all my limbs, and healthy!

I also suffer with ADHD (attention deficit hyperactive disorder) and OCD (obsessive compulsive disorder) and extreme anxiety.

Deep Brain Stimulation (DBS)

Here I explain DBS and the perks and cons of having such surgery.

To go ahead and receive Deep Brain Stimulation, I need to raise at least $35,000. Unfortunately, I and my family are not the kind of people to have that kind of money.

If I do not reach my goal of $35,000, I will still go ahead and put every single penny of the money I receive towards this surgery, and that's a promise!

The Impact

The difference on my life from even such a small contribution would be incredible, every little helps, as they say. I will finally be able to walk the streets without feeling taunted, and humiliated by passers by, I will have a lot more self control of my tic's (that's if I still have them!) And a lot more self esteem. Tourette's really does impact on my life more than you'd think, and if you'd like to know more about it, please Google, 'Tourette Syndrome'.

Updates

$10000 - Official website released
$20000 - More than half of what is needed for the treatment
$35000 - Treatment fully funded thanks to all of you! <3

Other Ways You Can Help

If you have read this far without giving up on me, I praise you for your loyalty and commitment, simply for giving me a chance to explain the best I can.

If you cannot donate to help, then do not worry, please, please just spread the word about my campaign.

Thank you ever so much!

- Jack

      x

story:
Better Sleep will be released even if the $14,000 objective is not met. Your contribution will allow us to offer more content and features, hire part-time staff to accelerate the app's development and to invest in PR to let insomniacs of the world know about this project. Thank you for your support!

Tired, but unable to sleep

If you suffer from insomnia you are not alone: 10% to 12% of adults worldwide suffer from chronic insomnia.

You may be surprised to know that several studies have found that modern insomnia therapy is more efficient than sleeping pills.

Modern insomnia therapy works

Over a dozen clinical studies have clearly demonstrated that insomnia therapy is very efficient, even in cases of long term, persistent insomnia.

This brings up an important question: If insomnia therapy works so well, why do 10% to 12% of adults suffer from chronic insomnia, costing an estimated 92 billion to 107 billion US dollars, per year, in the USA alone?

The answer is simple: most people do not have access to insomnia treatment.

Access to insomnia treatment is limited

A majority of people do not have a sleep psychologist in their area. Also, treatment can be expensive. 

Insomnia therapy can be delivered by computer

We know from recent studies that computer-based insomnia therapy is very efficient, and we quickly realized that smartphones are an ideal means to provide insomnia therapy.

We created the Better Sleep app to bring the latest, most efficient insomnia treatment to anyone with a smartphone or tablet.

A project directed by Dr. Philippe Stenstrom

The Better Sleep team is led by Dr. Philippe Stenstrom, a sleep expert who has worked at Montreal’s world-renowned Center for Advanced Research in Sleep Medicine and at Harvard’s Center for Sleep and Cognition before working full time on developing the Better Sleep app. He received a Master’s degree and a Doctorate from the University of Montreal, specializing in sleep psychology.

Dr. Philippe Stenstrom has written and co-authored a number of articles on the topic of sleep in some of the world’s leading scientific journals, such as Sleep (the official publication of the American Academy of Sleep Medicine and the Sleep Research Society), the Journal of Sleep Research (the official publication of the European Sleep Research Society) and Nature. He has given numerous talks at the annual meetings of the Associated Professional Sleep Societies, at the conferences of the Canadian Sleep Society, and as an invited lecturer at the University of Montreal and at Harvard Medical School.

The Better Sleep app: making efficient insomnia treatment accessible


How Better Sleep works

Better Sleep uses a no-nonsense, evidence-based approach to insomnia treatment. Specifically, we are using a type of therapy called Cognitive-Behavioral therapy.  The Better Sleep app synthesizes 20 years of insomnia research, using treatments that have been proven to be most effective for insomnia.

With its clean and intuitive interface, Better Sleep provides modern insomnia therapy in a manner that is simple and easy to follow, taking 10 to 15 minutes each day.

Here are some of the features of the Better Sleep app:

-Insomnia Profile Builder

Every person’s insomnia is different. Better Sleep builds a personalized treatment program based on your needs. The app considers a large variety of factors, from your insomnia history, sleeping pills use (if any) and age, to sleep habits to and attitudes towards sleep. Better Sleep updates your treatment program to reflect your progress.

-Intelligent Scheduling  

Automatic scheduling so you always know what to do. Daily sessions and activities can be done at any time, and take about 10 to 15 minutes in total. Better Sleep is dynamic so it adapts when you skip a session or training activity.

-Sleep Diary

Tracks important sleep-related information. For example, the app automatically calculates sleep efficiency, an excellent measure of how well you are progressing.  The app can also track activities known to affect sleep, helping you become aware of what influences your sleep (and was does not), and to what extent.

-Relaxation Training

Relaxation is a skill. Proper relaxation requires training and is very useful in overcoming insomnia. Dr. Philippe Stenstrom guides you though number of proven relaxation techniques. For example, people who can easily visualize will profit from guided imagery sessions. Others may prefer progressive muscle relaxation. All sessions are guided by Dr. Philippe Stenstrom and recorded in a professional studio.

-Interactive Therapy Sessions

In these sessions, you will learn new skills to help you overcome insomnia. Includes audio, video and interactive content.

-Topic Sessions

Dr. Philippe Stenstrom covers a variety of topics concerning insomnia and how to become a better sleeper.

-Sleep Scheduling

Sleep Scheduling uses information from your sleep diary, in addition to information you enter concerning your ideal sleep/wake times, to calculate a schedule that limits the time you spend in bed.

This is often considered the “boot camp” of insomnia treatment: it can be challenging at times, but it gives excellent results. An interactive questionnaire will help you determine if this is a good time for you to start this optional procedure.   

-Support Sessions, Milestones and Progress Reports

Support sessions and visual representations of your progress will keep you motivated during the course of the therapy.

Better Sleep needs your support

Better Sleep is 100% independent and will be supported entirely by users, their friends and families, and donations. 

We want to keep Better Sleep free of industry and business investors. This way, all decisions concerning Better Sleep will be made based exclusively on feedback from health practitioners, sleep specialists, sleep researchers, and importantly, those suffering from insomnia. Our only obligation, our only priority, will be to help those suffering from insomnia.  In order to stay independent, we need your help.

After a year of self-funded development, this IndieGoGo project is being launched to get the app through the final stages of production and into the hands of insomnia sufferers around the world. 

Better Sleep has the potential to revolutionize insomnia treatment. Accessible, mobile-based therapy for insomnia will help thousands of people suffering from insomnia. With your support, we can make this happen.

Your Rewards

To thank you for your support, you will receive the Better Sleep app as soon as it is released (the app can be given as a gift) with a donation of $5. You can get an early release of the app, before it is available to the public, with a donation of $10 or more. A donation of $20 or more will immortalize your name on the app and on the Better Sleep web site.

Larger contributions will get you some truly unique perks, such as personalized guided imagery recordings and one-on-one therapy sessions with Dr. Philippe Stenstrom over Skype or phone.

Maximizing accessibility

Here are some of the ways we are trying to get Better Sleep to as many people as possible.

Personal Computers: For those without mobile phones, we are developing a Better Sleep program adapted for personal computers (PC and Mac). While desktop computers do not have some of the advantages of mobile phones, all essential features of the treatment program are present.

More Languages: Better sleep is currently being developed in English and French.

In line with our objective of accessible insomnia treatment, funds beyond $14,000 will go towards translating the app into as many languages as possible, starting with Japanese, Chinese, Spanish and Russian.

Questions & Answers

-When will Better Sleep be released?

Better Sleep will be released October 2013.

-How long does the therapy last?

The treatment program lasts around 4 to 5 weeks, depending on the participant’s progress and the initial severity and persistence of insomnia symptoms.

-How much time will the therapy take daily?

Most people should expect to spend about 10 to 15 mins per day on therapy-related activities.

-I do not have a smart phone. Can I still use Better Sleep?

Better Sleep will be available on desktops and laptops that use Windows, and Macs.

-Does the app replace a sleep psychologist?

The best treatment for insomnia is a sleep psychologist. We created Better Sleep because most people do not have access to a sleep psychologist.

-Will this app cure my insomnia?

Better Sleep will significantly reduce the severity of your insomnia.  It is important to have realistic expectations. Never having insomnia ever again is not a realistic objective, because most people experience insomnia from time to time. Getting restful sleep on most nights is a realistic objective. Better Sleep will help you reach that objective.

-Is this app only for people suffering from chronic insomnia?

This app can help anyone to sleep better. The app will benefit “good sleepers” by reducing event-triggered insomnia sometimes caused by such things as pain (injury, surgery, etc.) and anxiety (evaluations, stressful life events, etc.). Better Sleep’s insomnia profile builder will propose a program specifically tailored to a “good sleeper’s” specific concerns and objectives.

Links:

-Studies demonstrating that insomnia therapy is more efficient than sleeping pills:

In young and middle aged adult: http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/15451764

In older adults: http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/18417099

-A study demonstrating that insomnia therapy can be efficiently delivered via a computer: http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/22654196

  

Help us by spreading the word!
Thank you!

story:
Isn't it time you started using something better than bristles on a stick to clean your teeth and gums?

We think so.

We have created something really special. Something that will make big toothbrush brands like Oral B and Sonicare nervous. It is also something that should make you very, very happy. You see, when you brush your teeth, the most problematic areas, when not cleaned very well, are at and below the gum line. This is problematic because most cavities and gum inflammation form in these areas and can put you at risk of serious health conditions. It is medically recognized that inflammation causing infection in gums is linked to heart disease, diabetes, and all sorts of other bad stuff. 

Paul A. Scheier D.M.D. (he's a dentist) spent quite a long time in his dental practice thinking about and experimenting with how to make brushing easier and more effective. He came up with EVOLVE, the smart brush that will clean under the gum line with virtually zero effort from you. 

read the study here.

What's unique about EVOLVE?

It has three brush heads that are attached to an elastic membrane...


Those brush heads bend when you apply pressure, and clean the teeth and gum line area simultaneously. No buttons. No voodoo.

Pretty neat, eh?

We made a lot of prototypes, we performed a lot of tests, and it truly does clean better than the best-selling brushes on the market.

Now we need your help to bring the brush into the world and help a lot of people avoid a lot of serious health issues linked to gum inflammation. Help us make this unique dental tool a reality while also ensuring healthier teeth and gums for yourself, your friends, and your family!


To begin production, we need $30k. To have better dental hygiene, you need EVOLVE.

See where we're going with this?

Production molds are expensive. Very expensive (just about $30k, not even counting the first production run!). But we believe in our product and we think it really makes a difference (yes, we use it ourselves). So, without further ado, here's how you can help:

You can (and we would really like you to) pre-purchase the brush during our campaign, and have it delivered to you before it enters the market. We will even throw in a free travel case (it's TSA proof).

Every dollar we get goes to help offset the cost of production.


It is not a gimmick. It does not vibrate at supersonic speeds. It does not have 25 different types of bristles. It just cleans your teeth and gums at the same time, and does so better than other best-selling brushes on the market.

After using EVOLVE, feeling and seeing the difference, it will become an indispensable tool in your hygiene arsenal. Our goal is to bring you, and the world, better dental tools to support better overall health. So, in return, please help us make it happen. Share this campaign with your family and friends.


Goals


In honor of Dr. Scheier's grandson, Oliver, who has a rare form of muscular dystrophy, for every brush, a $1 donation will be given to the Maywood, New Jersey Muscular Dystrophy Association (MDA) Chapter, in support of research for a cure to this debilitating disease that affects many of the world's children.


Our Supporters



Timeline


  • Campaign ends on October 11th, 2014.
  • We create the production mold by mid November, 2014.
  • The first production run is complete by early December, 2014.
  • We get the brushes by late December, 2014.
  • You get yours by New Year's (yay!).
  • Everyone else gets theirs by mid February at the earliest.

Some extra info

Shipping is included for U.S. only. If you need shipping outside the U.S., please write to us and we will figure it out.
You can keep in touch via our website: http://evolveoralcare.com or our facebook page: http://facebook.com/evolvetoothbrush


Frequently Asked Questions

What inspired Dr. Scheier to enter the business side of the dental world and invent the EVOLVE Toothbrush?
Dr. Scheier was inspired by frustrations in seeing his patients having difficulty cleaning their teeth, especially at and below the gum line, which can lead to periodontal disease.
After many years practicing dentistry it became clear to Dr. Scheier that dental care technology needed to evolve. He believes there needs to be an easy-to-use solution that helps people brush their teeth and gums more thoroughly. It is Dr. Scheier’s observation that “most toothbrushes are little more than bristles on a stick” and he is concerned that studies show that most people neglect at least one key area while brushing.

What makes the EVOLVE Toothbrush different from other toothbrushes?
It is a manual toothbrush with moving parts. Patented triple flexing action makes it effortless to clean multiple surfaces of teeth, simultaneously, especially at and below the gum line.
The center and outer bristles heads are embedded in an elastic membrane. This enables the outer bristles to flex in and grab the tooth at the gum line, when gentle pressure of the center head is applied to teeth. Because of this unique design, users can clean multiple surfaces of their teeth and gums at the same time, with minimal effort.
Its ergonomic design makes it easy for people living with compromised conditions and varying abilities, such as Arthritis, Parkinson’s disease, Multiple Sclerosis, Muscular Dystrophy and Cerebral Palsy to not only easily clean their teeth, but also effectively clean areas of their gums, where inflammation and gum disease can form.

How is the EVOLVE Toothbrush better than other brushes?
The EVOLVE Toothbrush has been proven in laboratory testing at the University of Pennsylvania to be superior at cleaning at and below the gum line vs. other best-selling manual and power brushes on the market.

How did Dr. Scheier come up with the brand name?
By using the EVOLVE Toothbrush to clean teeth and gums, consumer thinking would “EVOLVE” from the old fashioned technology of toothbrushes “bristles on a stick” to his new, innovative triple flexing technology.

How did Dr. Scheier come up with the design of the EVOLVE Toothbrush?
The design inspiration actually came about when Dr. Scheier’s wife was playing with their beautiful St. Bernard, Bridget. She had a toy ball that was covered with fingerlike projections. When Bridget bit down on the ball, the projections bent in to grab her teeth. The idea for EVOLVE's flexing technology was born.

How can the EVOLVE Toothbrush help transform an oral health routine?
It has been medically recognized that there is a link between gum disease and systemic diseases and conditions, including heart disease, diabetes, stroke, complications in pregnancy and even some forms of cancer. Because the EVOLVE Toothbrush makes it effortless and more precise to clean teeth and gums, users of the brush will improve their oral as well as overall health and well-being.
It helps make brushing teeth and gums a no brainer of sorts – “the EVOLVE Toothbrush is a smart brush that knows exactly what to do even if you don’t.”

Where can individuals go to buy the EVOLVE Toothbrush?
For the time being only on Indiegogo. The EVOLVE campaign is to secure capital to build production molds for the toothbrush.
After that, the EVOLVE Toothbrush will be available for purchase online and hopefully in selected specialty stores.

He came up with EVOLVE, the smart brush that will clean under the gum line with virtually zero effort from you. read the study here.What's unique about EVOLVE?It has three brush heads that are attached to an elastic membrane...Those brush heads bend when you apply pressure, and clean the teeth and gum line area simultaneously. No buttons. No voodoo.Pretty neat, eh?We made a lot of prototypes, we performed a lot of tests, and it truly does clean better than the best-selling brushes on the market.Now we need your help to bring the brush into the world and help a lot of people avoid a lot of serious health issues linked to gum inflammation. Help us make this unique dental tool a reality while also ensuring healthier teeth and gums for yourself, your friends, and your family!To begin production, we need $30k. To have better dental hygiene, you need EVOLVE.See where we're going with this?Production molds are expensive. Very expensive (just about $30k, not even counting the first production run!). But we believe in our product and we think it really makes a difference (yes, we use it ourselves). So, without further ado, here's how you can help:You can (and we would really like you to) pre-purchase the brush during our campaign, and have it delivered to you before it enters the market. We will even throw in a free travel case (it's TSA proof).Every dollar we get goes to help offset the cost of production.It is not a gimmick. It does not vibrate at supersonic speeds. It does not have 25 different types of bristles. It just cleans your teeth and gums at the same time, and does so better than other best-selling brushes on the market.
After using EVOLVE, feeling and seeing the difference, it will become an indispensable tool in your hygiene arsenal. Our goal is to bring you, and the world, better dental tools to support better overall health. So, in return, please help us make it happen. Share this campaign with your family and friends.GoalsIn honor of Dr. Scheier's grandson, Oliver, who has a rare form of muscular dystrophy, for every brush, a $1 donation will be given to the Maywood, New Jersey Muscular Dystrophy Association (MDA) Chapter, in support of research for a cure to this debilitating disease that affects many of the world's children.Our SupportersTimeline
Campaign ends on October 11th, 2014.
We create the production mold by mid November, 2014.
The first production run is complete by early December, 2014.
We get the brushes by late December, 2014.
You get yours by New Year's (yay!).
Everyone else gets theirs by mid February at the earliest.
Some extra infoShipping is included for U.S. only. If you need shipping outside the U.S., please write to us and we will figure it out.You can keep in touch via our website: http://evolveoralcare.com or our facebook page: http://facebook.com/evolvetoothbrush
Frequently Asked QuestionsWhat inspired Dr. Scheier to enter the business side of the dental world and invent the EVOLVE Toothbrush? 

Dr. Scheier was inspired by frustrations in seeing his patients having difficulty cleaning their teeth, especially at and below the gum line, which can lead to periodontal disease. 

After many years practicing dentistry it became clear to Dr. Scheier that dental care technology needed to evolve. He believes there needs to be an easy-to-use solution that helps people brush their teeth and gums more thoroughly. It is Dr. Scheier’s observation that “most toothbrushes are little more than bristles on a stick” and he is concerned that studies show that most people neglect at least one key area while brushing.
What makes the EVOLVE Toothbrush different from other toothbrushes?

It is a manual toothbrush with moving parts. Patented triple flexing action makes it effortless to clean multiple surfaces of teeth, simultaneously, especially at and below the gum line. 

The center and outer bristles heads are embedded in an elastic membrane. This enables the outer bristles to flex in and grab the tooth at the gum line, when gentle pressure of the center head is applied to teeth. Because of this unique design, users can clean multiple surfaces of their teeth and gums at the same time, with minimal effort.

Its ergonomic design makes it easy for people living with compromised conditions and varying abilities, such as Arthritis, Parkinson’s disease, Multiple Sclerosis, Muscular Dystrophy and Cerebral Palsy to not only easily clean their teeth, but also effectively clean areas of their gums, where inflammation and gum disease can form.
How is the EVOLVE Toothbrush better than other brushes?

The EVOLVE Toothbrush has been proven in laboratory testing at the University of Pennsylvania to be superior at cleaning at and below the gum line vs. other best-selling manual and power brushes on the market. 
How did Dr. Scheier come up with the brand name?
By using the EVOLVE Toothbrush to clean teeth and gums, consumer thinking would “EVOLVE” from the old fashioned technology of toothbrushes “bristles on a stick” to his new, innovative triple flexing technology.
 How did Dr. Scheier come up with the design of the EVOLVE Toothbrush?

The design inspiration actually came about when Dr. Scheier’s wife was playing with their beautiful St. Bernard, Bridget. She had a toy ball that was covered with fingerlike projections. When Bridget bit down on the ball, the projections bent in to grab her teeth. The idea for EVOLVE's flexing technology was born.
How can the EVOLVE Toothbrush help transform an oral health routine?

It has been medically recognized that there is a link between gum disease and systemic diseases and conditions, including heart disease, diabetes, stroke, complications in pregnancy and even some forms of cancer. Because the EVOLVE Toothbrush makes it effortless and more precise to clean teeth and gums, users of the brush will improve their oral as well as overall health and well-being. 

It helps make brushing teeth and gums a no brainer of sorts – “the EVOLVE Toothbrush is a smart brush that knows exactly what to do even if you don’t.”
 Where can individuals go to buy the EVOLVE Toothbrush?

For the time being only on Indiegogo. The EVOLVE campaign is to secure capital to build production molds for the toothbrush. 

After that, the EVOLVE Toothbrush will be available for purchase online and hopefully in selected specialty stores.

story: Hello, I am Hope Smith I live in Bristol, Va. My son has Cystic Fibrosis and lately a long hospital stay out of town, life support and a hypoglycemic seizure has left me unemployed. It is just Adam and I and we are within weeks of losing the car, and being homeless with no where to go. He is also on tube feedings for 12hrs a day. I'm scared to leave him alone but have been looking for work with no luck. Praying someone can find it in there heart to help. He suffers enough I would like to be able to keep a place to live at the very least.

He suffers enough I would like to be able to keep a place  to live at the very least.

story:
A family friend had a life changing accident that has effected his family forever. I had been  wanting to do something to try to help raise awareness and some much needed funds to help them. 


I have been considering donating my hair to the little princesses trust for some time now, they are a fantastic charity who make wigs for children with cancer. 
I am going to have my hair cut the 25th March 2015.
So I thought I would set this page up to try help both good causes.

 Please if you you can donate anything or share this page your help and kindness will be so greatly appreciated. 
Here is Danny's story written by his son: 

Hi, my name is Vick (34yrs old). I am a self employed driving instructor living and working in London UK. And as many of you at my age, I only have one living parent; my mother died of stage 4 ovarian cancer which spread to her brain in 2009.

This campaign is an attempt to raise funds to cover the substantial medical costs (including an air ambulance service use) incurred over the last six weeks (Just before Christmas 2014) for my dad who has tragically suffered a very serious injury to his spinal column, leaving him without the use of his arms and legs and currently on a ventilator to keep him alive.

My dad (Danny, a UK citizen for 40yrs and only 66yrs old) has recently been flown back to the UK after being diagnosed with quadriplegia (no use of arms or legs).
He flew to his place of birth (Mauritius) to visit his very sick mother and to deal with some paperwork. His trip was to be short (only 8 days).

After a sleep, on his first day there after a tiring 14 hour flight he woke and got up from bed and fainted.
When he fell he fractured his spine and compressed his spinal column from his neck down through the vertebrae that deals with his respiratory system.

2 hours before being discovered his condition worsened and deteriorated further during the additional 2 hours it took for the ambulance to arrive.
After being neglected in a state hospital for 5 days unwashed and uncared for his brother had him transferred to a private clinic while he still had a small amount of dignity left.

An operation was performed (at the private clinic) however, this operation should have taken place within 6 hours of the accident and by now was 6 days overdue.
At this point his respiratory system started to fail and he was put on a ventilator to breathe for him.

By now the operation (£20,000) was more about saving his life than it was to treat his quadriplegia and while saving his life was a success, the chances of recovering from this condition have become very slim. 

We (my brother and I) initially paid daily for the hospital (approx £1,000 a day), staff and all medical equipment which amounted to around £65,000. 
Much of dad's life savings will have paid for the bulk of the costs because, unfortunately he had not taken out travel insurance. As you can see the costs incurred are huge.
My dad does not have a living will (nobody expects the worse I guess) so the stress involved trying to access his life savings and pension was beyond anything I could have ever expected. This tragedy became all about paying the bills and having no time to care for and be there to support my dad in his time of need.

We tried so hard to get him transported to the UK as quickly as possible and into our free health care system but, we came up against obstacles at every turn.

At first he wasn't stable enough for flight because of the amount of oxygen needed to keep him alive and the use of dopamine aboard a flight is prohibited.
When stable an air ambulance was possible but would have cost in excess of £75,000 something that was beyond our budget even with access to my dads life savings.

There was a commercial flight option which is what we finally managed to achieve (costing £25,000), after overcoming many obstacles and jumping through hoops.
First of all the only airline to fly nonstop and has the capability of transporting a stretcher case is Air Mauritius however, their list of approved medical equipment was a decade out of date and they would not approve the UK medical team's equipment on board.

A doctor from the private clinic went beyond the call of duty and arranged meetings with Air Mauritius and the flight regulatory commission and got them to accept and approve the updated list of equipment and not just a temporary measure for my dad, but for all future cases! 
Now all of this took many weeks, we were taking time off from work and my brother had to leave his 18 month old son at home while we traveled across the world to help arrange things in a developing Third World country where things are very slow moving.

My dad is now back in the UK, it has been a week now (1st Feb 2015) and is receiving NHS care. We have all but depleted my dads accounts and are looking into selling his house to help cover costs.

We are not sure what future care will look like and I am hoping that some of you reading this might be able to help us with information regarding ongoing treatment and rehabilitation and possibly the funding of such services.  I am assuming that we will eventually need equipment to transport him and a place for him to live that has been adapted for his condition.

For those of you not able to contribute financially, maybe you know people that can help? He needs a specialised hospital bed in a hospital able to deal with his condition (dad is currently in a general hospital ICU). Maybe you know a surgical consultant who can check his condition and maybe make suggestions to us, the family? Or anything else that you can think of that might help.

If this campaign is not for you, I understand but please take something away with you that we learnt the hard way. Always, always get travel insurance! It may seem simple but you never know and it's a very small cost in comparison if the worse does happen. Also you may have a WILL all ready to go in the case of your death but, get a LIVING WILL! this will help those family members in a situation if you are rendered incapable of moving and talking.

Finally, thank you for increasing awareness of our situation, and all help given. We are eternally grateful.

Always, always get travel insurance! It may seem simple but you never know and it's a very small cost in comparison if the worse does happen. Finally, thank you for increasing awareness of our situation, and all help given. We are eternally grateful.

story:
My Mom's Story

Hi. My name is Rebecca Vasquez. I was a care-free teen a few months ago, but that all changed in a split second. On February 1, 2014, my mom, Issa Vasquez, was diagnosed was stage IV (4) Breast Cancer with a metastasis (the growth of one or more tumors at a time in a different part of the body) to her neck. In summary, she has the most severe stage of Breast Cancer plus 5 tumors near her throat. And on top of all that, we found out that my mom lost an amazing job offer due to her cancer.  This news hit me like a freight train. It was too much too bear at the time. I now knew what this distressing disease meant for my family. Why, you ask? When I about five years old, my mom was diagnosed with stage III (3) Breast Cancer for the first time. Fortunately, she had undergone Chemotherapy, Radiation, and several surgeries. I remember vaguely that my mom always put on a wig to hide her head. These last months, she had been under the care of her Oncologist using a hormone therapy and monitoring closely the tumors' growth. Her Doctor was pleased to see that my mom's tumors were at the same rate. But, my mom was not satisfied with her tumors being "just the same". So, she did some research, and came across the 
Hallelujah Diet ( a diet that promotes veganism and juicing). Naturally, she began to try this lifestyle. Not only did she lose 70 lbs. and her voice recovered, the tumors were not growing. It seemed as if everything was going the way we all had planned, but life has a funny way of surprising us. During her last PET SCAN, she found out that she has a new tumor and she only has a life expectancy of two years if she goes through Chemotherapy and Radiation. The Oncologist was clear that a cure cannot be offered anymore. 

LA HISTORIA DE MI MAMA

Hola . Mi nombre es Rebecca Vásquez . Yo era una adolescente sin preocupaciones hace unos meses, pero todo eso cambió en una fracción de segundo . El 1 de febrero de 2014, mi mamá, Issa Vásquez, fue diagnosticada con etapa IV ( 4 ) de cáncer de mama con metástasis ( el crecimiento de uno o más tumores en un momento en una parte diferente del cuerpo) en su cuello . En resumen, ella tiene la etapa más grave de cáncer de mama más 5 tumores cerca de la garganta . Y encima de todo eso, nos enteramos de que mi mamá perdió una oferta increíble de trabajo debido a su cáncer. Esta noticia me golpeó como un tren de carga . Era demasiado, para soportar en el momento. Esta vez si supe lo que significa esta enfermedad angustiante para mi familia . ¿Por qué , usted preguntará? Cuando yo tenía cinco años de edad, mi madre fue diagnosticada con estado III ( 3 ) de cáncer de mama por primera vez. Afortunadamente, se sometió a quimioterapia, radiación, y varias cirugías . Recuerdo vagamente que mi mamá siempre se ponía una peluca para ocultar su cabeza. Estos últimos meses, ella había estado bajo el cuidado de su oncólogo utilizando una terapia hormonal y seguía de cerca el avance desu enfermedad. Su doctor le complació ver que los tumores de mi mamá No habían crecido. Pero, mi mamá no estaba satisfecha, ella investigó, y se encontró con la dieta Hallelujah (una dieta que promueve el veganismo y los jugos de frutas y verduras naturales). Paulatinamente, ella comenzó a probar este estilo de vida. No sólo rebajó 70 libras, sino que su voz se recuperó, y los tumores no crecían . Parecía como si todo iba por buen camino, pero en el último PET SCAN, se enteró de que ella tiene un nuevo tumor y ella sólo tiene una esperanza de vida de dos años, si ella pasa por la quimioterapia y la radiación. El Oncologo fue claro en que no ofrece una cura sino solamente alargar su vida por dos años.


What We Need 

My mom had been looking for an alternative to Chemotherapy and Radiation, and there is a good chance that by being treated at the Oasis of Hope Clinic in Mexico, she will get better--or at least stay with us for more than the expectancy of two years. The entire therapy at the Oasis of Hope (which is where my mom will be going to) is $35,000. It's an enormous amount, but my mother's life doesn't have a price tag. Although baking cookies at home (that is what I'm doing to help) is my contribution, we still need  your help. 
LO QUE NECESITAMOS Mi mamá ha estado buscando una alternativa a la quimioterapia y la radiación, y hay una buena probabilidad de que al ser tratada en Oasis de Esperanza en México, ella pudiera mejorar - o por lo menos permanecer con nosotros durante más de la esperanza de dos años. Toda la terapia en Oasis de Esperanza es de $35.000. Es una cantidad enorme, pero la vida de mi madre no tiene precio . Aunque hornear galletas en casa (que es lo que estoy haciendo para ayudar) es mi contribución, todavía necesitamos su ayuda.

    The Impact

    Two years is not enough time to see my mom live. If she undergoes with Chemotherapy, Radiation, surgeries, etc., she will not see her only daughter grow up. She won't see me graduate high school, go off to college, and live my life to the fullest. My mom, will also not see my older brother, Daniel , graduate college, get married, start a family, and become an old man. Instead, all she will see us do is helping her out in the hospital. I cannot stress this enough, two years is not enough time to see my mother live. But, if she goes to the Oasis of Hope clinic in Mexico, she will see me do all the things I've listed and more. The money that you hopefully will donate will impact not only her life, but everyone around her. Even $10 will help her immensely. 
    EL IMPACTO Dos años no es tiempo suficiente para ver a mi mamá vivir. Si ella toma l quimioterapia, radiación, cirugías, etc. , no va a ver a su hija crecer. Ella no va a verme graduarme de la escuela secundaria, ir a la universidad, y vivir mi vida al máximo . Mi mami, también no verá a mi hermano mayor, Daniel , graduarse de la universidad, casarse, formar una familia , y llegar a ser un anciano . En su lugar, todo lo que ella nos verá hacer es ayudarla en el hospital . No puedo enfatizar esto lo suficiente, dos años no es tiempo suficiente para ver a mi mami viva. Pero, si ella va a la clínica Oasis de Esperanza en México, hay una buena posibilidad de que ella me vea hacer todas las cosas que he enumerado y mucho más. El dinero que espero que usted done impactará no sólo su vida, sino todo el mundo a su alrededor . Incluso $ 10.00 ayudarían inmensamente .

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you cannot donate, don't fret! You can spread the word by sharing Issa Vasquez's story using the hashtag #saveissa. Thank you for reading. 

      With love, 
      Rebecca Vasquez

      OTRAS MANERAS QUE USTED PUEDE AYUDAR Si no puede donar, no se preocupe! Puede correr la voz al compartir la historia de mi mamá usando el hashtag #saveissa . Gracias por tomar el tiempo para leer nuestra historia. Con amor , Rebecca Vásquez

The money that you hopefully will donate will impact not only her life, but everyone around her. Even $10 will help her immensely. 

EL IMPACTO 
Dos años no es tiempo suficiente para ver a mi mamá vivir. Si ella toma l quimioterapia, radiación, cirugías, etc. , no va a ver a su hija crecer. Ella no va a verme graduarme de la escuela secundaria, ir a la universidad, y vivir mi vida al máximo . Mi mami, también no verá a mi hermano mayor, Daniel , graduarse de la universidad, casarse, formar una familia , y llegar a ser un anciano . En su lugar, todo lo que ella nos verá  hacer es ayudarla en el hospital . No puedo enfatizar esto lo suficiente, dos años no es tiempo suficiente para ver a mi mami viva. Pero, si ella va a la clínica Oasis de Esperanza en México,  hay una buena posibilidad de que ella me vea hacer todas las cosas que he enumerado y mucho más. El dinero que espero que usted done impactará no sólo su vida, sino todo el mundo a su alrededor . Incluso $ 10.00 ayudarían inmensamente .


  Other Ways You Can Help
If you cannot donate, don't fret! You can spread the word by sharing Issa Vasquez's story using the hashtag #saveissa. Thank you for reading. 
With love, 
Rebecca Vasquez
OTRAS MANERAS QUE USTED PUEDE AYUDAR

Si no puede donar, no se preocupe! Puede correr la voz al compartir la historia de mi mamá usando el hashtag #saveissa . Gracias por tomar el tiempo para leer nuestra historia.

Con amor ,
Rebecca Vásquez

story:
Why should I give you money?

All the proceeds go directly to the Epilepsy Foundation Central And South Texas.

How does the Beard Battle work?

You vote, with your dollars, for me to either keep my beard or shave it.

Which ever team raises the most money wins and I do as they wish.

What do I get for giving you money?

Piece of mind that you're helping people the fight to stop seizures, find a cure and overcome the challenges created by epilepsy. 

You also get to have a little fun competing with your friends and family to see what happens to me, so we all really win here.

Why did you choose the Epilepsy Foundation Central And South Texas?

I had epilepsy as a child.

I had my first seizure when I was two, my last when I was nine.

I didn't have my first normal EEG until I was twelve.

It took me ten years, but I'm living proof that we can win the fight against epilepsy.

How else can I help?

  • Learn about epilepsy
  • Share this campaign on all social media outlets

Where did you get the idea?

One of my all-time favorite football players, Brett Keisel, holds an event every year where he shaves off his beard and all the proceeds go to the Children's Hospital of Pittsburgh of UPMC.  He looks a lot like this before:


"Keisel closeup" by Sodexo USA - https://www.flickr.com/photos/sodexousa/5417414332/in/set-72157625852923059/. Licensed under CC BY 2.0 via Wikimedia Commons.

story:
Short Summary

I lost my wonderful, vibrant, silly, caring aunt Elaine to cancer on August 26th, 2013. Elaine chose the Dr. Bob Kemp Hospice House as the place that would best support her end-of-life needs. Our family couldn't have asked for a better, more comfortable or caring environment for Elaine during that time. The hospice house is donation-based,
and all services are provided at no cost to clients or their families. As their website states, hospice is about celebrating life and quality of living--something in which Elaine, myself, and my family firmly believe. I miss Elaine deeply and constantly--and in an effort to turn some of that grief outward, give back to those who helped our family during this difficult time, and ensure that such end-of-life services are available to those going forward, I will be running the Whidbey Half Marathon on April 13th, 2014, in Elaine's memory and with the goal of raising funds and awareness for hospice care. 

Funding & Logistics

My goal is to raise $100 for every mile I run. All money raised will go directly to the Dr. Bob Kemp Hospice House in Hamilton, Ontario in Elaine's name. I encourage you to read more about their services here.

If you are interested in the course I will be running, you can find details about the event here. I will make sure to update you all on the race and day-of events. I will be running with my partner and a handful of dear friends. Laughter, reflection, mud-covered shoes, and a few tears are definites, as are lots of photographs. I look forward to sharing the experience with you all, and most importantly, holding Elaine with me as I run what promises to be a beautiful course. 

Other Ways You Can Help

In lieu of monetary donations, I happily accept well-wishes or a pause in your day to take a minute to tell those around you that they are appreciated and loved. The last time I saw Elaine, she was dancing down her street back toward her home. She truly both lived and loved her life and took time to pause and reflect on the little things. If nothing else, I encourage you all to do the same.

story:
Hair Walk: The Movement is...

The signature charity fundraiser of Sassy Cat Promotions, a nonprofit organization that supports other community do-gooders. To raise awareness and funds for a cause of action, SCP will produce a tri-event charity fundraiser that is composed of the Pink Tie Charity Auction, the HeadHunterz Competition and Hair Walk: The Movement.

This year, SCP has partnered with the South Carolina Oncology Associates (SCOA) Cares Foundation and the Palmetto Health Foundation to fight cancer with STYLE by raising $50,000. The SCOA Cares Foundation mission is to provide assistance to uninsured and underinsured cancer patients with services like:

  • the retail pharmacy voucher program
  • patient transportation program
  • educational classes and workshops
  • support classes and workshops

The Palmetto Health Foundation supports hospitals that offer an ever increasing array of services targeted to meet specific community needs. The Palmetto Health Center ensures that the cancer centers that it supports maintain a level of excellence with new programs, services and equipment. 

 

At the Pink Tie Charity Auction...

Well known men of Richland County and the surrounding areas will fashionably join together to wear pink ties to say, "Real men wear pink," in honor and remembrance of those affected by breast cancer. Via the Pink Tie Charity Auction, SCP seeks to raise the $50,000 that will be donated to the SCOA Cares and Palmetto Health Foundation.

 

The HeadHunterz Competition and Hair Walk....

The other events include the HeadHunterz Competition in which cosmetology students from various South Carolina schools will compete by making wigs to be judged by local news personalities and cosmetology professionals. Each school will have a team to represent them at the October finale event, Hair Walk: The Movement. During the finale, a high-energy hair and fashion show, SCP will hosts local businesses, new personalities, designers, retailers and award-winning hair stylists.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $50,000 for SCOA Cares Foundation and the Palmetto Health Foundation. When you purchase Macy's Shop for a Cause $5 savings pass, the $5 will be donated to the foundations. For the savings pass, you will receive:

  • 25% off regular, sales and clearance clothing.
  • 10% off electronics, furniture, mattresses and area rugs.

The savings passes will be distributed from Aug. 14 to Aug. 24. August 24 is the only day these passes can be used.


However, we will continue to raise funds via Indiegogo until Friday, Sept. 20. For your donation, you will receive joy from knowing that you helped to bring comfort to a person affected with cancer. The Pink Tie Charity Auction and the Indiegogo proceeds will be presented to the SCOA Cares Foundation at the Hair Walk: The Movement finale event on Sat. Oct. 5 at the Columbia Metropolitan Convention Center. If you are interested in seeing the presentation of your donation, tickets are available at www.hairwalk.org.

If we don't meet the $50,000 goal, all of the money raised will still be donated to SCOA Cares Foundation and the Palmetto Health Foundation.

 

The Impact

According to Cancer.org, 1 in 8 American women and 1 in 1000 American men will develop breast cancer; 1 in 3 Americans will develop cancer in their lifetime.

Your contribution will help the SCOA Cares Foundation and Palmetto Health Fondation to provide assistance to many more patients through service programs and clinical research. It will directly affect the patients and their family's quality of life, which should be as comfortable as possible as they battle cancer.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate, please share this campaign with at least eight people through social media links listed below or the Indiegogo shortcut link: igg.me/at/IWalkHAIR.

Join #HWTheMovement.

I walk hair. Do you walk hair. We will walk hair to help find the cure.

story:
It starts with an Ah-Ha!

For most of my adult life I've been studying alternative health, nutrition, and personal training; in more recent years, I began to explore energy work and mind-body techniques.

It happened on a day like any other day: I woke up, eyes wide, and with an idea that I sensed would  help people in a way never done before. 

This idea if successful could emerge as an entire system of training and movement therapy with unprecedented speed and efficiency! This system may then eventually become a new academy that people around the world could study and bring to their communities, and lives all over will be the better for it!

A project for health and happiness

For years, I've participated in leading edge academies such as the CHEK Institute, NASM, the Yuen Method, and more. Each of these wonderful schools of thought have helped thousands if not millions across the world; each of these schools also have a very unique approach to fitness, health and well-being.

I could see the individual pieces in my mind scattered about. Until now, the lore of these schools have been used as tools for the circumstance (a situation calls for a hammer, well, I have a hammer; and if it calls for a screwdriver, I have that too); but that aforementioned "Ah-Ha!" if done right, could be the ultimate Swiss army knife of life-improvement!

I have this great theory--abundant in creativity and possibility, but lacking in information/data. Here's a brief breakdown:

  • The money that I've estimated for this project would go to continuing education with select academies including the CHEK Institute, the Yuen Method, Tai Chi and related Eastern energy works, start up costs, and a few needed supplies.
  • Once the continuing education is complete to the degree necessary that I have that missing data I need; then comes the fun part... I'll be taking it to the field, experimenting on volunteers, building case studies, and finally bringing it to the public.
  • Then there would be data and lofty proof which would be the bedrock for a new, teachable system. This system would then be made available to the world to those willing to learn and become certified in the method.
  • I'm already a fairly accomplished natural health professional and trainer, and for your contributions, I'd love to share the best of what I know to help further your health and well-being.
  • And if I am unable to completely or mostly fund this project through the contributions hereby the end, I will donate all of it to the Weston A. Price Foundation, Alley Cat Allies, and Vitamin Angels.

The Impact

I have seen and worked with so many people that are needlessly in pain or are living a lesser quality of life on account of body image issues or restrictions in their movement. There are great tools already out there in the world, but what I have in mind will hasten results and dramatically increase the efficacy of training and movement reconditioning.

  • There is good movement and then there is extraordinary movement. Movement is life! My predecessors were astounding pioneers that developed something that truly helped countless people--and now, with a little bit of open mindedness, patience, and creativity, thousands more could benefit from what may develop from this project.
  • I'm a trainer that has always believed that there is the "Science of Training" and the "Art of Training;" up to this point in my life, I have successfully united these principles and have served my public with that knowledge. At the end of this project, even if my theories don't gel, it will only further my already high competencies to help people and possibly even you.
  • I foresee a completely new academy emerging from this theory! This academy would not be another school of how to do a squat or a bench press, but rather how to "rewire" the neurological or mind-body orientation that strengthens or weakens the system in dynamic, functional movement without the tendency towards lengthy, repetitive rituals born of qualified guessing---in other words, kind of awesome stuff!

Risks & Challenges

The truth is, I'm operating on an inspired thought and a theory that to my knowledge hasn't been tested before. Is there a risk to that? Of course... I could go through all the motions to try to pioneer something great, and ultimately have no "Swiss army knife" at the end of it all... But in the name of optimism, I'd still have exceptional tools that can help many people in familiar ways. That's the goal here, help people.

I've been in the industry long enough to know many people more brilliant than I. I won't be alone in this! The mentors I've been blessed to learn from over the years will help me to refine the technique(s). I'm confident in myself, but even more confident in the individuals I've met all over the world that are passionate about helping people too.

There can be no failure here friends! Again, even if no new super technique is found, there will be one more elite health professional growing in his field. 

Other Ways You Can Help

At some point, I'm going to need volunteers. I already have some people that are ready to volunteer themselves to see and try the magic, but I'll also need to test this remotely... How effective will this technique be over say Skype or voice call? If you'd like to be one of the beta testers, that could be a great help too! 

If this is something you think you'd like to participate in, let me know! Just tell me:

  • What your goals are in health, fitness, and wellness.
  • What you've tried in the past and what you are currently doing.
  • Anything I should be aware of (such as a heart condition, hardware such as rods around the spine, etc.).
  • And most importantly, how much do you want success?
  • I'm only going to need several volunteers in the beginning, once I have enough I'll remove this part.

story:
UPDATED:

Bob Rutter passed away peacefully on October 14th, 2013 with his wife and daughter at his side.  We were able to use some of the money raised to fulfill a few of Bob's wishes before he passed.  We are continuing our campaign in Bob's memory and contributing the money to a trust account to help his wife with anything she needs.  Thank you to all who have contributed so far, and please help us continue raising funds for Bob and his family. 

Sincerely, The Rutter and Fletcher families.

 

ORIGINAL CAMPAIGN:

Hello friends, family and generous people everywhere.

As most of you know my dad Bob Rutter was diagnosed with stage-4 colon cancer in January of 2012.  We soon learned that the cancer had already spread to his liver and was in-operable and terminal.  He was given two years to live just before his 65th birthday.

He is now in hospice care in Port Moody living his final weeks in comfort thanks to the amazing staff and volunteers at Crossroads Hospice.

My dad has always been there for everyone around him.  Whether to lend a helping hand, or a car payment, mortgage payment or whatever you needed, he's been there.  Now we are reaching out for help for the first time.  When the conventional treatments that are covered under medical stopped working last year, my parents were forced to spend their life's savings quite literally trying to save his life (or at the very least extend his time with us). 

So please if you're able, send a few "pennies" my dad's way and help us fulfill a few of his last wishes and help give him some peace of mind as he leaves us to enter his next journey.

What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise at least $5,000.00 to pay some bills, buy him some amazing food and as many final experiences as we can.

Choose a Perk if you like*

For each $25 donation, you can choose 3 beautiful handmade holiday greeting cards.

For each $50 donation, you can choose 3 handmade holiday greeting cards and 10 gift tags.

For each $100 donation, you can choose 4 handmade holiday greeting cards,10 gift tags and a lovely holiday wreath (either paper, felt or ribbon).

*For the perks, make sure you click on the designated boxes to the right before making your contribution.  Otherwise you can select "contribute now" if you do not wish to claim a perk.

Thank you in advance for the support.  And to those of you who have been there for us this past year, my Mom and I sincerely thank you.

story:
How will your donation be spent?

Fees: Your donation will in part pay for the Indiegogo fees, the credit card fees, and I am pretty sure there might be a multiple fee fee, for people who like fees. 

Product Development and Manufacturing: Your donation will go to manufacturing costs, to produce a quality, low cost, chill pill box for anyone.

Sources

1.http://www.nytimes.com/2011/08/16/health/16consumer.html?pagewanted=all&_r=0

2.http://www.nlm.nih.gov/medlineplus/ency/article/007189.htm

3.http://www.npr.org/blogs/health/2012/07/10/156575072/why-you-should-keep-medicines-out-of-summer-heat

**Please note, this product is still in the development stages, your donation will help further testing and development of a working product.
story_txt:

story:
Voices of Rwanda is dedicated to recording and preserving testimonies of the rescapés for use in memorialization, research, and education. All funds from this campaign will go directly to support these efforts.

Please listen to Claudine, a rescapée of the 1994 Genocide Against the Tutsi, as she recalls what became of her childhood, and what swimming means to her.

The Challenge: Swim the Strait (for VOR)

  • Board member Kerry Propper (Chardan Capital) pledged to match $20,000 towards filming testimonies.

  • I pledged the Strait

On August 23rd, I took to the waters in an attempt to swim from Europe to Africa by crossing the Strait of Gibraltar, in what was ultimately a 15.5 mile swim (due to shifting currents). I am proud to join the ranks of the fewer than 400 swimmers who successfully crossed the Strait without a wetsuit, but more importantly, I am proud that this symbolic journey has helped to raise funds for Voices of Rwanda.

Many have asked why I chose to swim. I hope this page helps to explain the connection between swimming, our work in Rwanda, and my own journey over the years.

In short, upon my first arrival in Rwanda nearly a decade ago, I felt completely outside my comfort zone. And yet I also felt I didn't have a choice but to return; Rwanda became an inevitable direction as I was pulled into a narrative of such force. Throughout my years as filmmaker, journalist, and director of the Voices of Rwanda archive, I have been a secondary witness to history by listening to the stories of others, who have been, and remain, my courageous guides across rough waters. This swim was an attempt to express that initial journey in a very physical way and to serve as a public statement that the oceans we as an organization must cross remain ahead of us.

Swimming to Rwanda

"Who needs metaphors for hell, or poetry about hell, this actually happened here on earth."  - Spalding Gray

In a small downtown theater one night in 1985, American actor and writer Spalding Gray made history by recounting history. He stepped on stage, sat behind a desk with a pencil, notepad, and glass of water, and began bearing witness to his experiences while filming The Killing Fields.

Spalding was a consummate outsider to the culture and to the historical events of Cambodia, and yet Cambodia became woven into the fabric of his life and left him tangled in a mess of history.  He called his monologue Swimming to Cambodia.  And while he had not experienced the dark chapter of Cambodian history with his own eyes, he had heard from the witnesses, and in turn, his own telling became another kind of bearing witness. 

In honor of Spalding and his unique gift for sharing the inner workings of his mind through storytelling, and in memory of all those who endured genocide, in particular the nearly one million Tutsi in Rwanda who were killed in 1994, many of whom were thrown into lakes and rivers unable to swim, I call this effort "Swimming to Rwanda." 

Just Going for a Swim

    "When we came back from school, we would agree to meet at 3 o’clock. You know at 3 o’clock, the sun is very strong. So, we’d say: 'Let’s go for a swim.' ... Sometimes we would lie to our parents, telling them that we were going to fetch water. [laughter] But in reality, [more laughter] we weren’t really going to fetch water. We were just going for a swim." - Claudine

In the video clip excerpted from Claudine's testimony, we are introduced to a childhood idyll of swimming in the lake.  Soon after, Claudine's laughter and smiles disappear as the memory of genocide surfaces. Her mind grants her a brief reprieve to live in the innocence of her childhood before it is drowned by explicit visions of the genocide.  As such, even the most precious memories of the lake are forever contaminated by her experiences during the genocide.  

For the rescapés in Rwanda, living with genocide means living with the persistence of these memories. And for hundreds of thousands like Claudine, "just going for a swim" will never exist.

Preserving Voices of Rwanda

Since 2006, I have been filming life stories of the rescapés of the 1994 Genocide against the Tutsi for Voices Of Rwanda, a video archive dedicated to bringing testimonies to high schools, Universities, museums, and research institutions around the globe.  VOR was founded with the goal of filming for 20 years, but we are unable to continue our work without wide support from those of us outside Rwanda who are ready to listen, who believe that the rescapés deserve a space to share their stories, and who recognize the importance of preserving history for the future.

Though our work is always disorienting, I am still swimming. Please help me swim farther by sponsoring this crossing.

story:
Rhonda Rano,

A Woman of God, A Wife, A Mother, A Grandmother, A Sister in Christ and A True Friend.

Rhonda is a woman of God and the enemy has been aggressively attacking her with this deadly health issue. Rhonda walks in faith and is a strong believer. Rhonda has completed two thirds of her seminary education and Satan does not want her to finish. He knows that her love for the Lord will bring many to accept God’s plan of salvation and have a personal relationship with His Son our Lord Jesus Christ.

Rhonda was diagnosed with Stage 4 breast cancer. When the doctors diagnosed her they gave her only a couple of months to live and that was if she made it through the debilitating chemotherapy and radiation treatments. She chose to use an Alternative Health Method of Treatment. That was over 2 years ago.

I am so thankful Rhonda has chosen this alternative method. Because of her choice of treatment she is not insurable.

Rhonda’s daily treatments are expensive and without insurance they have exhausted all of their financial resources. In order to continue the last of them and become cancer free she needs your financial assistance.

With the treatments her prognosis of being completely healed and cancer free is in sight.  Praise God !!!

Rhonda is a vibrant young woman. With your help she will be able to bring in the New Year. She can live a normal and healthy life, enjoy her husband, her children, see her grandchild grow up and to be a testament to this healthy alternative method of treatment. Which will help become a way for others to be naturally healed from this killing disease.

Any amount you are able to contribute will be appreciated. Please share this site and with everyone’s help we can save a beautiful woman’s life.

We would also like to ask for your prayers, as the power of prayer multiplied by many times produces awesome results and blessings.

Thank You and God Bless.

Lorie Ballard

story:
Short Summary

Blue Ridge Bread Co is the only bakery in the Yadkin Valley region that offers handcrafted old world artisan bread and baked goods. We opened our bakery on less than a shoestring, with just enough equipment to begin, but now must expand our production capabilities to become self-sustaining and rebound from several unforseen expenses.

Blue Ridge Bread Company is the culmination of ten years worth of planning and dreaming by Chef Rob Marsh who is a graduate of Johnson & Wales University, and Mr. Kevin Hager.

Blue Ridge Bread Co opened its doors in July of 2014. Since then, we have rapidly grown in local popularity (Check out our Tripadvisor Ranking and Reviews, currently ranked 4th of 38). Our baked goods are currently carried at several local retailers in the Elkin/Jonesville Area. Our use of Old World technique, and local organic ingredients, as well as our refusal to incorporate chemicals into our products have supplied our customers with a sought after niche of products that, until now, had been missing in the area. 

      When we decided to open BRBC, we had access to just enough capital to buy the essentials: a woodblock table, 3 bay sink, handwash sink, refrigerator, freezer, oven ($250 on Craig's list), etc. (our oven capacity being the weakest link in our bakery’s production line: 12 loaves at a time). We have operated the last few months at peak production levels and, after doggedly trying to work around it (plus several unforseeable circumstances), have come to the stark conclusion that we must ask for outside help to expand in order to survive. 

      We have been continually approached by prospective larger volume wholesale customers, but do not currently have near the production capacity to take them on, nor do our current wholesale accounts bring enough to sustain us. With your support, we will have the opportunity to purchase a new oven (approximate capacity ~76 loaves) so that we may take on these new accounts thereby securing our ability to not only increase our overall production level exponentially, but also become 100% self sufficient. With the purchase of the new oven comes the opportunity for us to take on multiple wholesale accounts, become self-sustaining, as well as pave the way for a small retail location in Elkin.

What We Need & What You Get

$1500 of campaign contributions will go directly to the initial purchase of our new (used) oven.

$500 will pay for the electrical work to install the new oven.

$500 will pay for rehabilitating the new oven (new elements, deck stones)

The remaining $1500 will go towards general operating expenses accrued in the interim.

Because we can access them immediately, Paypal Contributions are preferred, however we are not in the position to be picky and absolutely understand that not everyone has a Paypal account.

We endeavored to construct our perk levels in such a way that they would be approachable for just about anyone. Contribute what you can, and together we all can make this happen. We expect to have all perks distributed within 20 days of our campaign ending. 

If, in fact, we don’t reach our goal of $4000, we will apply your contributions to our most immediate financial needs while we continue to work diligently to secure further funding to expand.

The Impact

We believe that local food production is key to addressing the global food shortage we now face as human beings. Mass production processes strip vital nutrition out of commercially available bread and baked goods. With these things in mind, we hope to continue providing delicious, nutritious, bread and baked goods in the Yadkin Valley region and soon, up and down the entire Blue Ridge Corridor.

Risks & Challenges

Our greatest challenge in the short term is securing enough working capital to enable us to survive until we can install our new oven and get our new accounts on a consistent order-payment schedule. By increasing our production capabilities we will be able to avoid this scenario repeating itself again in the near future. With the production increase we will also be able to produce enough to begin pursuing a small retail location where we will offer not only our Artisan breads and baked goods, but also sandwiches, cold desserts, and espresso. By securing a retail location, we will no longer be quite so dependent on our wholesale accounts and can supply a much needed face to our company. Regardless of whether we meet our goal, we will not give up. BRBC has come this far, and we are not done yet.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that most people these days have limited finances, as we are in the same predicament. If you find that you feel passionately about our cause, but don’t have the means to contribute monetarily, there are other ways to support us. A Facebook share or a quick Tweet cost nothing but go a long way to spread the word. Tell your friends and neighbors in person as well. Indigogo makes it easy to share our campaign. Click any of the share tools, it’s easy!
