story:
Why get a DCT ProFlex?

The DCT ProFlex addresses some of the most chronic and nagging injuries of the lower body, such as:

•  Plantar Fasciitis
•  Achilles Tendonitis
•  Shin Splints
•  Knee Pain
•  Arthritis
•  Posture-Based Lower Back Pain and more!

In addition to resolving pain from these specific injuries, the DCT ProFlex is used by everyone from Professional and Elite Athletes looking for the cutting edge in performance, to Seniors wanting to improve their quality of life.  No matter where you lie on the health continuum, DCT and the ProFlex will help you take control of your body, and show you that it's possible to live both pain free and achieve superior levels of performance. 

Dynamic Contraction Technique, or DCT, is a flexibility system that uses sequential muscle contractions to actively balance tension, remove scar tissue, and ultimately improve muscle function and strength. The DCT ProFlex is a leverage device that fastens to your foot allowing users to perform DCT exercises and immediately improve blood circulation, range of motion, and posture. This is truly the first easy to learn, efficient, and powerfully effective therapeutic exercise system and device on the market.

The DCT ProFlex can be used either INDIVIDUALLY or by HEALTHCARE AND FITNESS PROFESSIONALS with their clients.  The ProFlex is designed for two separate applications, one for the shin and dorsal foot muscles and fascia, and the other for the calf and plantar foot muscles and fascia. 


DCT Client and Practitioner Testimonial Videos - Click the images below!


“I was introduced to Dynamic Contraction Technique (DCT) in April 2005, since then I have worked with Nic Bartolotta to create a flexibility program that best suits me.  DCT has helped me to prepare in a way that I know I am physically ready for anything.  The work is truly amazing, light years ahead of many of the other protocols commonly used in most athletic and fitness programs today.”  

Jayson Werth, Major League Baseball Player; 2008 World Series Champion; Right Fielder, Washington Nationals.

The true secret to the ProFlex lies in understanding the biomechanics of the ankle.  There is a common misconception that the Ankle joint operates like the hinge joint of a door.  A door hinge has a single axis of motion and a stable pivot point that the door swings around.  The knee and elbow joints are examples of hinge joints in the body.

    

But unlike a simple hinge joint, the ankle has 3 different axes of motion creating a pivot point that actually moves in an arc when you point and flex your foot.

This fact, now obvious to you, has actually been overlooked by most designers when creating rehabilitation and strength training devices for the lower leg and ankle. If you design a product for the human foot that works about a stable hinge joint then you lose out on 75% of the motion of the ankle and can cause poor muscle recruitment, improper movement patterns, or even injury.

If you look at the ProFlex in operation you can see very clearly that the device allows for full and complete motion of the ankle around its moving pivot point.  Unlike any other device on the market the ProFlex allows for controlled resistance along each independent axes of motion making it a superior rehabilitation tool for ankle sprains and fracture recovery (show Supination and pronation and inversion eversion). 

This scientific breakdown of ankle and foot motion also gives the ProFlex an unparalleled ability to strengthen muscles and connective tissue that directly re-enforces proper foot mechanics and posture.

Nine-ply, high strength and quality Europly wood, high-grade tubular nylon webbing for personal use strap, Breathable Hygienic Polyurethane closed cell foam, Biomechanically Advanced & Ergonomic foot strap.

The ProFlex is made from the highest quality materials and is produced 100% in the United States.  The foam used for the foot pad is breathable and allows for the wicking of sweat.  The foot strap is designed to be easily removed for cleaning and replacement.  The wood used for the ProFlex is a 9 ply high strength European ply wood that reduces the weight of the device while increasing performance and longevity. 

To accommodate the wide range of foot sizes of DCT users, we have customized two different sizes. 

Our Youth/Women’s ProFlex fits  8.5 or smaller shoe size (women's and youth)

Our Adult/Men's ProFlex fits shoe sizes 9 - 14 (women's) and shoe sizes 7 - 12.5 (men's)

We are able to produce the ProFlex for Extra Large foot sizes as well, however pricing varies on Qty ordered (For more information regarding XL sizes inquire at info@dctproducts.com).

For our indiegogo campaign we have 3 wood color options and 4 strap color options.  Strap Colors are Yellow, Royal Blue, Silver, and Black.  Wood Colors are Light Brown, Black, and Green.  Mix and match as you please!

Limited Edition ProFlex Style Options: We are offering 2 limited edition ProFlexes that will only be available during our Indiegogo campaign.

Option 1: The first Limited Edition ProFlex is for our Military Benefit Perk and is your choice of board color with a camouflage foot strap.  For every Camo ProFlex ordered we will donate $10 to the Warriors Live On organization based out of San Diego.  And for every 10 Camo ProFlexes ordered we will donate 1 ProFlex to a Veteran in the Warriors Live On program and teach them how to use it!  It just so happens that our friends at Warriors Live On are currently doing an Indiegogo campaign also, it’s called Trek 2 Heal, check them out and help us help them by buying our Camouflage ProFlex or donate directly to them at http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/warriors-live-on-trek2heal. We really feel strongly about what they are doing and are excited to give to such a great cause!

Option 2: The second Limited Edition ProFlex is for those of you who want your ProFlex to last a lifetime! It's a machined and anodized blue solid aluminum board with your choice of color foot strap.  This ProFlex also has the DCT Logos, patent number, your name, and the limited edition number engraved directly into the aluminum board. It really doesn’t get much cooler than this!  Note: When you buy this Perk we throw in a regular wood ProFlex that you can travel with, the solid aluminum doesn't quite meet TSA guidelines!

In order to make sure you get the most out of your ProFlex we've created an education program and resources that are as effective as they are efficient and practical.  Teaching DCT Over the past 13 years, we have found that if people can feel a significant change in their body in 10 minutes or less, they're more likely to be consistent with their training.  As such, both our individualized workouts, called TuneUps, and our assisted therapy sessions are all designed to be highly focused and intense so that you get the most out of your time.

As you learn and perfect each individual DCT exercise, we teach you how to stack the exercises into proprietary DCT Progressions that utilize muscle recruitment and activation of each consecutive exercise to generate the maximum strength and stretch from a specific muscle group or line of fascia (connective tissue).

For Therapists and Trainers learning to use the ProFlex with their clients, the DCT Progressionsallow them to blend this work into existing workout plans or treatment protocols seamlessly.

While DCT is a stand-alone therapy and training system it is designed to be additive and can beused to enhance other treatments or to help sustain results from other treatments.

At Harmonix Health we are leading the movement towards a Preventative Healthcare Model.  We believe that everybody should be able to take active measures to improve their quality of life, and Dynamic Contraction Technique and the DCT ProFlex offer an affordable, practical way to eliminate pain, avoid injuries, and improve physical performance on every level.  

Developed over the past 13 years, Dynamic Contraction Technique, also called DCT, is a highly evolved form of an existing corrective exercise therapy known as “resistance stretching.”  Unlike traditional passive stretching methods, resistance stretching uses muscle contractions to actively release excess tension and balance the pressure across your joints.  

  

The secret to radical health benefits that have previously gone untapped lies specifically in the use of the eccentric muscle contraction.  An eccentric muscle contraction is achieved only when a muscle remains contracted while being lengthened at the same time (also known as “negatives” in weight training).  

Because you are contracting the muscle as you lengthen it, you build strength and range of motion simultaneously, immediately improving both posture and blood circulation.  By establishing proper posture, we are able to isolate the root cause of an injury and create the needed change in movement and muscle recruitment for perfect and sustainable function.

Dynamic Contraction Technique embraces this principal of cultivating strength throughout a muscle's full range of motion and is helping redefine our notions of what it means to stretch and be flexible.  The DCT ProFlex is the first product ever developed to utilize this groundbreaking method. 

Due to the incredible torque created by the ankle joint, as well as the remarkable strength of the calf and shin muscles, it is impossible to facilitate an eccentric muscle contraction without assistance.  There simply is not enough leverage to overpower the muscles that cross the ankle joint and adequately perform a DCT exercise. 

And so it was out of basic necessity that the DCT ProFlex was created.  While the concept is simple, in reality, the ProFlex boasts a novelty and uniqueness in function that earned us a full Utility Patent from the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office in September of 2012!

In development for over 4 years, we have tested, refined, and simplified the design of the ProFlex to be so easy to use and effective that we couldn’t help but share it with the world through Indiegogo!


Here’s a breakdown of the perks you can choose from when you support this campaign (select your perk from the sidebar at the top of this page).  All perks come with education materials for personal use of the device.  Therapists and Trainers who purchase the ProFlex will be provided with both the personal use and assisted use education materials.  Therapists/Trainers will be required to agree to a terms of use document prior to being given access to the assisted use education materials.

DCT Client Pat Ricci, Suffered a Spinal Cord Injury at Levels C5 & C6:“Sitting in a wheelchair all day tends to keep my legs very tight.  My care givers and I have learned to use the ProFlex as well as other DCT exercises as part of my weekly routine.  When I use the ProFlex and do DCT it literally makes my legs feel alive.  Because I broke my neck and not my lower back I have what they call Incomplete Quadriplegia, which means that I have some control of the muscles below the site of my injury, but a lot of the time my muscles are in spasm making difficult to do simple things like transfer from my wheelchair to bed.  Since I have been using DCT I have noticed not only more flexibility and less spasms, but I have actually regained some strength and movement that I had lost.  It has been a remarkable addition to my life, and I strongly recommend DCT and the ProFlex to anyone who wants to feel better and move better.”  - Pat Ricci, retired Coach and Teacher, and an avid client of DCT


Licensed Acupuncturist and DCT Practitioner Dave Scully:“Dynamic Contraction Technique has been an integral part of my practice for over 5 years now. As a practitioner of Oriental Medicine I have found that the DCT exercises are very useful and effective with treatments not just for orthopedic cases but all types of complaints.  DCT is efficient and unique due to its integration of Acupuncture Meridian theory, utilizing the 12 main meridians, the 8 extra and the tendino-muscular channels along with western bio-mechanics. Many of my patients have experienced the effectiveness of the personal and assisted DCT exercises immediately. The personal exercises are easy to learn and a great tool for teaching my patients how to work on themselves outside of treatments and to reconnect with their bodies."

Dave Scully, Dipl.OM, L.Ac. Cofounder of OmniQi Wellness Center Collegeville PA. www.omniqi.com

Healthcare in the United States is facing the worst crisis we have ever known.  Some 80 million people, around 43% of America's working-age adults, didn't go to the doctor or access other medical services last year because of the cost.  But cost is not the only factor that has led to a reactive attitude towards health and wellness in our nation.  We have been conditioned from childhood that “if it aint broke, don’t fix it,” and we take this to heart when it comes to our bodies.  There is a flawed perception that our body should operate as we demand without the slightest attention paid to it at all.  Unfortunately, pain is historically our greatest motivator, and catastrophic injury is typically the only thing serious enough to get us to change our behaviors and upgrade our lifestyle choices. 

However, we now stand at a crossroads in Healthcare where financially and physically we cannot afford to be complacent about the aspects of Health and Wellness that we can actually control.  As healthcare costs and insurance premiums steadily rise, a dramatic shift is taking place where people are stepping back and choosing to proactively address avoidable health conditions and injuries.  And until recently, most proactive and preventative measures of Healthcare have come with a large price tag making them unavailable to the masses. 

At Harmonix Health we are leading the movement towards an affordable Preventative Healthcare Model; we believe that everybody should be able to take active measures to improve their quality of life, and Dynamic Contraction Technique and the DCT ProFlex offer an inexpensive and practical way to eliminate pain, avoid injuries, and improve physical performance on every level.


Nic Bartolotta MPT HHP, Cofounder & CEO

Licensed Physical Therapist and Holistic Health Practitioner, innovator of Dynamic Contraction Technique and inventor of the DCT ProFlex. Responsible for new product innovation and content creation.  Head of product production and manufacturing.  DCT Instructor and ProFlex Educator.


Kyle Shinners Lac MT, Vice President & Creative Director

Licensed Acupuncturist and Massage Therapist. Co-Creator of DCT curriculum and creative director of brand development.  DCT Instructor and ProFlex Educator.


Jim Rooney, Director of Company Culture

Wellness Coach and My City Youth Mentorship Leader.  Head of sales and marketing strategy.  Leader of DCT Ambassador Training Program.  DCT Instructor and ProFlex Educator.


Shawn Makris, Director of Expansion & VP of Business Development

Project Manager and Private Contractor.  Head of strategic business development.  Identifies commercial opportunities and develops new strategic partnerships.  Manages clients, endorsers, and ambassadors. DCT Instructor and ProFlex Educator.


In addition to our core team, we've assembled an incredible group of engineers, designers, and industry experts who are collaborating with us to create the best product possible.

We have completed all research and development on the ProFlex and are ready for our first production run.  We have created two versions of the ProFlex to accommodate a wide range of youth’s, women’s, and men’s foot sizes.  Beyond minor tweaks to product design we are currently focused on the following:

  • Filming the DCT education material with the latest model of the ProFlex.
  • Choosing a web platform and finalizing materials for our online                                              training event Perks.
  • Refining our DCT Ambassador Program for the ProFlex.
  • We will soon begin the process of:
  • Initiating Product Liability Insurance.
  • Procurement of Materials.
  • 1st Production.

We have been working on the DCT ProFlex for the past 4 years and we have come a long way.  But now we need your help.  Your support will allow us to initiate manufacturing so we can make the ProFlex and DCT available to you and all the people who have never before had a good preventative healthcare option. Let’s take the first step towards a more conscientious, responsible, and wellness driven society.

So why should you support us?

  • Be the first to get one.
  • You’ve never been very flexible and think it’s awesome to have a simple and easy way to make it so you can finally touch your toes!
  • You want to be one step ahead of the rest and be on the leading edge of flexibility and performance.

Even if you can’t contribute, we ask for your help in raising awareness.  We’re grateful to you for sharing this on social media with the Indiegogo sharing tools below or emailing the page to someone you feel could benefit from the health and performance benefits that the ProFlex and DCT provides.

1.  How do I choose my size, strap color, and board color?

At the end of the campaign we will send you a link to a page with a form to fill out where you can choose the correct size of the ProFlex for yourself or for your clients.  You will also be given the color options for the board and foot strap at this time.  For the Limited Edition Aluminum ProFlex you will be asked to provide the name with the exact spelling you would like engraved onto the device.  If you are buying multiple ProFlexes you will be sent a link to separate form for each one you purchased. 

2.  What are you going to do with the money you raise?

Once our campaign ends we will make your ProFlex or ProFlexes and ship them to you as quickly as possible.  Any additional funds raised will go towards continued production and expansion of the current product to include an XL version for size 14.5 feet and up (currently XL is only available as a custom order), more TuneUp Videos (and other educational materials), as well as some additional product features that were cost prohibitive to test during the original prototyping process.

3.  When do I get my ProFlex?

Our manufacturing partners are standing by and excited to start producing the ProFlex.  As soon as our campaign ends, they will get to work.  We have been given a 60 day lead time from our manufacturers, and allowing for roughly 15 days to receive the funds we raised we can expect to have the ProFlex delivered to you within 3 months after the end of the campaign.  To expedite the process we will ship the products as they come off the production line which means if you are an early adopter and are one of the first to order the ProFlex then you will be one of the first to receive it!

4.  What sizes do the ProFlex come in?  How do I know my size?

The ProFlex is currently offered in two different sizes based off of standard US shoe sizing:

Youth/Womens (Size 8.5 and below in Womens/Youth US sizes)

Mens (Size 7 - 12.5 in Mens US sizes; 9 and up in Womens/Youth US sizes)

The ergonomics of the ProFlex strap accommodate for differences in the width and height of your foot.  We have found that the most important measurement for picking the proper size of the ProFlex is your foot length.  If you have 14.5 and up sized feet you can still purchase the ProFlex through the campaign, but there may be an additional fee assessed once we complete the campaign.  However, if we receive enough XL requests and pre-sell enough units overall we may be able to incorporate the XL version into our offerings and waive the fee!  For more details on the XL size please email us directly at info@dctproducts.com. 

5.  How old do you need to be to safely use the ProFlex? Can my kids use it?  For that matter can my parents/grandparents use it?

If you have a previous condition or concern relative to your ability to perform DCT exercises or use the ProFlex be sure to consult with your physician before using this device and syste.  That being said, the ProFlex can be used with a very wide range of ages, 8 years old to 90+ years old.  The real determining factor is coordination and proper sensation.  With children under the age of 10 better results are had when being facilitated by a licensed Therapist or certified Personal Trainer who can help them keep their attention focused on the activity.  Depending on the coordination of the child the bottom limit in age appears to be 8 years old.  Teenagers and adults are able to very successfully perform the DCT TuneUps on their own, but can certainly benefit greatly from receiving assisted DCT ProFlex sessions from a Therapist or Trainer.  With Seniors the limitation in use stems from chronic injuries, overall strength and conditioning, and impaired sensation.  Determining a specific upper age limit for the ProFlex is difficult, but in general if an elderly person has difficulty getting up and down from the floor then they will do better using the ProFlex with a Therapist or Trainer certified in the DCT ProFlex and who specializes with Seniors.  However, if cleared by their doctor and able to easily lay on the floor for exercise then the ProFlex will be of extremely beneficial to a Senior.  We have had 91 year olds attend DCT group classes in San Diego with great success!

6.  What is the difference between the Therapist & Trainer Perks and the regular Perks?

The difference between the Perks is in the type of education materials provided with the purchase of the ProFlex.  As a Therapist or Trainer we will teach you both how to do assisted (hands on) DCT exercises with your clients as well as how to use the ProFlex by yourself so that you can teach your clients how to use it on their own.  The Perks that offer extra education packages include live webinar events where you will learn how to perfect using the ProFlex and be able to ask questions and see live demonstrations.

7.  I forgot to include the additional fee for the Intermediate Education Package Upgrade, what should I do?

If you do not include the additional fee to your contribution, not to worry, just make a new contribution via Indiegogo for the additional fee, and then email your original order confirmation and the additional fee confirmation to: sales@dctproducts.com Keep in mind that it is only necessary to pay the additional fee once, so if you are buying multiple units you do not need to include the extra fee.

8.  If I am a Therapist or Trainer should buy both the small and large versions of the ProFlex? 

Yes, we do recommend that you have both sizes if you are planning on using the ProFlex with your clients/patients.  Unless you service a very specific demographic with consistent foot sizes it is very likely that you will find need of both the small and large versions of the ProFlex.  We have included the Licensed Professionals Package Perk so that you can get both at a significantly discounted price. 

9.  What is the DCT ProFlex Ambassador Program?  How can I get involved?

We are looking for people who are inspired and passionate about the health and wellness industry to help spread the word about DCT and the ProFlex.  Our Ambassador Program is a unique opportunity to become a spokesperson for this new and exciting product and be a focal point for our growing network of DCT practitioners and clients in your area.  As an ambassador you be among the first to be able wholesale the ProFlex and earn commissions when we begin commercial sales of the product in the Spring.  Getting involved is easy, simply purchase the ProFlex along with one of the education packages and then email us directly at info@dctproducts.com.  We will be offering free ambassador training events and experiences this winter and spring, so don’t miss out!

10.  Shipping Questions

Perks include free ground shipping in the USA.  For international orders, please note that there will be an additional charge based on the weight of the perk you are ordering, per device, for all international orders.  This does not include additional fees due to customs or other shipping costs to your country.

For international orders you may purchase your Perk now without paying for shipping, then contact us at sales@dctproducts.com  to provide us with your shipping address so that we can calculate the exact cost for shipping.  Once we have this information you will simply make a contribution in the amount needed for shipping.  A good rough estimate of international shipping costs is $45-$60 depending on your continent.
story_txt:
Why get a DCT ProFlex?

The DCT ProFlex addresses some of the most chronic and nagging
injuries of the lower body, such as:
• 
Plantar Fasciitis• 
Achilles Tendonitis• 
Shin Splints• 
Knee Pain• 
Arthritis• 
Posture-Based Lower Back Pain and more!
In addition to resolving pain from these specific injuries, the
DCT ProFlex is used by everyone from Professional and Elite Athletes looking
for the cutting edge in performance, to Seniors wanting to
improve their quality of life.  No matter where you lie on the health
continuum, DCT and the ProFlex will help you take control of your body, and
show you that it's possible to live both pain free and achieve superior levels
of performance. 
Dynamic Contraction
Technique, or DCT,
is a flexibility system that uses sequential muscle contractions to actively
balance tension, remove scar tissue, and ultimately improve muscle function and
strength. The DCT ProFlex is a leverage device that fastens to your foot
allowing users to perform DCT exercises and immediately improve blood
circulation, range of motion, and posture. This is truly the first easy to
learn, efficient, and powerfully effective therapeutic exercise system and
device on the market.

The DCT ProFlex can be used either INDIVIDUALLY or
by HEALTHCARE AND FITNESS PROFESSIONALS with their
clients.  The ProFlex is designed for two separate applications, one for
the shin and dorsal foot muscles and fascia, and the other for the calf
and plantar foot muscles and fascia. 


DCT Client and
Practitioner Testimonial Videos - Click the images below!


“I was introduced to Dynamic Contraction Technique (DCT) in April 2005, since then I have worked with Nic Bartolotta to create a flexibility program that best suits me.  DCT has helped me to prepare in a way that I know I am physically ready for anything.  The work is truly amazing, light years ahead of many of the other protocols commonly used in most athletic and fitness programs today.”   
Jayson Werth, Major League Baseball Player; 2008 World Series Champion; Right Fielder, Washington Nationals.

The true secret to
the ProFlex lies in understanding the biomechanics of the ankle.  There is
a common misconception that the Ankle joint operates like the hinge joint of a
door.  A door hinge has a single axis of motion and a stable pivot point
that the door swings around.  The knee and elbow joints are examples of
hinge joints in the body.    
But unlike a simple hinge joint, the ankle has 3 different axes
of motion creating a pivot point that actually moves in an arc when you point
and flex your foot.

This fact, now obvious
to you, has actually been overlooked by most designers when creating
rehabilitation and strength training devices for the lower leg and
ankle. If you design a product for the human foot that works
about a stable hinge joint then you lose out on 75% of the motion of the ankle
and can cause poor muscle recruitment, improper movement patterns, or even
injury.
If you look at the ProFlex in operation you can see very clearly
that the device allows for full and complete motion of the ankle around
its moving pivot point.  Unlike any other device on the market the
ProFlex allows for controlled resistance along each independent axes of motion
making it a superior rehabilitation tool for ankle sprains and fracture
recovery (show Supination and pronation and inversion eversion). 
This scientific breakdown of ankle and foot motion also gives
the ProFlex an unparalleled ability to strengthen muscles and connective tissue
that directly re-enforces proper foot mechanics and posture.

Nine-ply, high strength and quality Europly wood, high-grade
tubular nylon webbing for personal use strap, Breathable Hygienic Polyurethane
closed cell foam, Biomechanically Advanced & Ergonomic foot strap.
The ProFlex is made from
the highest quality materials and is produced 100% in the United States. 
The foam used for the foot pad is breathable and allows for the wicking of
sweat.  The foot strap is designed to be easily removed for cleaning and
replacement.  The wood used for the ProFlex is a 9 ply high strength
European ply wood that reduces the weight of the device while increasing
performance and longevity. 
To accommodate the wide range of foot sizes of DCT users, we
have customized two different sizes. 
Our Youth/Women’s ProFlex fits  8.5 or smaller shoe size (women's and youth)
Our Adult/Men's ProFlex fits shoe sizes 9 - 14 (women's) and
shoe sizes 7 - 12.5 (men's)
We are able to produce the ProFlex for Extra Large foot sizes as
well, however pricing varies on Qty ordered (For more information regarding XL
sizes inquire at info@dctproducts.com).

For our indiegogo campaign we have 3 wood color options and 4
strap color options.  Strap Colors are Yellow, Royal Blue, Silver, and
Black.  Wood Colors are Light Brown, Black, and Green.  Mix and match
as you please!



Limited Edition ProFlex Style Options: We are offering 2 limited
edition ProFlexes that will only be available during our Indiegogo campaign.

Option 1: The first Limited Edition ProFlex is for our
Military Benefit Perk and is your choice of board color with a camouflage foot
strap.  For every Camo ProFlex ordered we will donate $10 to the Warriors
Live On organization based out of San Diego.  And for every 10 Camo
ProFlexes ordered we will donate 1 ProFlex to a Veteran in the Warriors Live On
program and teach them how to use it!  It just so happens that our friends
at Warriors Live On are currently doing an Indiegogo campaign also, it’s called
Trek 2 Heal, check them out and help us help them by buying our Camouflage
ProFlex or donate directly to them at http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/warriors-live-on-trek2heal.
We really feel strongly about what they are doing and are excited to give to
such a great cause!

Option 2: The second Limited Edition ProFlex is for those of
you who want your ProFlex to last a lifetime! It's a machined and anodized blue
solid aluminum board with your choice of color foot strap.  This ProFlex
also has the DCT Logos, patent number, your name, and the limited edition
number engraved directly into the aluminum board. It really doesn’t get much
cooler than this!  Note: When you buy this Perk we throw in a regular wood
ProFlex that you can travel with, the solid aluminum doesn't quite meet TSA
guidelines!

In order to make sure you get the most out of your ProFlex we've
created an education program and resources that are as effective as they are
efficient and practical.  Teaching DCT Over the past 13 years, we have
found that if people can feel a significant change in their body in 10 minutes
or less, they're more likely to be consistent with their training.  As
such, both our individualized workouts, called TuneUps, and our assisted
therapy sessions are all designed to be highly focused and intense so that you
get the most out of your time.

As you learn and perfect each individual DCT exercise, we teach
you how to stack the exercises into proprietary DCT Progressions that
utilize muscle recruitment and activation of each consecutive exercise to
generate the maximum strength and stretch from a specific muscle group or line
of fascia (connective tissue).
For Therapists and Trainers learning to use the ProFlex with
their clients, the DCT Progressionsallow them to blend this work
into existing workout plans or treatment protocols seamlessly.

While DCT is a stand-alone therapy and training system it
is designed to be additive and can beused to enhance other
treatments or to help sustain results from other treatments.
At Harmonix Health we are leading the movement towards a
Preventative Healthcare Model.  We believe that everybody should be able
to take active measures to improve their quality of life, and Dynamic
Contraction Technique and the DCT ProFlex offer an affordable, practical way to
eliminate pain, avoid injuries, and improve physical performance on every
level.  

Developed over the past 13 years, Dynamic Contraction Technique,
also called DCT, is a highly evolved form of an existing corrective exercise
therapy known as “resistance stretching.”  Unlike traditional passive
stretching methods, resistance stretching uses muscle contractions to actively
release excess tension and balance the pressure across your joints.  
   


The secret to radical health benefits that have previously gone
untapped lies specifically in the use of the eccentric muscle
contraction.  An eccentric muscle contraction is achieved only when a
muscle remains contracted while being lengthened at the same time (also known
as “negatives” in weight training).  
Because you are contracting the muscle as you lengthen it, you
build strength and range of motion simultaneously,
immediately improving both posture and blood circulation.  By establishing
proper posture, we are able to isolate the root cause of an injury and create
the needed change in movement and muscle recruitment for perfect and
sustainable function.

Dynamic Contraction Technique embraces this principal of
cultivating strength throughout a muscle's full range of motion and is helping
redefine our notions of what it means to stretch and be flexible.  The DCT
ProFlex is the first product ever developed to utilize this groundbreaking
method. 
Due to the incredible torque created by the ankle joint, as well
as the remarkable strength of the calf and shin muscles, it is impossible to
facilitate an eccentric muscle contraction without assistance.  There
simply is not enough leverage to overpower the muscles that cross the ankle
joint and adequately perform a DCT exercise. 

And so it was out of basic necessity that the DCT ProFlex was
created.  While the concept is simple, in reality, the ProFlex boasts a
novelty and uniqueness in function that earned us a full Utility Patent from
the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office in September of 2012!

In
development for over 4 years, we have tested, refined, and simplified the
design of the ProFlex to be so easy to use and effective that we couldn’t help
but share it with the world through Indiegogo!
Here’s a breakdown of the perks you can choose from when you
support this campaign (select your perk from the sidebar at the top of this
page).  All perks come with education
materials for personal use of the device. 
Therapists and Trainers who purchase the ProFlex will be provided with
both the personal use and assisted use education materials.  Therapists/Trainers will be required to agree
to a terms of use document prior to being given access to the assisted use education materials.

DCT Client Pat Ricci, Suffered a Spinal Cord Injury at
Levels C5 & C6:“Sitting in a wheelchair all day tends to keep
my legs very tight.  My care givers and I
have learned to use the ProFlex as well as other DCT exercises as part of my weekly
routine.  When I use the ProFlex and do
DCT it literally makes my legs feel alive. 
Because I broke my neck and not my lower back I have what they call
Incomplete Quadriplegia, which means that I have some control of the muscles
below the site of my injury, but a lot of the time my muscles are in spasm
making difficult to do simple things like transfer from my wheelchair to bed.  Since I have been using DCT I have noticed
not only more flexibility and less spasms, but I have actually regained some strength
and movement that I had lost.  It has
been a remarkable addition to my life, and I strongly recommend DCT and the
ProFlex to anyone who wants to feel better and move better.”  - Pat Ricci, retired Coach and Teacher, and
an avid client of DCT
Licensed Acupuncturist and DCT Practitioner Dave Scully:“Dynamic Contraction Technique has been an
integral part of my practice for over 5 years now. As a practitioner of
Oriental Medicine I have found that the DCT exercises are very useful and
effective with treatments not just for orthopedic cases but all types of
complaints.  DCT is efficient and unique due to its integration of
Acupuncture Meridian theory, utilizing the 12 main meridians, the 8 extra and
the tendino-muscular channels along with western bio-mechanics. Many of my
patients have experienced the effectiveness of the personal and assisted DCT exercises
immediately. The personal exercises are easy to learn and a great tool for
teaching my patients how to work on themselves outside of treatments and to
reconnect with their bodies."
Dave Scully, Dipl.OM, L.Ac. Cofounder of
OmniQi Wellness Center Collegeville PA. www.omniqi.com
Healthcare in the United States is facing the worst
crisis we have ever known.  Some 80
million people, around 43% of America's working-age adults, didn't go to the
doctor or access other medical services last year because of the cost.  But cost is not the only factor that has led
to a reactive attitude towards health and wellness in our nation.  We have been conditioned from childhood that
“if it aint broke, don’t fix it,” and we take this to heart when it comes to
our bodies.  There is a flawed perception
that our body should operate as we demand without the slightest attention paid to it
at all.  Unfortunately, pain is
historically our greatest motivator, and catastrophic injury is typically the
only thing serious enough to get us to change our behaviors and upgrade our lifestyle
choices. 
However, we now stand at a crossroads in Healthcare
where financially and physically we cannot afford to be complacent about the
aspects of Health and Wellness that we can actually control.  As healthcare costs and insurance premiums
steadily rise, a dramatic shift is taking place where people are stepping back
and choosing to proactively address avoidable health conditions and
injuries.  And until recently, most
proactive and preventative measures of Healthcare have come with a large price
tag making them unavailable to the masses. 


At Harmonix Health we are leading the movement towards
an affordable Preventative Healthcare Model; we believe that everybody should
be able to take active measures to improve their quality of life, and Dynamic
Contraction Technique and the DCT ProFlex offer an inexpensive and practical
way to eliminate pain, avoid injuries, and improve physical performance on
every level.


Nic Bartolotta MPT HHP, Cofounder & CEO
Licensed Physical Therapist and
Holistic Health Practitioner, innovator of Dynamic Contraction Technique and
inventor of the DCT ProFlex. Responsible for new product innovation and content creation.  Head of product production
and manufacturing.  DCT Instructor and
ProFlex Educator.





Kyle Shinners Lac MT, Vice President & Creative Director
Licensed Acupuncturist and
Massage Therapist. Co-Creator of DCT curriculum and creative director of brand development.  DCT
Instructor and ProFlex Educator.



Jim Rooney, Director of Company Culture
Wellness Coach and My City Youth
Mentorship Leader.  Head of sales and
marketing strategy.  Leader of DCT Ambassador
Training Program.  DCT Instructor and
ProFlex Educator.



Shawn Makris, Director of Expansion & VP of Business
Development
Project Manager and Private Contractor.  Head of strategic
business development.  Identifies
commercial opportunities and develops new strategic partnerships.  Manages clients, endorsers, and ambassadors. DCT
Instructor and ProFlex Educator.

In addition to our core team, we've assembled an incredible
group of engineers, designers, and industry experts who are collaborating with
us to create the best product possible.
We have completed all research
and development on the ProFlex and are ready for our first production run.  We have created two versions of the ProFlex
to accommodate a wide range of youth’s, women’s, and men’s foot sizes.  Beyond minor tweaks to product design we are
currently focused on the following:

Filming the DCT education material with the latest model of the
ProFlex.
Choosing a web platform and finalizing materials for our online                                              training event Perks.

Refining our DCT Ambassador Program for the ProFlex.

We will soon begin the process
of:

Initiating Product Liability Insurance.

Procurement of Materials.

1st Production.


We have been working on the DCT ProFlex for the past 4 years and we
have come a long way.  But now we need
your help.  Your support will allow us to
initiate manufacturing so we can make the ProFlex and DCT available to you and
all the people who have never before had a good preventative healthcare option.
Let’s take the first step towards a more conscientious, responsible, and
wellness driven society.
So why should you support us?

Be the first to get one.

You’ve never been very flexible
and think it’s awesome to have a simple and easy way to make it so you can
finally touch your toes!

You want to be one step ahead
of the rest and be on the leading edge of flexibility and performance.


Even if you can’t contribute, we ask for your help in
raising awareness.  We’re grateful to you
for sharing this on social media with the Indiegogo sharing tools below or
emailing the page to someone you feel could benefit from the health and
performance benefits that the ProFlex and DCT provides.
1.  How do I choose my size, strap color, and
board color?
At the end of the campaign we will send you
a link to a page with a form to fill out where you can choose the correct size
of the ProFlex for yourself or for your clients.  You will also be given the color options for
the board and foot strap at this time.  For
the Limited Edition Aluminum ProFlex you will be asked to provide the name with
the exact spelling you would like engraved onto the device.  If you are buying multiple ProFlexes you will
be sent a link to separate form for each one you purchased.  
2.  What are you going to do with the money you
raise?
Once our campaign ends we will make your
ProFlex or ProFlexes and ship them to you as quickly as possible.  Any additional funds raised will go towards
continued production and expansion of the current product to include an XL version
for size 14.5 feet and up (currently XL is only available as a custom order), more
TuneUp Videos (and other educational materials), as well as some additional
product features that were cost prohibitive to test during the original
prototyping process.
3.  When do I get my ProFlex?
Our manufacturing partners are standing by
and excited to start producing the ProFlex. 
As soon as our campaign ends, they will get to work.  We have been given a 60 day lead time from
our manufacturers, and allowing for roughly 15 days to receive the funds we
raised we can expect to have the ProFlex delivered to you within 3 months after
the end of the campaign.  To expedite the
process we will ship the products as they come off the production line which
means if you are an early adopter and are one of the first to order the ProFlex
then you will be one of the first to receive it! 
4.  What sizes do the ProFlex come in?  How do I know my size?
The ProFlex is currently offered in two
different sizes based off of standard US shoe sizing:
Youth/Womens (Size 8.5 and below in Womens/Youth US sizes)
Mens (Size 7 - 12.5 in Mens US sizes; 9 and up in Womens/Youth US sizes)
The ergonomics of the ProFlex strap
accommodate for differences in the width and height of your foot.  We have found that the most important
measurement for picking the proper size of the ProFlex is your foot
length.  If you have 14.5 and up sized
feet you can still purchase the ProFlex through the campaign, but there may be
an additional fee assessed once we complete the campaign.  However, if we receive enough XL requests and
pre-sell enough units overall we may be able to incorporate the XL version into
our offerings and waive the fee!  For
more details on the XL size please email us directly at info@dctproducts.com.  
5.  How old do you need to be to safely use the
ProFlex? Can my kids use it?  For that
matter can my parents/grandparents use it?
If you have a previous condition or concern
relative to your ability to perform DCT exercises or use the ProFlex be sure to
consult with your physician before using this device and syste.  That being said, the ProFlex can be used with
a very wide range of ages, 8 years old to 90+ years old.  The real determining factor is coordination
and proper sensation.  With children
under the age of 10 better results are had when being facilitated by a licensed
Therapist or certified Personal Trainer who can help them keep their attention
focused on the activity.  Depending on
the coordination of the child the bottom limit in age appears to be 8 years
old.  Teenagers and adults are able to
very successfully perform the DCT TuneUps on their own, but can certainly
benefit greatly from receiving assisted DCT ProFlex sessions from a Therapist
or Trainer.  With Seniors the limitation
in use stems from chronic injuries, overall strength and conditioning, and
impaired sensation.  Determining a
specific upper age limit for the ProFlex is difficult, but in general if an
elderly person has difficulty getting up and down from the floor then they will
do better using the ProFlex with a Therapist or Trainer certified in the DCT
ProFlex and who specializes with Seniors. 
However, if cleared by their doctor and able to easily lay on the floor
for exercise then the ProFlex will be of extremely beneficial to a Senior.  We have had 91 year olds attend DCT group
classes in San Diego with great success!
6.  What is the difference between the
Therapist & Trainer Perks and the regular Perks?
The difference between the Perks is in the
type of education materials provided with the purchase of the ProFlex.  As a Therapist or Trainer we will teach you
both how to do assisted (hands on) DCT exercises with your clients as well as
how to use the ProFlex by yourself so that you can teach your clients how to
use it on their own.  The Perks that
offer extra education packages include live webinar events where you will learn
how to perfect using the ProFlex and be able to ask questions and see live
demonstrations.
7.  I forgot to include the additional fee for
the Intermediate Education Package Upgrade, what should I do?
If you do not include the additional fee to
your contribution, not to worry, just make a new contribution via Indiegogo for
the additional fee, and then email your original order confirmation and the
additional fee confirmation to: sales@dctproducts.com Keep in mind that it is only necessary to pay the additional fee once, so if
you are buying multiple units you do not need to include the extra fee.
8.  If I am a Therapist or Trainer should buy
both the small and large versions of the ProFlex?  
Yes, we do recommend that you have both
sizes if you are planning on using the ProFlex with your clients/patients.  Unless you service a very specific
demographic with consistent foot sizes it is very likely that you will find
need of both the small and large versions of the ProFlex.  We have included the Licensed Professionals Package Perk so that you can get both at a significantly discounted price.  
9.  What is the DCT ProFlex Ambassador
Program?  How can I get involved?
We are looking for people who are inspired
and passionate about the health and wellness industry to help spread the word
about DCT and the ProFlex.  Our
Ambassador Program is a unique opportunity to become a spokesperson for this
new and exciting product and be a focal point for our growing network of DCT
practitioners and clients in your area. 
As an ambassador you be among the first to be able wholesale the ProFlex
and earn commissions when we begin commercial sales of the product in the
Spring.  Getting involved is easy, simply
purchase the ProFlex along with one of the education packages and then email us
directly at info@dctproducts.com.  We will be offering free ambassador training
events and experiences this winter and spring, so don’t miss out!
10.  Shipping Questions
Perks include free ground shipping in the
USA.  For international orders, please
note that there will be an additional charge based on the weight of the perk you are ordering, per device, for all
international orders.  This does not
include additional fees due to customs or other shipping costs to your country.
For international orders you may purchase your Perk now without paying for shipping, then contact us at sales@dctproducts.com  to provide us with your shipping address so that we can calculate the exact cost for shipping.  Once we have this information you will simply make a contribution in the amount needed for shipping.  A good rough estimate of international shipping costs is $45-$60 depending on your continent.
campaign_city: Los Angles & San Diego, United States

story:
I.ENGLISH 

II.ROMANA    (In josul paginii)

My family is what gives sense to my life. I got married in 2006. I met my wife, Cristina in college when we both took a language class. She is my best friend and support. In 2010 our family grew when Asael David, our son, came along.

The shorter version of a longer story

For me, living with Hemophilia meant that instead of receiving the recommended dosage of factor VIII per year (182,000 to 273,000 UI), I only got 2000 to 5000 UI. As a result, my elbows, knees and also my right wrist are deteriorated and deformed now by the Hemophilic Arthropathy. At this point, we are also forced to deal with additional problems: my wife being laid off, me being unable to work and support my family with a monthly disability income of only 240$, raising our 3 years old son and living in inadequate conditions. The solution is not getting help for some immediate needs only.

  Our intention, when kindly asking for your support, is to send Cristina, my wife, to learn  tailoring, quilting and fashion design. This would help us to help ourselves. In consequence, we can have greater chances fighting my disease and improving our living conditions. We thank you for your interest and support

We hope is still time for our campaign to reach at least $4,800 , the cost for the Ladies Tailoring Techniques+Patterns making(8 months, 2 modules)  

Below, a more detailed version available.

I.   English

My story

My name is Cristian. I was diagnosed with Hemophilia at the age of 1. 

I spent most of my life fighting this terrible disease. 

Hemophilia is a "rare bleeding disorder in which blood doesn't clot normally." My Hemophilia is type A - clotting factor VIII deficiency - and is a severe form , where the active factor is less then 1 percent of the normal levels. 

Living in Romania was, and still is unfortunate for hemophilic patients like me.

During 1983 - 1992, only treatment available was Plasma and  Cryoprecipitate, administered for bleeding. I suffered severe allergies many times after being infused. I also got infected with Hepatitis C after one of the many blood transfusions. 

After 1992, with the help of factor VIII donations from other countries like US, Canada, Germany and Austria, some lucky patients were able to use factor VIII as an " on demand " solutions to severe bleeding. 

As factor VIII is not produced in our country, our supplies come from donations and purchases; however, Ministry of Health is rarely budgeting enough for purchases of factor VIII.

It is recommended that factor VIII should be administered two or three times each week in 25 - 40 IU/Kg dose; this sums up to 182,000 to 273,000 units per year. 

Factor VIII Recommended Dosage

In Romania, during last four years, for example, I barely used 2000 to 5000 units per year. Things are not getting better: as of 2013 our Health Care System denied me even routine labs and I only received 1750 IU of factor VIII so far. 

The lack of prophylactic, or "on demand" infusions of factor VIII caused repeated joint bleeding (mainly knees and elbows) that led to what affects me the most - hemophilic arthropathy. This joint damaging disease resulted in advanced deterioration and deformity of both my knees and elbows, also in my right wrist, along with chronic and acute pains.

My mobility is very much affected; I use crutches since 2008, and during activities that involve my hands and legs, like eating, holding or moving even small objects, washing myself or clothing, I experience a huge deal of pain, making me highly dependent on my wife and others. Last year I started to use a wheelchair as well,  because now my elbows and my right wrist can't sustain me on crutches for more than 5 - 10 minutes. I experience also spontaneous bleeding from kidneys, nose, ears and gums.

The financials

My monthly income from disability is about $240. My wife was laid off after working one year as a High School teacher due to staff reductions imposed by government. Unable to find a job, and with my situation getting worse, she didn't have a choice but to take care of me. She also had to take care of our son by herself. As of today, our family of three has to live of my disability income. 


What can be done?

 Little can be done as far as supplying me with factor VIII, so in absence of the possibility to  get Factor VIII in my country, our  wish is to compensate by starting a project to empower us for self sustaining.

What we ask for is help us to help ourselves.


1. Cristina's tailoring school project!

My wife, Cristina has basic knowledge and some experience in tailoring and fashion design. One of our friends donated money for buying a sewing machine. But in order to be good at it, she needs professional training. The costs for school, including all 5 modules,  are as following:


Ladies Tailoring Techniques+

Patterns making          (8 months, 2 modules)            $4,800  


Men's Tailoring Techniques +

Patterns making          (8 months, 2 modules)           $5,000


Fashion Design           (10 months 1 module)            $7,000


Total:                                                                                                                $ 16,800


Keep in mind that if the entire sum of $16,800 for whole course will not be reached, with less money, she can still do 1 or 2 modules, which will help her start working.

The income that we project coming from her future job could help make ends meet, pay for some of the medications I need - anti-inflammatories and painkillers, pay for hospital visits, a better wheelchair and crutches.

We hope is still time for our campaign to reach at least $4,800 , the cost for the Ladies Tailoring Techniques+Patterns making(8 months, 2 modules)  



2. Improve our living conditions

Add external thermal insulation to my house and remodel the bathroom to allow wheelchair access. The cost for this is about $ 12,000.

The total  sum requested is $ 28,800, a daring goal, but I hope that this campaign will succeed, as every dollar donated will make a difference in my life and will improve our chances as we continue the fight.

If you have any questions or want to know more about our situation, please don't hesitate to contact me at +40 769 278 539 or ferareginae@gmail.com

       

II.  Romana

 Istoria mea, pe scurt

        Numele meu este Cristian. Am fost diagnosticat cu hemofilie la varsta de 1 an. 

         Am petrecut cea mai mare parte a vietii luptand cu aceasta boala teribila. 

         Hemofilia este boala ereditara legata de cromozomul X, caracterizata printr-o tulburare a coagularii sangelui. hemofilia este transmisa in mod recesiv si legat de sex: gena in cauza se gaseste pe unul dintre cei doi cromozomi X ai mamei si doar baietii dezvolta boala. Tipul meu de hemofilie este A - factorul VIII de coagulre din sange lipseste - fiind o forma severa, unde factorul activ se afla intr-un procentaj mai mic de 1% fata de normal.

          In perioada anilor 1983 - 1992, singurul tratament disponibil a fost plasma si crioprecipitatul, administrate in cazul sangerarilor. Am suferit de multe ori alergii in urma administrarii acestor tratamente si am fost infectat cu hepatita C in urma uneia dintre multele transfuzii de sange.

          Dupa 1992, in urma donatiilor de factor VIII din tari ca Statele Unite, Canada, Germania sau Austria, unii dintre pacienti, cei norocosi, au putut beneficia de tratament.  Pentru ca factorul VIII nu este produs in Romania este nevoie de donatii si cereri pentru donatii. Ministerul Sanatatii dintodeauna a locat bugete foarte mici comparativ cu alte tari pentru achizitionarea de factor VIII, in ultimii ani acest tratament fiind aproape inexistent in hematologii.

          Dozajul normal recomandat pentru administrare al factorului VIII este de 25-40 de unitati pe kg de 2 sau 3 ori pe saptamana; pe an nr. de unitati necesare unui hemofilic  s-ar ridica la 182.000 - 273.000. In ultimii patru ani spre exemplu, cu greu am primit 2000-5000 de unitati pe an. In acest an, cu greu am primit 1750 de unitati iar analizele mi-au fost refuzate.

          Lipsa administrarii  profilactice sau in caz de episod hemoragic, a factorului VIII, duce la hemoragii repetate ale incheieturilor, provocand artropatia hemofilica - o deteriorare avansata a coatelor, genunchilor si incheieturilor mainii in cazul meu, alaturi de dureri acute, cronice.

           Mobilitatea mea este foarte mult afectata; folosesc carje din 2008 si in timpul activitatilor ce implica folosirea mainilor si a picioarelor experimentez dureri foarte puternice. Incepand de anul trecut am fost nevoit sa folosesc un carucior, pentru ca durerile din genunchi, coate  si de la incheietura mainii drepte nu-mi mai permit sa folosesc carjele mai mult de 5 - 10 minute. De multe ori experimentez, deasemenea, hemoragii spontane la rinichi, nas si gingii.

        

Ce poate fi facut?

         Dorinta noastra este sa reusim sa compensam raul deja facut usurand pe cat posibil efectele acestei boli prin conditii mai bune de viata.
 Acest deziderat noi il dorim realizat in sensul de a folosii  eventualul ajutor primit, ca start pentru posibilitati de autosustinere in viitor.    

Cristina, in acest moment deja  a inceput activititatea in domeniul croitoriei si designului vestimentar, in termeni modesti bineinteles, un prieten oferindu-i si  banii necesari pentru o masina de cusut performanta.

Pentru a se perfectiona insa in acest doemniu, dorinta noastra este sa inceapa un set de cursuri de specialitate.

Croitorie dama + curs tipare  (8 luni, 2 module)             $4,800  

Croitorie barbati + curs tipare (8 luni, 2 module)           $5,000

Design Vestimentar                    (10 luni 1 modul)           $7,000

Total:                                                                                    $ 16,800

Chiar daca suma totala nu va fi atinsa, chiar cu mai putin,  va putea face totusi un modul sau doua, atat cat ne va permita suma finala!



Speram ca mai este inca timp ca proiectul nostru sa atinga  suma  $4,800 , costul pentru cursul de Croitorie Dama si cursul de Tipare Dama (8 luni, 2 module).


            

             Imbunatatirea conditiilor de viata

             Este necesara tencuiala si izolarea termica exterioara a casei si refacerea baii pentru uzul facil al acesteia. Costul pentru aceste lucrari se ridica la 12.000 de dolari.

             Suma totala necesara este de 28.800 de dolari, o tinta indrazneata, intr-adevar, dar sper ca aceasta campanie va avea succes, intrucat fiecare dolar va face o diferenta in viata noastra si va mari sansele de reusita in lupta noastra cu efectele hemofiliei.

             Pentru orice intrebare va sunt la dispozitie la numarul de telefon +40 769 278 539 sau email-ul: ferareginae@gmail.com.


Notes:

1. Please recommend this campaign to your friends  by using Indiegogo sharing tools.

http://support.indiegogo.com/entries/20494567-How-to-Contribute-to-a-Campaign

2. Direct credit card

    • Enter your card information. Don't worry; this information is protected and is never saved by Indiegogo (Related Forum Article: Online Security)
    • We accept Visa, MasterCard, Discover, and American Express. We do NOT accept pre-paid value cards

    3. PayPal

      • Click on the Contribute button and click 'continue' to be taken to the PayPal payment gateway
      • Your card will NOT be charged when you click 'continue'.  There are a few more steps to complete.
      • EITHER log in to PayPal to complete your contribution OR click on "Pay with a credit or debit card" to pay without signing in
      • Please note, you do NOT need to have or start a PayPal account to pay through PayPal. [Related Forum Article: How to Contribute via PayPal without a PayPal Account]

      • You can contribute to a campaign via PayPal, even if you do not have a PayPal account. Use your credit card to "Pay as a Guest" without signing in:

      1.  When you get to the PayPal screen, you'll see up top "Choose a Way to Pay"
      2.  Select the second option: "Pay with a debit or credit card"
      3.  Complete the form - PayPal accepts Visa, MasterCard, Discover, and American Express
      4.  Deselect the checkbox that says: "Save this information with a PayPal account"
      5.  Click "Review and Continue" to continue with a payment using a credit card
      6.  Click on the "Continue Without Logging In" link.
story_txt:
I.ENGLISH II.ROMANA    (In josul paginii)My family is what gives sense to my life. I got married in 2006. I met my wife, Cristina in college when we both took a language class. She is my best friend and support. In 2010 our family grew when Asael David, our son, came along.The shorter version of a longer story
For me, living with Hemophilia meant that instead of
receiving the recommended dosage of factor VIII per year (182,000 to 273,000
UI), I only got 2000 to 5000 UI. As a result, my elbows, knees and also my
right wrist are deteriorated and deformed now by the Hemophilic Arthropathy. At
this point, we are also forced to deal with additional problems: my wife being
laid off, me being unable to work and support my family with a monthly
disability income of only 240$, raising our 3 years old son and living in inadequate
conditions. The solution is not getting help for some immediate needs only.  Our
intention, when kindly asking for your support, is to send Cristina, my wife,
to learn  tailoring, quilting and fashion design. This would help us to help
ourselves. In consequence, we can have greater chances fighting my disease and
improving our living conditions. We thank you for your interest and supportWe hope is still time for our campaign to reach at least $4,800 , the cost for the Ladies Tailoring Techniques+Patterns making(8 months, 2 modules)  Below, a more detailed version available.
I.   EnglishMy storyMy name is Cristian. I was diagnosed with Hemophilia at the age of 1. I spent most of my life fighting this terrible disease. Hemophilia is a "rare bleeding disorder in which blood doesn't clot normally." My Hemophilia is type A - clotting factor VIII deficiency - and is a severe form , where the active factor is less then 1 percent of the normal levels. Living in Romania was, and still is unfortunate for hemophilic patients like me.During 1983 - 1992, only treatment available was Plasma and  Cryoprecipitate, administered for bleeding. I suffered severe allergies many times after being infused. I also got infected with Hepatitis C after one of the many blood transfusions. After 1992, with the help of factor VIII donations from other countries like US, Canada, Germany and Austria, some lucky patients were able to use factor VIII as an " on demand " solutions to severe bleeding. As factor VIII is not produced in our country, our supplies come from donations and purchases; however, Ministry of Health is rarely budgeting enough for purchases of factor VIII.It is recommended that factor VIII should be administered two or three times each week in 25 - 40 IU/Kg dose; this sums up to 182,000 to 273,000 units per year. Factor VIII Recommended DosageIn Romania, during last four years, for example, I barely used 2000 to 5000 units per year. Things are not getting better: as of 2013 our Health Care System denied me even routine labs and I only received 1750 IU of factor VIII so far. The lack of prophylactic, or "on demand" infusions of factor VIII caused repeated joint bleeding (mainly knees and elbows) that led to what affects me the most - hemophilic arthropathy. This joint damaging disease resulted in advanced deterioration and deformity of both my knees and elbows, also in my right wrist, along with chronic and acute pains.My mobility is very much affected; I use crutches since 2008, and during activities that involve my hands and legs, like eating, holding or moving even small objects, washing myself or clothing, I experience a huge deal of pain, making me highly dependent on my wife and others. Last year I started to use a wheelchair as well,  because now my elbows and my right wrist can't sustain me on crutches for more than 5 - 10 minutes. I experience also spontaneous bleeding from kidneys, nose, ears and gums.The financialsMy monthly income from disability is about $240. My wife was laid off after working one year as a High School teacher due to staff reductions imposed by government. Unable to find a job, and with my situation getting worse, she didn't have a choice but to take care of me. She also had to take care of our son by herself. As of today, our family of three has to live of my disability income. What can be done? Little can be done as far as supplying me with factor VIII, so in absence of the possibility to  get Factor VIII in my country, our  wish is to compensate by starting a project to empower us for self sustaining.What we ask for is help us to help ourselves.1. Cristina's tailoring school project!My wife, Cristina has basic knowledge and some experience in tailoring and fashion design. One of our friends donated money for buying a sewing machine. But in order to be good at it, she needs professional training. The costs for school, including all 5 modules,  are as following:Ladies Tailoring Techniques+Patterns making          (8 months, 2 modules)            $4,800  Men's Tailoring Techniques +Patterns making          (8 months, 2 modules)           $5,000Fashion Design           (10 months 1 module)            $7,000Total:                                                                                                                $ 16,800Keep in mind that if the entire sum of $16,800 for whole course will not be reached, with less money, she can still do 1 or 2 modules, which will help her start working.The income that we project coming from her future job could help make ends meet, pay for some of the medications I need - anti-inflammatories and painkillers, pay for hospital visits, a better wheelchair and crutches.We hope is still time for our campaign to reach at least $4,800 , the cost for the Ladies Tailoring Techniques+Patterns making(8 months, 2 modules)  
2. Improve our living conditionsAdd external thermal insulation to my house and remodel the bathroom to allow wheelchair access. The cost for this is about $ 12,000.The total  sum requested is $ 28,800, a daring goal, but I hope that this campaign will succeed, as every dollar donated will make a difference in my life and will improve our chances as we continue the fight.If you have any questions or want to know more about our situation, please don't hesitate to contact me at +40 769 278 539 or ferareginae@gmail.com       II.  Romana Istoria mea, pe scurt        Numele meu este Cristian. Am fost diagnosticat cu hemofilie la varsta de 1 an.          Am petrecut cea mai mare parte a vietii luptand cu aceasta boala teribila.          Hemofilia este boala ereditara legata de cromozomul X, caracterizata printr-o tulburare a coagularii sangelui. hemofilia este transmisa in mod recesiv si legat de sex: gena in cauza se gaseste pe unul dintre cei doi cromozomi X ai mamei si doar baietii dezvolta boala. Tipul meu de hemofilie este A - factorul VIII de coagulre din sange lipseste - fiind o forma severa, unde factorul activ se afla intr-un procentaj mai mic de 1% fata de normal.          In perioada anilor 1983 - 1992, singurul tratament disponibil a fost plasma si crioprecipitatul, administrate in cazul sangerarilor. Am suferit de multe ori alergii in urma administrarii acestor tratamente si am fost infectat cu hepatita C in urma uneia dintre multele transfuzii de sange.          Dupa 1992, in urma donatiilor de factor VIII din tari ca Statele Unite, Canada, Germania sau Austria, unii dintre pacienti, cei norocosi, au putut beneficia de tratament.  Pentru ca factorul VIII nu este produs in Romania este nevoie de donatii si cereri pentru donatii. Ministerul Sanatatii dintodeauna a locat bugete foarte mici comparativ cu alte tari pentru achizitionarea de factor VIII, in ultimii ani acest tratament fiind aproape inexistent in hematologii.          Dozajul normal recomandat pentru administrare al factorului VIII este de 25-40 de unitati pe kg de 2 sau 3 ori pe saptamana; pe an nr. de unitati necesare unui hemofilic  s-ar ridica la 182.000 - 273.000. In ultimii patru ani spre exemplu, cu greu am primit 2000-5000 de unitati pe an. Incepand de anul trecut am fost nevoit sa folosesc un carucior, pentru ca durerile din genunchi, coate  si de la incheietura mainii drepte nu-mi mai permit sa folosesc carjele mai mult de 5 - 10 minute. De multe ori experimentez, deasemenea, hemoragii spontane la rinichi, nas si gingii.        Ce poate fi facut?         Dorinta noastra este sa reusim sa compensam raul deja facut usurand pe cat posibil efectele acestei boli prin conditii mai bune de viata. Acest deziderat noi il dorim realizat in sensul de a folosii  eventualul ajutor primit, ca start pentru posibilitati de autosustinere in viitor.    Cristina, in acest moment deja  a inceput activititatea in domeniul croitoriei si designului vestimentar, in termeni modesti bineinteles, un prieten oferindu-i si  banii necesari pentru o masina de cusut performanta.Pentru a se perfectiona insa in acest doemniu, dorinta noastra este sa inceapa un set de cursuri de specialitate.Croitorie dama + curs tipare  (8 luni, 2 module)             $4,800  Croitorie barbati + curs tipare (8 luni, 2 module)           $5,000Design Vestimentar                    (10 luni 1 modul)           $7,000Total:                                                                                    $ 16,800Chiar daca suma totala nu va fi atinsa, chiar cu mai putin,  va putea face totusi un modul sau doua, atat cat ne va permita suma finala!
Speram ca mai este inca timp ca proiectul nostru sa atinga  suma  $4,800 , costul pentru cursul de Croitorie Dama si cursul de Tipare Dama (8 luni, 2 module).

            
             Imbunatatirea conditiilor de viata
             Este necesara tencuiala si izolarea termica exterioara a casei si refacerea baii pentru uzul facil al acesteia. Costul pentru aceste lucrari se ridica la 12.000 de dolari.
             Suma totala necesara este de 28.800 de dolari, o tinta indrazneata, intr-adevar, dar sper ca aceasta campanie va avea succes, intrucat fiecare dolar va face o diferenta in viata noastra si va mari sansele de reusita in lupta noastra cu efectele hemofiliei.
             Pentru orice intrebare va sunt la dispozitie la numarul de telefon +40 769 278 539 sau email-ul: ferareginae@gmail.com.

story:
I am sending this message in regards to a youth soccer league in Diriomo, Nicaragua. I am a Peace Corps volunteer entering my second year of service and looking to leave behind a sustainable foundation for a youth soccer league. We have already successfully formed the soccer league for kids ages 10-12, with 100+ participants and 12 community organizers serving as coaches and referees. In 2013 we successfully founded the league, completed a regular season schedule of 10 games, and finished with a championship - if you would like to see highlights click here. Going into the next year we are hoping to expand the program with 2 more divisions to enable more participation in different age groups, both older and younger. The league has been a huge success in the community, and you can see some of the accomplishments achieved with the following:

www.facebook.com/futboldiriomo

Soccer Meeting

Soccer meeting

Pledging to follow FIFA guidelines!


A major obstacle looking forward will be the costs of the metal soccer goals and soccer uniforms which are necessary to facilitate the older division. We are currently working within the community doing fundraising through various activities, as well as soliciting financial support from the mayors office, but external funds will be necessary due to the substantial cost of the posts and uniforms, especially considering the desired start-up the league in January 2014. We have already received support from One World Futbol with the donation of 20 soccer balls as well as financial support from Futbol Friends International who helped us raise money to provide soccer uniforms to the teams in the younger division (which we will continue to use every year).

Uniforms for the middle division... these will be re-used next year as well

New goals funded by the mayors office


New net!!

Some of the kids with soccer balls donated by One World Futbol!

The importance of this project is evident to me every Sunday that I am out on the fields watching these kids play and the coaches encouraging them in the development of important values; teamwork, sportsmanship, health, and friendship. Participation does not stop just at those involved, but includes the numerous family members and friends who come to cheer the kids on in a community activity that highlights positive actions instead of reinforcing the negative behaviors which are so common on the streets and in the homes.  

The goal leader of the league with his dad. A star on and off the field

The heart of the league. This group forms the league directive and organizes meetings, prepares the field before games, and directs all league fundraising activities

Some parents watching their kids play

We are providing an alternative to the drug and alcoholism that runs rampant, through prohibiting the consumption of either substances at the fields and for participants. We also plan on incorporating a training at the beginning of next season to highlight these issues for every child participant, addressing drugs and alcohol in an educational environment with dynamic activities lead by Peace Corps volunteers from the Health sector. There are also environmental positives to the league, through the constant reinforcement of trash management and field cleanliness. This is a very large problem and important behavior change for the young generation as throwing trash on the ground immediately after consumption of any good is not only a regular, but a positively viewed habit by the people of the community.

For these, and many other reasons which I have not mentioned, I am seeking your financial help to ensure that this league continues to build on the firm foundation we worked so hard to establish, growing in size and strength to make a sustainable impact here in Diriomo, Nicaragua.

story:
OUR STORY...

Doc Holliday Sauces is a Lake Orion, Michigan based "Clean" Ingredient sauce producer that was launched in February of 2012 with the introduction of our "CLEAN" ingredient steak sauce. 

My name is Raymond Najor and the beautiful Hawaiian girl next me is Joycelyn Alexander; my business partner and fiance.

Our mission, is to make Doc Holliday Sauces, part of the 'CLEAN' eating movement that is Rapidly growing across the country and to challenge the myth, that all natural, gluten free foods have to cost more. 
We felt that Indiegogo - being a "Grassroots" funding resource - was our best option, because the contributors are everyday people like us... Unlike the banks that have told us that we have not been in business long enough to qualify for a loan! 

Our sauces not only challenge the marketplace standard, but was inspired by the need to show the consumer that it doesn't have to cost more to eat healthy; that a 'CLEAN' healthy alternative that is free of artificial preservatives and colors, is gluten free and bears a lower consumer price than even standard sauces by giant corporate brands, let alone those 'pricey' so called "all natural" competitors!

Demand for our clean sauce alternative is growing; meeting the demand for our steak sauce is not the issue; the issue, is that the steak sauce is the only item we have in the marketplace, and with all the expenses involved; production, labels, freight, etc., all we are doing is breaking even.

With the introduction of our new line of sauces and marinades into the marketplace, Doc Holliday Sauces becomes self sufficient and self sustaining... instead of 1 item in the market, we would now have 4, which for us, would mean an increase in revenue, market share and sustainability.

Joyce and I have personally traveled to every state and nearly every store Doc Holliday is in. We do our own sales, our own demos (whenever possible) and have basically been our own marketing department. 

DOING A DEMO AT WESTERN MARKET IN CANTON, MI.

DEMO AT JOHNNY POMODORO'S  FRESH MARKET in FARMINGTON, MI.


At one point, I had been on the road for 2 months straight, only returning home twice to get some fresh clothing and to see my fiance Joycelyn.
Doc Holliday Sauces is our life; We eat, sleep and dream Doc Holliday;  something that started as an idea in January of 2012 and became reality a month later. We started with $200.00; an old desk, phone, home computer and a small 300 square foot office that cost us $100.00 a month, in Downtown Pontiac, Michigan and have built it into what it is today.
WE NEED THIS NEW LINE! Without the addition of the 3 new sauces, we are fighting a battle that always ends in a draw. Constantly breaking even without taking a salary is hard way to go.
And we haven't: taken a salary that is.

With your support, we will be able to have a successful line launch into roughly 50% of our current retail customer base, expand our warehousing, produce a shipper, build a stronger infrastructure and robust marketing platform to help promote our 'CLEAN' sauce alternative across the country.

Not only will your contributions help make us viable and self sustaining, but your contributions will also be helping American Veterans suffering from Traumatic Brain Injuries and PTSD because Doc Holliday donates a SMALL portion of profits from the sale of every case to The Intrepid Fallen Heroes Fund! 


THERE'S NOTHING BETTER THAN GRILLED CHICKEN WITH DOC!

Joyce and I have put our lives into Doc Holliday Sauces; and not just our time; Our blood, sweat and tears, our passion and future and the future of our children and grandchildren! We have put every penny (and then some) we could scrape together into this endeavor!

We have been told we have the BEST STEAK SAUCE on the market; I believe it.

"Yummy!"
