story:
Summary

This is a science project to perform "before" and "after" testing on the gut biomes of a family of four in response to a diet supplemented with resistant starch.

The positive effect of resistant starch on blood glucose control has been the source of many recent anecdotal reports among health bloggers on the internet. The mechanism is not entirely clear, but evidence suggests better feeding and nutrition of symbiotic bacteria in the gut microbiome is causative.

The goal of this project is to measure and compare the effects of resistant starch dose-responses on gut biome in as reasonably controlled a manner as possible by selecting an otherwise typical and healthy family that lives and eats together.

  • A secondary goal of this project is to provide a proof-of-concept and, perhaps, a template for future crowd-sourced, small-scale diet and health experiments.

Methods

I will purchase two "Microbes for Four" swab kits from the American Biome Project.

At the start of the project four members of our family, two adults and two children, will provide a stool swab.

Over the course of a 6 week study period I will maintain a food journal for each participant and provide a daily diet supplement of resistant starch in the form of Bob's Red Mill Unmodified Potato Starch. Each participant will follow a unique supplementation regimen:

a) adult 1 - 2 TBSP mixed in water, consumed on an empty stomach

b) adult 2 - 4 TBSP mixed in water, consumed on an empty stomach

c) child 1 - 1 TBSP potato starch plus 1 TSP whole psyllium husk mixed into yogurt

d) child 2 - 1 TBSP potato starch mixed into yogurt

At the conclusion of the study period the four test subjects will provide a second stool swab for comparison purposes. The lab results from both swabs will be shared publicly on the internet.

Our current diet is almost entirely home-cooked meals somewhere between primal/paleo-ish and WAPF. None of us has supplemented with potato starch previously. We do eat, a few times a week up to almost daily, an heirloom strain of viili yogurt that I culture myself. More details, including a fairly typical week of meals for us are recorded at the project blog.

Stretch Goals

If the project is over-funded I will perform additional "before" & "after" lab tests in consultation with Dr. BG from the blog Animal Pharm. She has worked extensively with others on rehabilitating their gut biome and is an expert in the practice. I will also be providing to her a $50 honorarium for her help, advice, and assistance.

As an example of additional testing, we are looking into additional profiling that would cover non-bacterial micro-organisms like protozoa, fungi, and parasites. Another possibility dependent on over-funding would be biome testing from additional service providers to document, compare, and contrast the different results and reporting methods of different lab services.

I may also do a limited amount of blood glucose testing using an OTC blood-glucose meter and disposable test strips.

We will do these for one or more of the study participants as financial resources allow. 

As of this writing, the exact costs for the additional tests are unknown so I can't give precise goal levels for each set of additional tests. Dr. BG is graciously and actively researching the available options and their associated costs.

story:
Your Odor Free Bathroom is 

Cogswell Air Purifier

99.9% Odor elimination with patented Helixion™ filtration technology.

With it's sleek design, the Cogswell Personal Air Purifier, removes odor at the source - Your toilet.

How it works:

The Cogswell Personal Air Purifier is battery operated, and
fits neatly on the side of the toilet bowl; with the air intake arm inside the
toilet and the filtration system on the outside of the toilet. As you approach
within two feet, the sensor will activate the unit and LED light.

The malodorous air is drawn in from the bowl, passed through
the filter and returned to the room, fresh and clean. Cogswell’s proprietary Helixion™ technology is the only filter available to remove sulfur based gases.  The malodorous air is drawn in from the bowl, passed through the filter and returned to the room, fresh and clean.

Revolutionary Design- Proven Technology!

  • Works with all toilets – fits easily, simple to use

 

  • Batteries included – average battery life is 6 months

          -Motion sensor tells you when batteries are low 

 

  • Helixion Filtration cartridge – last three months

          -Refills average $2.99 - suggested price

          -Available directly from Cogswell Innovation

 

  • LED Nightlight – no need to turn on lights

 

  • Cost effective – replaces the need for sprays

          -Set it and forget it

 

ODOR FREE BATHROOM, INSTANTLY & FOREVER!

story:
Our dear friends MJ needs our help!  She recently received devastating news from her doctor.  Her liver is deteriorating rapidly due to Hepatitis C related disease.  Interferon, a very potent drug, was ruled out as a course of action due to some other health concerns.  She is presently undergoing extensive testing to lay the groundwork to get on the donors list.  Without a transplant the doctor's outlook is grim.  Our insurance only covers a fraction of the testing needed.  Our goal is to raise as much money as possible to help MJ cover the medical costs for the necessary tests and maintain a positive outlook for recovery.  Any and all donations are greatly appreciated - it all adds up!  Thank you so very much for supporting our friend.

*We are also having a benefit on February 23rd from 11am to 3pm at The Original Fish Market restaurant in downtown Pittsburgh.  It is $25 at the door and includes a fabulous brunch buffet.  There will be $2 bloody mary's and mimosas, a Chinese auction, a silent auction, and a 50/50 raffle.  Please pass this along to anyone who would like to attend.

story:
MICHELE’S LIGHT BULB MOMENT

Michele’s doctor had been telling her for years that she needed to lose weight or she would become diabetic.  She had actually been having all sorts of health issues, i.e. acid reflux, hiatal hernia, obstructed bowels, swollen feet & ankles, you name it she had it.

In July of 2012, she found herself literally rolling to the floor on her knees in the mornings just to get out of bed. That’s when she knew it was time.

Michele said “I knew I was fat but I just didn’t call it obese or overweight”

While being obese, Michele was tired, sore and insecure about herself.  She was embarrassed not just for herself but also for her kids.  Michele didn’t want to be around people and would tend to avoid going to certain functions.

Michele will tell you that some aspects of her journey was challenging but not difficult, like disciplining herself to eat right when those around her were not. “... but with the help of Kurt Dixon of Body Refined Inc. I learned what to do when those around me aren’t eating healthy” Michele said.

She has learned so much in this journey to better her health. She said… “Realizing what I could look like played a key factor in why I wanted more than just losing enough weight to stop the ailments.  I wanted my body to look a lot more toned and defined.”

“I learned that my body functions so much better by eating the right foods and at the right times.  I understand my body is not a dumping ground for all these foods they put out. Just because it’s there and may seem convenient doesn’t mean I have to eat it. I now understand what my body needs to fuel itself.”

She has a lot of support from her three daughters, sister and parents. She has many friends who have supported her journey but she has also gained some new friends & supporters, like 2013 NPC Max Muscle Classic Figure Champion, Laurelle Martineau. Elle has witnessed her transformation first hand, she says:

“Not every day I have the pleasure of meeting someone who is naturally driven as Michelle. Her fierce drive for excellence has led the way to her success today. Michelle’s dedication discipline and determination has showed me that no dream is too big or no goal is out of reach. Watching her develop and excel on her fitness journey has truly been inspiring.”

 “Some family and friends were a little concerned about me losing too much weight but I realize they don’t understand the body and what we are supposed to look like.  Just watch old episodes of Soul Train. Over the years, we have been conditioned to think that plump, thick, chunky is ok BUT it’s not.”

I have tried to lose weight several times on my own.  I had dvd’s, I tried walking in my school’s gym, I even had one of those silver space looking suits (the ones that make you sweat. lol)  If you noticed everything I tried was related to the physical part of losing weight.  Body Refined Inc. taught me that is only 20% of the process the other 80% is nutrition.  That’s right what I was consuming on a daily (sometimes a hourly) basis.  Compared to the other times I got the right HELP!  Someone who guided me with nutrition tips and how to do the exercises properly.

THIS JOURNEY REQUIRED A HEALTH SPECIALIST, A COACH… NOT A TRAINER

Fast forward from December 2012 (the start of her journey) to September 2013….. 80+ pounds down, 30% body fat gone and a total of 83 ¼ inch reduction from various parts of her body. Most noticeably in the mid-section.

I met Kurt Dixon of Body Refined Inc. in November of 2012. I got Kurt's number from a friend and I gave him a call. I left a message and within minutes he returned my call. We set up a time and date for my initial consultation. During the consultation Kurt asked very specific questions pertaining to my health and what I had been told by my doctor. I completed a survey which he explained would give him an idea of how to help us (he & I) design a program just for me.

During the consultation he provided me with a wealth of information which included research and statistics about obesity in women, ailments associated with poor health/nutrition and lack of physical activity.

The program Kurt designed for me began at a very slow pace and it was geared for my body type, strength and endurance. Over time, I have become stronger physically and mentally. I am running, which I did not do even before my weight gain. I have also learned what my body needs and how to read the labels on food products. I even learned how to shop in the grocery store, yes, I had to learn how to grocery shop because all I use to buy was everything instant, sweet, salty and saturated with fat.

Kurt has provided me with one-on-one nutrition and fitness training with strong emphasis on NUTRITION.

“The first day I met with Michele, her drive and intensity was noticeable within minutes of the initial consultation. She listened intently to everything I was explaining to her about the changes in nutrition and the exercise routines that we would engage in over the next several months. From the start, I explained that there is a good chance there will be excess skin but let’s do our best to eat clean and take this whole weight-loss process slow to allow the skin to pull back as much as possible. Which it did but unfortunately, not in the abdominal area.

So, this procedure that she needs to get done is far better than it could have been if we had rushed this process.

I hope all who are reading this find it in their heart (and change purse) to help Michele to get this much needed procedure done. Congratulations Michele and I am definitely contributing to this last hurdle that we have!”

EXTREME WEIGHT LOSS LEADS TO EXCESSIVE SAGGING SKIN

Losing a large amount of weight as a result of weight loss through diet and exercise is a major accomplishment that will enhance your health, your outlook on life, and your appearance.

Michele has achieved great weight loss but an 83 ¼ inch difference from the start of her journey to now has left her with a large amount of heavy, loose folds of skin around the abdomen area.

Extreme weight loss can cause skin to sag and lose elasticity as a result of being stretched for a long period of time. After significant weight loss, the skin often fails to shrink back to its former size and shape.

The excess skin can cause hygiene and medical problems. Chronic skin-on-skin contact can result in rashes and other sores that can lead to infection. In addition, excess skin can be a cosmetic issue. People who have lost a large amount of weight often want their bodies to reflect the new, more positive image they have of themselves. Many times, the only way to remove excess skin left after extensive weight loss is through body-contouring plastic surgery.

As you can imagine, we are all very proud of Michele for this significant achievement.

And while all this progress is inspiring and dramatic for her as well as others, it also created some depressing feelings.  Even though there was a new, improved body laying underneath, the excess amount of sagging skin is completely masking the hard work that she has put into her journey.

As you can see from her pictures, her abdomen looks like a deflated balloon.

Here we are, 2014, 15 months later, the final step to completing this journey….. Find a plastic surgeon to remove the excess skin and unveil a body that she can admire in and out of clothes.

THE PLASTIC SURGEON

Michele consulted with a couple plastic surgeons, reviewing before and after pictures of their patients, and decided to hire Dr. Marcia V. Ormsby’s. a preeminent female plastic surgeon and cosmetic surgery specialist based in Maryland at Annapolis Aesthetic Surgery, Inc.

Michele says “When I first met Dr. Ormsby, we conducted the initial consultation in her office where she explained the entire procedure a long with having to do liposuction but when we went to her examination room for her to do the examination on my body, she was shocked at what she saw. I guess my clothes were big because all kept saying was “wow, you are so tiny”. She was more elated when she realized that my procedure would not require liposuction and it was just going to be a skin removal procedure. “

HOW TO PAY FOR THE SURGERY (THE CROWDFUNDING GOAL)

Michele tried borrowing from her retirement account. Tried to get a personal loan. She even asked her medical insurance company. As you can see, she has tried all options including family.

So, the next option are DONATIONS.

The goal is to raise $11,500 to cover the cost of the surgery recommended by Dr. Marcia V. Ormsby, “Abdominoplasty”.  This will cover the surgical procedure, Anesthesia, and the use of the facility.

Abdominoplasty involves removing excess skin and tightening of the underlying abdominal muscles. An incision is made just above the pubic area from hip to hip, occasionally extending to the back. Sometimes a vertical incision is necessary, too. Dr. Ormsby has determined that Michele needs only a panniculectomy, which is simply the removal of excess skin. No liposuction which has greatly reduced the cost. Although this is primarily a hygiene and medical concern for Michele, having the abdominal muscles tightened or extending the incision to the back is most often considered cosmetic and this is why her medical insurance will not cover the cost.

If Michele raises more than her goal of $11,500 for the surgery, she will “pay it forward” to another hard working person who also needs a similar surgery.

PLEASE SHARE THIS STORY

If you cannot help with money, it would be immensely helpful if you could forward her personal story to your family, friends and business colleagues via your social network circles.  You can send this link: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/final-step-in-michele-s-weight-loss-journey via e-mail or social media posts to help Michele complete her journey.

It took a lot of courage for Michele to post the pictures of her abdomen as it is now, with the excessive skin. Any and all help would be greatly appreciated.

NOTES FROM MICHELE’S FAMILY, FRIENDS & SUPPORTERS:

DJOBS LYONS – BIKRAM YOGA INSTRUCTOR, WASHINGTON, DC

“If will and determination had a face? It would show you Michele Taylor. I've known the Mother, Teacher and Friend for some years now, and have been an eye-witness to tremendous progress in reaching her fitness goals. I believe a big part of her motivation came from watching her daughters taking dance classes. I would encourage her to participate during yoga & warm-up. Even during her heaviest, never intimidated, she would try doing the postures. Now half the weight, Michele is a regular student of mine at Bikram Yoga”

ELOISE "MAE" NOBLES – MICHELE’S MOM, WILSON, NC

“I watched my daughter Michele gain weight over the years. Each time I saw her, she seemed to put on a few more pounds. She is a pretty girl but the weight bothered me. Even her father said “Michele needs to do something about her weight.”  She would complain about always feeling tired and her feet hurting. I did not want to say anything because I did not want to make her feel bad. I would say to myself of course, she looks like a round butter ball. She would find an excuse not to go to family functions. One day she showed up at with a large pink bag full of plastic containers. I asked her, “what's all that?” she said her food, she was on a diet. Each time I saw her, I saw a difference in her weight. I saw her determination and dedication toward a healthy lifestyle. She motivated me to begin a long term weight loss. Keep up the good work.

You will always have our support and you can count on mom & dad to help you get this procedure done.”

DEBRA NOBLES – MICHELE’S YOUNGER SISTER, BRONX, NY

“For the past few years, I’ve watched my sister struggle with her weight. She experienced several unfortunate events in her life which caused her to become depressed. She found comfort in unhealthy eating habits.  Her favorite, Entenmann’s chocolate chip cookies was her comfort food.  During this period in her life, I really did not know how this was affecting her body and I even gave her a nickname “fatty fat cakes”.  But as the years went by, she would complain about how tired she was and suffered several medical issues dealing with her stomach.  Her doctors advised her to lose weight and to begin eating healthier. About 1 year ago she was introduced to Kurt Dixon of Body Refined Inc. and this is when her journey to weight lose began.  With the guidance of Mr. Dixon, she was able to completely change her lifestyle.  With determination and will power, she learned how to shop, eat and live, a healthier lifestyle and within a few weeks the change began, not only did this change her physically it also did emotionally; It brought the happy go lucky person I grew up with back to life.  And I will always be proud to be her little sister.

You will definitely getting a donation from your little sister, I love you!”
story_txt:
MICHELE’S LIGHT BULB
MOMENT
Michele’s doctor had been telling her for years that she
needed to lose weight or she would become diabetic.  She had actually been having all sorts of
health issues, i.e. acid reflux, hiatal hernia, obstructed bowels, swollen feet
& ankles, you name it she had it.
In July of 2012, she found herself literally rolling to the
floor on her knees in the mornings just to get out of bed. That’s when she knew
it was time.
Michele said “I knew I was fat but I just didn’t call it
obese or overweight”
While being obese, Michele was tired, sore and insecure
about herself.  She was embarrassed not
just for herself but also for her kids.  Michele
didn’t want to be around people and would tend to avoid going to certain
functions.
Michele will tell you that some aspects of her journey was
challenging but not difficult, like disciplining herself to eat right when
those around her were not. “... but with the help of Kurt Dixon of Body Refined Inc. I
learned what to do when those around me aren’t eating healthy” Michele said. 
She has learned so much in this journey to better her health.
She said… “Realizing what I could look like played a key factor in why I wanted
more than just losing enough weight to stop the ailments.  I wanted my body to look a lot more toned and
defined.” 
“I learned that my body functions so much better by eating
the right foods and at the right times. 
I understand my body is not a dumping ground for all these foods they
put out. Just because it’s there and may seem convenient doesn’t mean I have to
eat it. I now understand what my body needs to fuel itself.”
She has a lot of support from her three daughters, sister
and parents. She has many friends who have supported her journey but she has
also gained some new friends & supporters, like 2013 NPC Max Muscle Classic
Figure Champion, Laurelle Martineau.
Elle has witnessed her transformation first hand, she says:
“Not every day I have the pleasure of meeting someone who is naturally
driven as Michelle. Her fierce drive for excellence has led the way to her
success today. Michelle’s dedication discipline and determination has showed me
that no dream is too big or no goal is out of reach. Watching her develop and
excel on her fitness journey has truly been inspiring.”
 “Some family and friends were a little
concerned about me losing too much weight but I realize they don’t understand
the body and what we are supposed to look like. 
Just watch old episodes of Soul Train. Over the years, we have been
conditioned to think that plump, thick, chunky is ok BUT it’s not.”
I have tried to lose weight several times on my own.  I had dvd’s, I tried walking in my school’s
gym, I even had one of those silver space looking suits (the ones that make you
sweat. lol)  If you noticed everything I
tried was related to the physical part of losing weight.  Body Refined Inc. taught me that is only 20%
of the process the other 80% is nutrition. 
That’s right what I was consuming on a daily (sometimes a hourly)
basis.  Compared to the other times I got
the right HELP!  Someone who guided me
with nutrition tips and how to do the exercises properly.
THIS JOURNEY REQUIRED
A HEALTH SPECIALIST, A COACH… NOT A TRAINER
Fast forward from December 2012 (the start of her journey)
to September 2013….. 80+ pounds down, 30% body fat gone and a total of 83 ¼ inch
reduction from various parts of her body. Most noticeably in the mid-section.
I met Kurt Dixon of Body Refined Inc. in November of 2012.
I got Kurt's number from a friend and I gave him a call. I left a message and
within minutes he returned my call. We set up a time and date for my initial
consultation. During the consultation Kurt asked very specific questions
pertaining to my health and what I had been told by my doctor. I completed a
survey which he explained would give him an idea of how to help us (he & I)
design a program just for me.
During the consultation he provided me with a wealth of
information which included research and statistics about obesity in women,
ailments associated with poor health/nutrition and lack of physical activity.
The program Kurt designed for me began at a very slow pace
and it was geared for my body type, strength and endurance. Over time, I have
become stronger physically and mentally. I am running, which I did not do even
before my weight gain. I have also learned what my body needs and how to read
the labels on food products. I even learned how to shop in the grocery store, yes,
I had to learn how to grocery shop because all I use to buy was everything
instant, sweet, salty and saturated with fat.
Kurt has provided me with one-on-one nutrition and fitness
training with strong emphasis on NUTRITION.
“The first day I met with Michele, her drive and intensity was
noticeable within minutes of the initial consultation. She listened intently to
everything I was explaining to her about the changes in nutrition and the
exercise routines that we would engage in over the next several months. From
the start, I explained that there is a good chance there will be excess skin
but let’s do our best to eat clean and take this whole weight-loss process slow
to allow the skin to pull back as much as possible. Which it did but
unfortunately, not in the abdominal area.
So, this procedure that she needs to get done is far better than it
could have been if we had rushed this process.
I hope all who are reading this find it in their heart (and change
purse) to help Michele to get this much needed procedure done. Congratulations
Michele and I am definitely contributing to this last hurdle that we have!”
EXTREME WEIGHT LOSS
LEADS TO EXCESSIVE SAGGING SKIN
Losing a large amount of weight as a result of weight loss
through diet and exercise is a major accomplishment that will enhance your
health, your outlook on life, and your appearance.
Michele has achieved great weight loss but an 83 ¼ inch
difference from the start of her journey to now has left her with a large
amount of heavy, loose folds of skin around the abdomen area. 
Extreme weight loss can cause skin to sag and lose
elasticity as a result of being stretched for a long period of time. After
significant weight loss, the skin often fails to shrink back to its former size
and shape.
The excess skin can cause hygiene and medical problems.
Chronic skin-on-skin contact can result in rashes and other sores that can lead
to infection. In addition, excess skin can be a cosmetic issue. People who have
lost a large amount of weight often want their bodies to reflect the new, more
positive image they have of themselves. Many times, the only way to remove
excess skin left after extensive weight loss is through body-contouring plastic
surgery.
As you can imagine, we are all very proud of Michele for
this significant achievement.
And while all this progress is inspiring and dramatic for
her as well as others, it also created some depressing feelings.  Even though there was a new, improved body
laying underneath, the excess amount of sagging skin is completely masking the
hard work that she has put into her journey.
As you can see from her pictures, her abdomen looks like a
deflated balloon.
Here we are, 2014, 15 months later, the final step to
completing this journey….. Find a plastic surgeon to remove the excess skin and
unveil a body that she can admire in and out of clothes.
THE PLASTIC SURGEON
Michele consulted with a couple plastic surgeons, reviewing
before and after pictures of their patients, and decided to hire Dr.
Marcia V. Ormsby’s. a preeminent female plastic surgeon and cosmetic

first met Dr. Ormsby, we conducted the initial consultation in her office where

saying was “wow, you are so tiny”. She was more elated when she realized that
my procedure would not require liposuction and it was just going to be a skin
removal procedure. “ 
HOW TO PAY FOR THE
SURGERY (THE CROWDFUNDING GOAL)
Michele tried borrowing from her retirement account. Tried
to get a personal loan. She even asked her medical insurance company. As you
can see, she has tried all options including family.

The goal is to raise $11,500 to cover the cost of the

Abdominoplasty involves removing excess skin and tightening

is why her medical insurance will not cover the cost.
If Michele raises more than her goal of $11,500 for the surgery,
she will “pay it forward” to another hard working person who also needs a
similar surgery.
PLEASE SHARE THIS
STORY
If you cannot help with money, it would be immensely helpful
if you could forward her personal story to your family, friends and business
colleagues via your social network circles. 
You can send this link: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/final-step-in-michele-s-weight-loss-journey
via e-mail or social media posts to help Michele complete her journey.
It took a lot of courage for Michele to post the pictures of
her abdomen as it is now, with the excessive skin. Any and all help would be
greatly appreciated.
NOTES FROM MICHELE’S
FAMILY, FRIENDS & SUPPORTERS:
DJOBS LYONS – BIKRAM
YOGA INSTRUCTOR, WASHINGTON, DC
“If will and determination had a face? It would show you
Michele Taylor. I've known the Mother, Teacher and Friend for some years now,
and have been an eye-witness to tremendous progress in reaching her fitness
goals. I believe a big part of her motivation came from watching her daughters
taking dance classes. I would encourage her to participate during yoga &

story:
Hydro-Run™-- Helping Runners Run Further Faster

Why is Hydro-Run™ better? Our 15oz. (total 30oz.) Hydro-Run™ system provides immediately available hydration while you are running The  Hydro-RunTM system also imparts many additional benefits because of the innovative design. See the video above for a complete demonstration. Having hydration available where and when you need it will help increases both your endurance and your speed. See feature and benefits at bottom to learn more about why the previous statement is the truth.

How can we be so sure? Tanita, a Japanese manufacturer, did a study on performance effects of hydration on over 5000 Ironman competitors during contests. There is a linear relation between the hydration levels and the fastest to slowest finishing times. The higher the hydration level the faster the finish time. The actual study can be found by searching Google for "Ironman Hydration Study". Hydro-Run™ brings this technology for you to use in your workouts and events. Support this campaign by pre purchasing multiples of as many of the offers as possible. Feel comfortable with knowing the offers are great gifts for the runner and/or walker in your life. Please also share on Facebook, and email friends and family with your recommendation to purchase if you want to give us even more help!!! Thank You!!!

Science has long established the importance of proper hydration in achieving peak performance in all fitness activities. It was also discovered that the easier it was to drink the more likely a runner or walker would adhere to their hydration requirements. In fact, when staying hydrated properly runners’ performance increases much more rapidly while accelerating weight loss. Proper hydration leaves you feeling better during and after the run, speeding recovery, reducing lactic acid build up, minimizing cramping, and is the number one beauty aid on the planet. Support this campaign.

Sadly many runners develop poor hydration habits since there is nothing on the market that is simple, easy to use and does not hinder their natural body movement during running. Because of this many runners are extremely slow in reaching their fitness goals, or worse yet, injure themselves without realizing hydration is the culprit. Proper use of the Hydro-Run™ system ensures poor hydration is not the cause of injury or lack of progress in hitting fitness goals. Support this campaign.

The Hydro-Run™ hydration system is easy to use, consistent with a runner's natural motion, and makes hydration readily available throughout exercising. The Hydro-Run™ system includes water bottles, electrolytes, weights for the bottles, and attachable strobe light and flashlight for the water bottles. Support this campaign.

By supporting this Indiegogo campaign you will directly be responsible for helping many people reach their fitness goals faster. The prototypes have been built, the tooling for the molds are done, the market has been surveyed, we have built the business operational structure….we are ready.....Support this campaign.

 

The following list of features (F) followed by the benefits (B) received by the user.

 

Features

Benefits

Ergonomically Design Envelops the Hand

Rest in the hands.

Very little effort to hold.

Can carry for hours without becoming burdensome.

Does not require gripping like normal bottles.

Distributes the weight around your hand.

Becomes an extension of the hands

Trigger and valve system

Opens to drink using digit of the hand they are in.

Close so all fluids are sealed within until you want to drink.

Operated independently of any other part of the body except the hand it’s in.

Allows you to use Hydro-Run as design, that is, one in each hand at the same time.

Allows you to easily and conveniently drink while running.

Used in pairs

Works with your natural rhythm, gate or stride.

Encourages proper running posture and form.

You maintain balance.

Holds 15oz each

 

Allows you to stay properly hydrated for hours.

Not heavy.

Assures quality drinking liquid of your choice. Allows you to keep moving enhancing your routing since you do not have to stop or struggle to retrieve your drink.

Top removes creating a large opening

Easy to clean and sanitize.

Can be filled quickly even during extended workouts.

Weighs 19oz full

Imparts a slight upper body workout during your routine.

You burn more calories without adding more time to your run or walk which accelerates weight loss.

Enhances your aerobic workout by adding a slight cardiovascular routine.

Get lighter as you drink assuring you maintain great form and posture all the way to the end of your workout. 

Made of high-density polypropylene

BPA and Phthalate free, no negative effects that are now being linked to most plastics.

Award Winning

Been judged by professionals so you know it’s good

story:
Help us Fund Safe Passage Tennis Program of Los Angeles

Thanks for visiting our campaign. This campaign is being launched and is very important for the continued existence of "Safe Passage Tennis Program" a very special after-school tennis program for at-risk youth in Los Angeles California. The magnitude of your contirbutions is immersurable.

About Safe Passage Tennis Program

The Los Angeles Safe Passage Tennis Program was started by the Arthur Ashe Safe Passage Tennis Foundation in memory of legendary tennis champion and humanitarian in 1995 two years after his death.

Our mission is to create a "Safe Passage" for youth making the journey into productive adulthood by using tennis as the vehicle for building self-esteem and character. Discipline, confidence and independent thinking are stressed.

See our alumni list: Safe Passage Tennis Program Graduates

Ultimately, Arthur Ashe hoped to accomplish with Safe Passage an ever growing program that teaches and develops children's interpersonal and social skills through exposure to tennis. The organization strives to develop skills that will better prepare children for their future by focusing on decision-making skills, problem solving, self-esteem, physical fitness and teamwork. The development of a curriculum based on sportsmanship, not winning or losing, is key to maintaining a respect for self and game.

In 1997 the after-school tennis program was acquired by the Los Angeles Junior Chamber of Commerce (LAJCC). Unfortunately in 2011 the (LAJCC) after the downturn in the ecomomy and facing financial straits decided to discontinue its support of the after school tennis program in December of 2011 after 14 years. We are very thankful to the Los Angeles Junior Chamber of Commerce for it's support and continuing the legacy of Arthur Ashe.

Brock Foundation took over the Safe Passage Tennis Program in January of 2012. Safe Passage Tennis addresses the alarming problems of peak juvenile crime, and risking behavior which are most prevalent for youth ages 13 to 18 during after-school hours of 3pm and 7pm. Safe Passage Tennis was created to address these problems and more such as childhood obesity and juvenile delinquency.
 
In 2012 we were able to service over 170 students in the preventive after-school tennis program. Of the approximately 170 kids we have 60 students who participate year-round. The year round participants are constantly tracked for their academic and tennis development.

"My father ... kept me home, out of trouble. I had exactly 12 minutes to get home from school, and I kept to that rule through high school."

– Arthur Ashe
 
Traditionally, tennis has been a sport not accessible to all communities regardless of race, religion or creed. We hope to bridge that gap and use tennis to transcend these barriers and bring the sport of a lifetime to more communities in Los Angeles. Our goal is to positively influence and enrich tennis opportunities for youth in Los Angeles.

Our intention for this campaign is to raise $10,000 which will be used to continue our preventive after-school tennis program. In many cases, children who love the sport simply cannot afford to participate.

The hope with this initiative is to:

  1. Raise awareness of our preventive after-school tennis program
  2. Create a unique dynamic where academics and tennis are the focus
  3. Make tennis accessible six days a week for activities such as clinics, lessons, camps, recreational play and tournament travel teams.

With your support and assistance, we can provide this service for the community as there are many expenses that must be covered.  If our fundraising target is not met, all your contributions will still be used in order to achieve our objectives.

The Impact

Your contribution will help inner city youth gain access to high quality tennis training which will hopefully be part of advancing youth to higher education and increase tennis participation in the United States.

The desired result is that the kids have a full tennis experience: learning and competing in the game of tennis, leadership, teamwork, striving for success, and most importantly, having fun.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our organization and our goal with everyone you know.

We also welcome and encourage anyone who wants to sponsor our organization through whatever means available.

Check Out Our Website

For More Info about Safe Passage Tennis visit www.safepassagetennis.com  
Like us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/safepassagetennis
Follow us: safepassage10s

Ultimately, Arthur Ashe hoped to accomplish with Safe Passage an ever growing program that teaches and develops children's interpersonal and social skills through exposure to tennis. The organization strives to develop skills that will better prepare children for their future by focusing on decision-making skills, problem solving, self-esteem, physical fitness and teamwork. The development of a curriculum based on sportsmanship, not winning or losing, is key to maintaining a respect for self and game.
In 1997 the after-school tennis program was acquired by the Los Angeles Junior Chamber of Commerce (LAJCC). Unfortunately in 2011 the (LAJCC) after the downturn in the ecomomy and facing financial straits decided to discontinue its support of the after school tennis program in December of 2011 after 14 years. We are very thankful to the Los Angeles Junior Chamber of Commerce for it's support and continuing the legacy of Arthur Ashe.

Brock Foundation took over the Safe Passage Tennis Program in January of 2012. Safe Passage Tennis addresses the alarming problems of peak juvenile crime, and risking behavior which are most prevalent for youth ages 13 to 18 during after-school hours of 3pm and 7pm. Safe Passage Tennis was created to address these problems and more such as childhood obesity and juvenile delinquency.
 
In 2012 we were able to service over 170 students in the preventive after-school tennis program. Of the approximately 170 kids we have 60 students who participate year-round. The year round participants are constantly tracked for their academic and tennis development.


"My father ... kept me home, out of trouble. I had exactly 12 minutes to get home from school, and I kept to that rule through high school."
– Arthur Ashe
 
Traditionally, tennis has been a sport not accessible to all communities regardless of race, religion or creed. We hope to bridge that gap and use tennis to transcend these barriers and bring the sport of a lifetime to more communities in Los Angeles. Our goal is to positively influence and enrich tennis opportunities for youth in Los Angeles.

Our intention for this campaign is to raise $10,000 which will be used to continue our preventive after-school tennis program. In many cases, children who love the sport simply cannot afford to participate.
The hope with this initiative is to:


Raise awareness of our preventive after-school tennis program


Create a unique dynamic where academics and tennis are the focus 

Make tennis accessible six days a week for activities such as clinics, lessons, camps, recreational play and tournament travel teams.

With your support and assistance, we can provide this service for the community as there are many expenses that must be covered.  If our fundraising target is not met, all your contributions will still be used in order to achieve our objectives.


The Impact
Your contribution will help inner city youth gain access to high quality tennis training which will hopefully be part of advancing youth to higher education and increase tennis participation in the United States.
The desired result is that the kids have a full tennis experience: learning and competing in the game of tennis, leadership, teamwork, striving for success, and most importantly, having fun.


Other Ways You Can Help
Share our organization and our goal with everyone you know.
We also welcome and encourage anyone who wants to sponsor our organization through whatever means available.


Check Out Our Website
For More Info about Safe Passage Tennis visit www.safepassagetennis.com  
Like us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/safepassagetennis

Follow us: safepassage10s

story:
¿Qué es Yogahora y qué hacemos?


En Yogahora hacemos clases de yoga online accesibles para todos, a través de Youtube y nuestra web. Creemos que los beneficios del yoga son algo universal, y que deben ser accesibles por la mayor cantidad posible de personas en todo el mundo, nos gusta hacer clases sencillas y atractivas tanto para practicantes habituales como para principiantes. No nos gusta utilizar un lenguaje complicado, el yoga es sencillo de entender, nuestro lenguaje también.

Queremos seguir haciendo vídeos en abierto para poder seguir compartiendo los beneficios del yoga con muchas más personas. Queremos hacer más y mejores vídeos y mejorar nuestra página web. Durante este último año hemos recibido una gran respuesta desde personas en diferentes países, llegando a pueblos remotos de África o a grandes ciudades como México D.F. Con tu ayuda, seguiremos haciendo muchos más vídeos, haciendo crecer esta gran familia de Yogahora y ofreciendo los beneficios del yoga a miles de personas.


¿Qué necesitamos ?

  • Con tu ayuda podremos seguir costeando la grabación y la edición de las clases, ofreciéndolas en abierto. 
  • Necesitamos un nuevo micrófono de calidad y podremos comprar mejores accesorios de iluminación.
  • Con tu colaboración podremos mejorar nuestra página web para seguir haciendo crecer la comunidad de Yogahora. 

¿Qué podremos hacer con tu ayuda?

  • Seguiremos realizando más clases y compartiéndolas en abierto en youtube, clases de diferentes estilos y dedicadas a mejorar distintas dolencias y situaciones.
  • Mejoraremos la calidad de los vídeos, tanto a nivel sonido, como imagen, utilizaremos varias cámaras para que puedas apreciar las posturas en detalle.
  • Podremos seguir ayudando a personas que no tienen acceso a clases de yoga presenciales, bien porque no tengan ningún estudio cerca de donde viven o porque sus recursos no le permiten costearse las clases de yoga.
  • Seguiremos descubriendo y desmitificando el yoga para miles de personas, haciéndolo más accesible y fomentando unos hábitos de vida saludables.


Historia



Paula Martínez, una de las fundadoras y profesora de Yogahora inició su camino en el yoga hace más de 10 años, como pasa muchas veces, por casualidad, su primera motivación fue mejorar una escoliosis que padecía. Después de un tiempo practicando yoga, descubrió que su escoliosis había remitido y que estaría enamorada del yoga de por vida. Empezó a practicar más intensamente hasta que tomó la decisión de formarse como profesora de yoga para así poder compartir sus beneficios y ayudar a otras personas como la habían ayudado a ella. Después de un tiempo dando clases presenciales, pensó que ayudar a varios grupos de personas de manera presencial estaba muy bien, pero ¿Y si pudiera ayudar a miles de personas al mismo tiempo? Y ahí nació el proyecto Yogahora, de la necesidad de compartir los beneficios del yoga con la mayor cantidad posible de gente, Naciendo una comunidad internacional, multicultural y abierta de practicantes de yoga de todas las edades y condiciones.


¿Qué nos han contado?

Muchos de nuestros amigos nos han escrito contándonos cosas como estas:

"nunca me había decidido a hacer yoga y la verdad fue una sensación increible desde hoy me suscribo a tu canal, gracias!!"   Yadi

"Hola, acabo de hacer la clase y no había hecho yoga nunca, estoy de 16 semanas y llevaba unos días con molestias de espalda sobretodo en la zona dorsal y lumbar, después de la clase me he encontrado de maravilla,super relajada y como nueva. Os felicito, muy bien explicado, muy ameno y sobretodo muy útil. Gracias"   Mariajo

"En un momento de conflictos el yoga a ayudado a calmar mi ansiedad muchas gracias!!"   Leslie

"Si la gente hiciera Yoga contigo, no tendrian que tomar pastillas para dormir, esto es lo mas relajante y desestresante que hay. Ahora a dormir! gracias Yogahora! :)"  Cecilia

"Hola!! Soy una chica a la que le cuesta mucho dormir y me desvelo con gran facilidad. Llevo dos semanas con tus clases y duermo muy bien. Muchas gracias por tus clases." Patry

"Tu clase es extremadamente simple, clara, sin comentarios vedanticos o espirituales y sin embargo el hecho de ser simple, lo hace valiosisimo en un desarrollo espiritual sin pretenciones e intrinseco. Lo he visto y hecho por primera vez y me ha aliviado mis dolores musculares que los llaman trigger points. Arigato desde Japon"  Sevastian

Con tu colaboración podremos seguir ofreciendo nuestras clases y ayudando a miles de personas.

¡Nuestras camisetas Yogahora!

En Yogahora hemos diseñado nuestras exclusivas camisetas, que recibirás con algunas de las recompensas ¿Quieres llevar esta bonita camiseta contigo? ¡Colabora!

   


    Formas en las que también puedes ayudar

    No solo puedes colaborar económicamente, también existen otras maneras apoyar el proyecto, ¡cualquier ayuda cuenta!:

    • Participa en nuestro reto de los 45 días de Yogahora (Nos da mucha fuerza saber que estamos acompañados en esto :)) Apúntate aquí ->  http://www.yogahora.com/reto-yogahora-de-los-45...
    • Comparte en las redes sociales esta campaña
    • Cuéntale a tus familiares y amigos qué hacemos en Yogahora y enséñales nuestros vídeos.

story:
5 for 5: 

Run With a Winning Team to Improve Health!


Our 5 for 5 Partnership With YOU!

Diabetes, heart disease, cancer, obesity and stress are the fatal five. They shorten the lives of millions of black women and their loved ones each year.

Help us beat the fatal five by taking a new approach to eliminating health disparities in engaging ways.

Your five: Donate at least $5 (or a multiple of 5: $50, $500, $5,000), and introduce 5 friends to Fierce.

Our five: We’ll make a difference for black women in 5 ways — at the very least:

1. Telling Your Story: Fierce will become home to a story bank where black women can share their stories of health, healing and triumph. We will always share the best that science has to offer, but we want to hear about your experiences in your words. We want to know what works for you and your family. Our goal is to increase understanding about what harms and heals black women and their families.

2. Finding the Truth: Ever read a survey about black women’s lives and well-being and wonder who on earth they were talking to?  Well, we want to talk to women like you. Existing research tells only part of our health story. Working with major foundations, we will initiate surveys that will uncover many of the trends that have an impact on our health happiness.

3. Digging Deep: We will expand our Living Well investigative reporting series to ask top journalists to answer the unasked questions about health and well-being.

4. Gathering Together: We will grow our Fierce Circle of Sisters to bring women together for common interests and concerns through large and small meet-ups and get-togethers on fibroids to fitness, special events, spa trips or other girlfriend getaways

5.  Harnessing Technology: Fierce will use social media, apps and other tech tools to help you stay healthy, fit and fabulous! 

Healthy Women Mean 

Healthy Families and Healthy Communities

Who is the Fierce woman? She’s Michelle Obama. She’s Viola Davis. She's you! And all of you are part of the most successful, highly educated and independent generation of black women in history. The Fierce woman makes every effort to live a full, rich, balanced life that cannot be defined by narrow stereotypes. She has arrived or is striving to fulfill her dreams, because she’s proactive. Determined to be in charge of her well-being, she is in search of real-life solutions to wellness and fitness in ways that resonate with her culture, her heritage, her world. Our target audience is 35 and older, but also includes younger Fierce women. 

Why women? We're Fierce! 

Plus, healthy women mean healthy families and healthy communities.

Stretching Your 5 for 5

By donating as little as $5 (or a multiple of 5: $50, $500, $5,000), you can help break the cycle of health disparities and save lives! We're attempting to raise $500,000 through gifts of health from  great people like you, investors, competitions and our various revenue streams. We'll put whatever we raise to good use by delivering on our 5 for 5 pledge to improve health through engaging digital content, apps, events and social media.

Our exciting perks for you include:

  • Fierce fitness kits, T-shirts, beauty or grooming boxes, mugs, exercise balls, yoga mats and smart phone arm bands
  • Discounts on Fierce merchandise and events
  • Wellness and financial consultations
  • Special donor listings and sponsorships
  • Exclusive invitations and VIP treatment

 Your gift will help us:

  • Support investigative reporting on solutions to the health  issues that keep black women and their families mired in disparities. 
  • Create content that will increase health literacy for black women and their families along with advice on how to build and support heathier communities. 
  • Hire a digital advertising director and other key staff members, as well as pay those who have been generously working pro bono
  • Engage public health experts and other consultants for services related to areas such as public relations, marketing, social media, accounting and intellectual property
  • Develop technology to create interactive tools that will be designed to help our audience reach their health and fitness goals,  such as apps and searchable databases.
  • Purchase equipment and various software
  • Build the infrastructure to maximize advertising and other revenue streams as well as establish training programs and fellowships
  • Expand the Fierce community through social media, workouts, meet-ups and other events.

    The Impact

    We are ready to take Fierce to the next level so that we can more effectively help our target audience. We’re concerned about the many people in our community who have a poor quality of life because of health issues  and especially those who are dying prematurely. 

    Our strategy combines a holistic approach with real-life solutions to promote healthy lifestyles. This is important, because African American women are less likely to exercise or eat healthy, while enduring higher levels of stress (financial and otherwise) along with the health disparities. Unfortunately, we’re also less likely to receive cutting-edge treatments or possess the health literacy necessary to  to adopt healthy practices, follow medical regimens or seek and demand the best care.

    Fortunately, some of this is changing. At Fierce, we have the experience and track record to make a difference. We know how to have fun, when to be serious and what it takes to empower, enlighten and entertain busy women and their families.   

    Why We're a Winning Team

    Led by Sheree Crute and Yanick Rice Lamb, our team is made up of truly fierce journalism, business and digital professionals with years of experience in starting and managing innovative, successful multimedia properties. Fierce is not only unique because of its content and focus, but it is also the only media source dedicated to the health of black women that is owned, operated and created for black women, by black women.

    Our core staff is made up of award-winning multimedia journalists, digital innovators, technology experts and media executives with expertise in strategic planning, app development, new media, social media, marketing, sales, finance, narrative journalism and investigative reporting. We have a respected team with a proven track record of success. The co-founders are creative and visionary with a long history of effectively working together on startups and at established media companies. Our team has decades of experience in producing cutting-edge content on black women’s health.

    Yanick Rice Lamb, Publisher and Co-Founder

    And as the daughter and sister of nurses, Yanick has had a lifelong interest in health but the sight of blood sent her into journalism and business school, instead of medical school. Yanick is immersed in all aspects of the company. She oversees business and  strategic development for Fierce. She has helped to launch magazines, websites and the original Sunday Styles section at the New York Times. She has an MBA and extensive experience in health, digital journalism, social media and business.

    An award-winning journalist and author, Yanick teaches journalism at Howard University.  She was also editor of Heart & Soul magazine under three owners. As founding editor of BET Weekend magazine, she helped to increase circulation  nearly 40 percent, from 800,000 to 1.3 million. In addition to the New York Times, she has also worked at the Atlanta Journal-Constitution and the Toledo Blade as well as Essence and Child magazines.

    Sheree Crute, Editor-in-Chief and Co-Founder

    A writer, editor and author who has dedicated her career exploring health, medicine and health care disparities, Sheree is involved in all aspects of the company. An award-winning journalist, she is responsible for guiding Fierce's editorial strategy, including investigative journalism projects, narrative and shorter articles, and social media strategy. She draws on her extensive experience in communications program management to grow the business. 

    She is one of the most highly regarded health journalists in the country. In addition to being a 2011 USC/Annenberg fellow, her work has appeared in Essence, AARP: The Magazine; Health, Better Homes & Gardens, Heart & Soul, Consumer Reports on Health and The Root.com. She has also directed a national health information service created to assist journalists in reporting on health disparities. 

    Why We're So Fiercely Motivated

    Once you realize the difference that your work can make, you want to do more. That is why Fierce is a mission fueled by social entrepreneurship. We started Fierce, because we’ve been inspired by the impact that we've had on women and their families through our decades of health journalism. 

    In meeting women through our travels and receiving notes of thanks (and even hugs), they’ve shared how we’ve inspired them to adopt healthy habits — whether it’s losing weight, improving nutritional habits, exercising more or making appointments with friends for breast exams. But they have also asked us to do more — to find new and creative ways to support their journey toward a healthier lifestyle. Fierce is our answer to that call. 

     We’ve worked out with some of these women. We’ve shared laughs as well as tears. And we’ve come clean about our own ups and downs — like giving in to potato chips and popcorn and an excuse to miss another workout.  

    Fierce is for black women by black women. Because we’re part of the audience. We intimately understand the challenges we all face from experiences we've had in our own lives and in our families. We know what works and what doesn’t. And we have the expertise to back it up with highly credible, compelling and accessible reporting on the most important medical research, health and social issues for our audience.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We understand if you can't afford to contribute; we appreciate your time and support. Here are other ways that you can help:

    • Pass the word about FierceforBlackWomen.com and our goals to your family and friends
    • Follow us on social media
    • Use the Indiegogo share tools to let people know about our crowd-funding campaign
    • Take good care of yourself, your family and your community!

    Thanks for being so Fierce!

She oversees business and  strategic development for Fierce. She has helped to launch magazines, websites and the original Sunday Styles section at the New York Times. She has an MBA and
extensive experience in health, digital journalism, social media and business.

An award-winning journalist and author, Yanick
teaches journalism at Howard University.  She was also editor of Heart & Soul magazine under three owners. As founding editor of BET Weekend magazine, she helped to increase circulation  nearly 40 percent, from
800,000 to 1.3 million. In addition to the New York Times, she has also worked at the Atlanta Journal-Constitution and the Toledo Blade as well as Essence and Child magazines.
Sheree Crute, Editor-in-Chief and Co-Founder
A writer, editor and author who has dedicated her career exploring health, medicine and health care disparities, Sheree is involved in all aspects of the company. An award-winning journalist, she is responsible for guiding Fierce's editorial strategy, including investigative journalism projects, narrative and
shorter articles, and social media strategy. She draws on her extensive experience in communications program management to grow the business. 

She is one of the most highly regarded health journalists in
the country. In addition to being a 2011 USC/Annenberg fellow, her work has appeared in Essence, AARP: The Magazine; Health,
Better Homes & Gardens, Heart & Soul, Consumer Reports on Health and The
Root.com. She has also directed a national health information service created to assist journalists in reporting on health disparities. 

Why We're So Fiercely Motivated
Once you realize the difference that your work can make, you want to do more. That is why Fierce is a mission fueled by social entrepreneurship. We started Fierce, because we’ve been inspired by the impact that we've had on women and their families through our decades of health journalism. 
In meeting women through our travels and receiving notes of thanks (and even hugs), they’ve shared how we’ve inspired them to adopt healthy habits — whether it’s losing weight, improving nutritional habits, exercising more or making appointments with friends for breast exams. But they have also asked us to do more — to find new and creative ways to support their journey toward a healthier lifestyle. Fierce is our answer to that call. 
 We’ve worked out with some of these women. We’ve shared laughs as well as tears. And we’ve come clean about our own ups and downs — like giving in to potato chips and popcorn and an excuse to miss another workout.  
Fierce is for black women by black women. Because we’re part of the audience. We intimately understand the challenges we all face from experiences we've had in our own lives and in our families. We know what works and what doesn’t. And we have the expertise to back it up with highly credible, compelling and accessible reporting on the most important medical research, health and social issues for our audience.
  Other Ways You Can Help We understand if you can't afford to contribute; we appreciate your time and support. Here are other ways that you can help: 
Pass the word about FierceforBlackWomen.com and our goals to your family and friends
Follow us on social media
Use the Indiegogo share tools to let people know about our crowd-funding campaign

Take good care of yourself, your family and your community! 
 Thanks for being so Fierce!

story:
Hi ,
Few months ago , I moved to Dubai to join my husband,
We got married last year and  expecting a baby, which feels great))

Since my pregnancy(23weeks)  I am at home and can't contribute to family finances anymore .
We decided not to buy a medical insurance, cause here in Dubai , insurance covers maternity only after 1 full year of subscription ((

Hospital birth cost starts from 2500$ to 3000$  for normal birth, and 5000$ -7000$ Cesarean (God forbid).

So, I decided to post a campaign to raise one third of minimum hospital cost.
If  happens ,will help our family significantly.
We don`t know the baby`s gender yet,
 I need your help to choose a name for our baby .  --------------------------->
                                                                                            --------------------------->
Thank you...                                                                                 --------------------------->

story:
1 in 4 women experience pregnancy or infant loss.


My name is Evonnie Fomento and I earned my certification to be a birth and bereavement doula through Still Birthday. SBD trains doulas to be able to support birth in any trimester and with any outcome. I support live births and angel births with the same amazing amount of support ❤️ Every birth is a birthday. I have spearheaded this campaign because I realize that the gift of time is the most precious thing that we can give to families experiencing the loss of a baby.


Nicole Dodson-Sands, a local loss doula certified through Loss Doulas International, and owner of Angel Care Loss Doula Services, has joined in this campaign. Nicole is a local loss mom who helps to support women who are experiencing the death of a child during pregnancy or shortly after- as well as those experiencing high-risk pregnancies.


"For those not familiar with the unit a CuddleCot is an in room cooling unit that is the size of a small humidifier disguised inside of a Moses basket. Research has proven having a unit available to parents while they are in the hospital encourages families to spend time with their baby. This gift of time allows precious hours for bonding, pictures, plaster molds to be taken and other family members to come and meet the baby before the natural changes that occur in death become more apparent. In addition the baby can now stay in the room with the family the entire hospital stay if the family so desires. While we know this might not be for everyone it does allow families a choice." (US Cuddle Cot Campaign Initiative Facebook)


We need to raise $3,750 to purchase one Cuddle Cot, from there it will be determined what hospital receives the Cuddle Cot as a donation. Any money beyond what is necessary for one Cuddle Cot will go back into supporting newly bereaved families and purchasing a second cuddle cot. 


Cuddle Cots are being used worldwide: 

  • England (UK)-  Over 90% of UK hospitals use CuddleCots. 
  • N. Ireland – CuddleCots™ in use extensively and donated by charities such as SANDS and through other local fund raisers (see Newry Times)
  • S. Ireland – Feileacain (Stillbirth and Neonatal Death Association of Ireland) are a proactive Irish charity and have provided CuddleCots™ to most hospitals in Southern Ireland (see pictures below)
  • Scotland – SIMBA have provided many CuddleCots™ to hospitals in Scotland
  • Canada – In early 2014 Tiny Hands of Hope provided a CuddleCot to QE2 hospital in Canada (view details) and the CuddleCot is also installed at the Lois Hole Hospital for Women (view details). The CuddleCot and CoverCool Mini will soon be in use at Canuck’s Place Children’s Hospice (view details)
  • Australia – A growing number of Australian hospitals are using the CuddleCot, many supplied by the charity Emirukus Land Foundation
http://flexmort.com/cuddle-cots/

Those who donate will receive various things to express our thanks. Some of these incentives include a personalized thank you letter from a bereaved parent and a Certificate of Appreciation from Precious Memories Doula, LLC. If we do reach our goal we will collect the money we have earned and launch another campaign to try to collect the remainder and develop other ideas to make enough money to raise the remainder of the funds. 


If you can't donate we understand but we would love if you could share and help promote this fundraiser so that we might be able to purchase this wonderful tool to help bereaved families.


“I think it would provide Bereaved Parents and their family members, additional time spent with their child, during those crucial yet tender moments following the child's passing. The LAST concern a family wants to be faced with is lack of time, due to the baby's bodies state over the course of time. I recall Taylor's leg peeling a little, it tore my heart and we did decide to allow the nurses to take him sooner than we would have liked. I am wondering if this would curb that?” ~ Savannah


The answer? Yes.

story:
On October 19th, I'll be running the Toronto marathon to raise funds for the Canadian Association of Williams Syndrome.

I've set a goal of $2,000 - can you help me get there?

Wait. What is Williams Syndrome?

You can ask that. I certainly did. I didn't know what it was either. Until June 2013.

That's when Alma Rae got her diagnosis. You see, she was born super early in December 2012 and spent almost a month in the NICU. My best friend Melanie (Alma's mom) knew something wasn't right beyond Alma being a tiny preemie. She wasn't eating, she slept ALL OF THE TIME and she just wasn't thriving.

Melanie was determined to get to root of what was going on with Alma. She went to doctors, grilled specialists and talked her way into Genetics at the Hospital for Sick Kids for testing. She wouldn't take no for an answer. Everyone (including me - sigh) told her that she was crazy. That Alma was fine, that she was just talking longer to catch up.

Then the tests came back and with it a diagnosis of Williams Syndrome. The journey then became what does this mean for the rest of Alma's life?

So what is Williams Syndrome?

Williams Syndrome is a rare genetic disorder. It's caused by an abnormality in chromosomes, and presents in approximately 1 in every 20,000 births. We have 35,000 genes in our brains and Williams Syndrome is a completely random deletion of 25 to 28 of these, resulting in some physical and intellectual disabilities but coupled with a mesmerizing affinity for music, startling verbal abilities, and extraordinary empathy. For instance, some kids are not able to tell left from right, but can sing beautifully in 30 languages. Being so rare, most people have never heard of Williams Syndrome. I sure hadn't.

Alma will be two years old in December and I need your help. Melanie has made it one of her life’s goals to spread awareness about Williams Syndrome so that no one ever asks “What is that?” ever again.

I really want to help her do this.

So. I can’t do much. But I can run. I have been training all summer to run the Toronto Scotiabank marathon on October 19, 2014. This little campaign is my way of raising funds for the Canadian Association of Williams Syndrome.

This Association is SO important to Williams Syndrome families and their loved ones. They organize an annual conference so that families can gather together and empower each other with education, support and friendship.

I got to help at this year’s conference held at Sick Kids in August, organized by, you guessed it, Melanie. It was probably the most rewarding day of the year for me and my daughter. Any funds I raise will be donated to help offset costs for the 2015 conference.

I've set a goal of $2,000  and I hope you can help me get there.

Watch this amazing video to learn more about Williams Syndrome:
https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?v=1020013826...

You can learn more about the Canadian Association for Williams Syndrome here:
http://caws.sasktelwebhosting.com/about.html

story:
Here is my story,

My name is Amy Simmons and I am 29 years old. I was born in Oct of 1982. I am from a small town in West Virginia called Cairo. It all started when i was 3 years old. I had my first grand-mal seizure at that age while i was taking a nap in pre-school. I went 2 years before I had my second one at the age of 5. After that I was seizure free for 8 years until the age of 13. When I had my third seizure and my worse one out of the three. But just as the same with the first two, I didnt have another one for 8 years to come. Until the age of 21 in Feb of 2004. I was told it was 4 in the morning when I let out a loud high pitch screech squeal. And I started having a grand-mal seizure that would change my life forever. Until that time the medicine I had been on had been controlling the seizures. But shortly after having that seizure I started having them on a daily basis. It wasn't and isn't always the grand-mal seizures I have, but all of them are critical in the damage that they do. I have had as many as 10 seizures in one day. The reason I say in the damage that they do is because, when I have them I stop breathing and if standing I lose my balance and fall. Meaning the lack of oxygen causes brain damage, which I have loss most of my memory because of having so many seizures. I can do something yesterday and not remember doing it the next day and sometimes not remember that day. My neurologist told me that he has nothing left that he can do for me, but if I quit having the seizure my memory might get better. But thats not the only damage that it has done I have now broken my nose twice from falling while having seizures. Also I have had to have staples and stitches twice this year. Not to mention the bruising not only on the body as well as on the face. And going out into public and people looking at me and my boyfriend like he beats me. Not knowing what the bruises is from. But is isn't just the physical toll it has on the body, but it has emotional also. Because now I am never by myself someone always has to be with me because they happen and I do not have time to prepare for them. So instead of going to bathroom and having privacy someone has to go with me. I can't go make me something to eat because of them. I am 29 and have to be watched like I am a small child. And then that doesn't always help because even with that I fell and had to get staples and stitches. Just them turning their head for a second it happened. Me and my boyfriend was in the kitchen cooking he turned his head to get a fork, and I had fallen and split my head. I had to get 6 staples and 3 stitches. Then 3 months later we got out car at my parents and he reached in the car to get the dog, and before he stood back up I had a seizure and fell. I had to get staples again that time for spliting my head on the asphalt. I want to have a family but with my condition I cannot have kids and be able to watch them. I would injure them if I was holding them and fell with them. So I am at the last resort that I know to do, and that is to ask for help from anyone who reads this. I cannot afford to see the specialist or the testing that needs to be done. Because of the seizures I cannot work cause of the fear of hurting myself or someone else. There is only 3 specialist in the field of doctor that I need to see on the east coast. One is in New York, another in Florida, and the 3rd in Michigan. Dr. Jacobs in New York is the closes to me, but is still a long trip for me to make. Any donation is helpful and will be greatly appreciated.

The Impact

I am disabled because of the seizures. My boyfriend works but with the money he makes it is just enough to pay the bills we have now. And no extra left over to try to get me to a doctor that is that far away or as costly as he is or the test that I will need. The seizures isn't only effecting my life but others also, because when he is at work my parents has to drive from 30 miles away to stay with me everyday. So they don't get to do the thing that they need to do, and the money it cost them to do this is money they need for things they need. But instead it is going for gas to come and watch me. Whatever money is raised will be used for me to go to see the dr., travel, lodging and testing that needs to be done.

What I Need and What You Get

10,000 dollars is alot of money but considering that it can save my life if he is able to stop the seizures. Because I will not be falling and I will not quit breathing cause I will not be having the seizures. And you will get to know that you help someone live their life and help cure them from an awful disability and hopefully have a family to share the life you saved with.

Other Ways To Help

Please send this to all your friends so that even if you cannot donate that someone else might be willing to help me can see this. And if you cannot donate then please remember me in your prayers and ask others to also. Any help will be appreciated.

story:
Once again we are asking for your help, love, and support. With the medical, and traveling expenses for Aroura over these past few months we are once again asking for your help to raise money so we may help pay for our accommodations while at Stanford. We have made arrangements to stay at the Ronald McDonald House at Stanford during Aroura’s initial inpatient care. Unfortunately they cannot guarantee our stay and will not have any space available for about 10 days after our admission date of November 26th. This leaves us having to come out of pocket at one of the local hotels that offer discounted rates for families who have children receiving care at the hospital. Even with the discounted rates Palo Alto is still an expensive city and the rooms at the cheapest run about 69 dollars a night plus tax which is more than we can afford for the amount of time we would need to stay there. We are asking for any amount that anyone could spare that would not cause any financial burden. We understand that since it is a holiday season not everyone will be able to help and we understand. Please just continue to keep us in your thoughts and prayers.

Aroura's story:

Our daughter Aroura is a 6 years old girly girl who loves her kitty her little brother and spending time with friends and family. Aroura had just completed the 1st grade at Golden Hills elementary school and just had her first dance recital with Tehachapi Dance Theater in June. Then on July 24th our family received some devastating news… Aroura was diagnosed with AML Leukemia (Acute Myeloblastic Leukemia), and given a 60% chance of cure. AML is a cancer of the bone marrow and the blood that progresses very quickly and has to be treated very aggressively. How could such a healthy and happy little girl be so sick? It has been so unreal for our family especially since AML is so rare among children; there are only about 500 cases a year nationwide of childhood AML. AML affects mostly cells that aren't fully developed and does not allow these cells to carry out their normal functions. Also most people diagnosed with AML have one of eight different kinds (subtypes) of AML. Unfortunately for Aroura she has a subtype that makes her high risk and almost guarantees her to relapse. Her subtype has now dropped her initial 60% chance of cure to a 20 or 30% chance. This means Aroura's best chance for recovery will have to be a bone marrow transplant. Aroura has already completed her first, second and third rounds of chemo therapy. After her first three rounds of chemo we are thankful to say she is in remission and can go to transplant as soon as a donor is found. We have recently met with the team of doctors at Stanford who will be preforming Aroura’s transplant and we have signed all the needed paperwork to move forward with her transplant using a cord blood donor. So now we are enjoying our time at home in between going to and from hospital appointments in Madera and Palo Alto which has just been final preparation to get her ready for transplant. Aroura will be admitted November 26th at Stanford to begin receiving Radiation and chemo therapy treatments in preparation for her transplant on December 5th. If all goes well Aroura’s treatment will take approximately 100 days from the date of transplant. So Aroura will stay inpatient at the hospital for 4-6 weeks then when she is well enough she will be released to the Ronald McDonald house at Stanford to stay the remainder of the 100 days while she is recovering and attending daily appointments for care at Stanford. Aroura will still has many obstacles to overcome and the more support the better. Thank you for wanting to know more about Aroura and for choosing to help and support our family. Please feel free to pass her story along. Please keep Aroura and our family in your thoughts and prayers.

 

Please check out our facebook page.

Facebook: Harry Polenychko

(Updates on Aroura and a lot of pictures of her journey)
